title: Rust

review: I have mixed reviews on Rust. It can be alot of fun with friends but not for a long time and having too many people with you can be a cluster . Let's get started1. LootingLooting in Rust isn't really a main part of the game yes there is looting but that doesn't happen much at the beginning of your life. The game is more about resource gathering and crafting. You spawn into the world completely naked bearing only a rock and torch. You can use your rock to hit trees nodes and barrels. You collect cloth and start to craft your first clothes and weapon/tool. However that's where it isn't fun with friends. You could spend a whole hour just trying to meet up with 1 buddy because of dying from the following reasons Starvation Dehydation Drowning Freezing Heating up and then proceeding to die of thirst Another player A wolf A bear A chicken A scientist and even Cacti! After finally meeting up with your friend survival begins.2. SurvivalSurvival in Rust can either be fun and moderately difficult or it can be a waste of time and insanely difficult to meet up with friends/ make a base. Going back to how you can die servers can have up to 500 players (give or take). This means that you have a good chance of crossing paths with another survivor. Now in other survival games you're chances of them being friendly is about a 50/50 (again give or take) however in Rust there is a 90% that they won't say a word to you and they will instantly attack you sending you back to square 1. This brings me to...3. Community ...Community! Oh boy the community in Rust is dare I say CANCEROUS. This game started as a decently friendly community you probably did have a 50/50 chance of making a friend. However just like a cancer cell the toxicity of this game spreaded like wildfire and today you have a good chance of someone running at you with a sword playing/making obnoxious sounds through their mic. Now if this sounds like your cup of tea you'll fit right in However it gets old quick and after dying constantly and spawing in naked again you'll end up giving up. I don't see a future where the community of Rust becomes friendly ever again.4. ShootingShooting in Rust is good. There is Spray Patterns Recoil Bullet Drop and Travel Time. But you probably won't get to the point of having guns unless you're an absolute professional time waster and you farm for it. That's all I have to say about shooting5. Closing UpNow Rust is not a bad game it gets frequent updates and I don't expect the game to be abandoned. The updates definitley add some good mechanics but it doesn't change the things I dislike about the game. Anyway you can make you're own decision about the game but that's just my thoughts.
title: Rust

review: Legacy Rust was and will always be the true version that was "Rust". This *new* thing they call "Rust" is not what the fans fell in love with. Oh sure you can switch to Legacy Rust but there's no support for it updates bug fixes anti cheats etc. It's now dominated by Russians and hackers. There aren't any fully functional/ populated English speaking servers to be able to play on the Legacy Rust even if they could solve the hacking problem. The original Rust (that was highly acclaimed) is no longer available and has been replaced with a completely different game. New Rust has completely different game mechanics graphics game play less features etc. It's a horrible flop that promises to be like the original version but it will never be the same game that got all those positive reviews and hours from us gamers. Buy it? What will you even do in game? At this point in time H1Z1 (a brand new clone of Rust) is much more exciting to play and H1Z1 itself is terribly boring. Stay away unless Rust becomes free to play! (WARNING Micro transactions are a planned feature for Rust)

review: I have waited for a long time to write this review why? because I didnt think it would be fair to judge a game that is in alpha. It was a rough start. The first couple builds where remarkably dull. I would get on play for a half an hour get my head bashed in by a rock and proceed to spam ALT F4. The game has since then become an uncut gem in my opinon. The UI is amazing and simple to well use and the bugs have for the most part went away. I only have three issues with this game. One grass is all over the goddamn place and the only way to turn it down is through the console (it's not a performance issue I just prefer less grass). Two lag is always present when it comes to PVP which is more than essential to fix in an online only game. And three I find it very hard to find wildlife I dont know if they just dont spawn or what but I might as well be looking for a tumbleweed to eat. To give my final opinion if Facepunch can cut this gem they're looking at my Game of the Year(s).

review: At first I got excited for Rust for it seemed it might be a more grown up verison of Minecraft with its harvest/research sandbox mechanics. I suppose it's my own fault for not taking the survival part seriously. Any attempts to avoid the kill or be killed mentality will bring you nothing but frustration. As mentioned by a number of other reviewers solo play is nigh impossible. I bounced from server to server trying to find a quiet corner to amass even the most basic of supplies to no avail. I found servers to run rampant with players decked out with superior equipment trolling on the coastlines where the noobs begin their journey. Were there a way to keep the PVP aspect a little more fair I maybe would have invested more time into the game.I think it's important to mention Rust has the most toxic gaming environments I've ever encountered. Players flame up at the drop of a hat chat is plagued with complainers swearing racial slurs you name it. Heaven forbid you ask a question to the community to help you find your way else you'll be made fun of for the next ten minutes. If you need an outlet for your poor sadistic soul you'll find it here. But if you're more along the lines of a casual gamer definitely walk away from this one.
title: Rust

review: Imagine It is Christmas Eve. There is snow on the ground and a shine in your eye. You work for hours and hours on the most perfect snowman. During the night a couple of people come and kick your snowman and smash it into the ground taking the scarf and throwing the buttons into the distance. You wake up the next morning and go to look at your snowman and it is gone. review: The thing with Rust is where you play it. You can play on anything from Vanilla servers to Modded servers. I personally prefer some of the modded servers. The game is what you make it you can play team style or solo. The degree of difficulty depends a great deal on the server. The game is still being developed and there are occasional set backs but I think the positive outweighs the negative in that regard. Competition and lifespan are variable also. Challenge yourself on a vanilla server or chill on one of the modded servers it's personal preference and how you play the game. I bought this game as an early release and I have logged a lot of fun hours playing it. There are so many fun aspects to Rust.

review: Played this game for a decently long time I loved it. The adrenaline pvp making bases everything seemed just so great about the gameThen they added loot tiers map.Ever since then you spawn in like 1 7 spawn points which basically are all near each other and you're meant to get away from there as fast as possible because you're going to get camped by the people that were lucky to get a bow early and basically spawn kill you and oh boy are people s in this game. Doesn't matter if you have a sash or not you're going to get chased across the map for that rock and torch of yours. Did you just pick up a hemp near a fresh spawn? Well too ing bad because now he's going to chase you across half the map just to try and kill you and ruin your start just because they can.Then comes the interaction with the community which is almost nonexistant past fresh spawns. If a guy has a bow you can bet he's gonna shoot your sweet for no reason other than to kill you and maybe take the you got IF you got any that is.To the people who played this game for a pretty long time now. How many people have you talked to who have a bow without them trying to kill you? Because 95% of the time they're gonna draw that and kill you and Im guessing you weren't even taking the chances of talking with them because you probably were already aiming at him with your bow or spear.Clans rule the game It's been like that for a while if you have no one to play the game with you're usually gonna have a time. Honestly early game problems come from the loot tier map and how you just don't spawn around the map anymore thus increasing in density of people in one place and like 20% of the people making out of there without getting attacked by a guy with a bow.In the end ill still play it because i enjoy the pvp and base building but these are the issues i seem to find the most troubling.
title: Rust

review: GENERAL OVERVIEW Learning how to build/craft gets headshot by a bolty. ACTUAL REVIEW After playing more than 555 hours on rust I can say that it is a good game (besides the screaming naked asians).It is driven by the community you chose how to play whether it be Playing in a clan roleplaying as a merchant or ransacking someone's shop. There is a lot to do. Sadly this has become a problem. The community has grown in toxicity making new players quit after a few hours of playing. Due to this it will slowly die. But YOU can change it. Whether it be giving metal tools to a newman or not griefing someone's wooden house you decide what happens. Don't make the wrong choice.P.S. Very gud gam mest bye!

review: Rust is a game that can inspire you with what you can do with just an Eoka pistol some bullets and a few friends. Its a very fun game to play with friends and thats why I love it but it can also be a cruel game at times. You work so hard to build your base and gather materials to raid other players and you return to your own base comepletely destroyed is the worst feeling in the world. This game is not for the faint hearted as it will constantly be throwing obstacles at you that you have to mentally endure. I would also say that this is the best survival game out on steam currently. It had weekly updates and they show what they are working on and you can also suggest to the devs what you want to see changed.

review: With Rust you gotta be smart. Smart base planning.You have to plan every step you take and base everything around other player's actions.Walk the long way to avoid getting wrecked? Do it. Wait till a player is offline to raid them? Do it.The only thing you shouldn't do is get asshurt when you get raided and have to start from scratch just like you've left another player. It's just the cycle of Rust.Pros Nice weaponsNice crafting system.Nice building systemNice resource system (a bit grindy but eh)Cons Not enough animals. I find myself running around for ages to find 1 measly pig and have to wait to find another 2 just to build a furnace.The monuments need textures.More enemies. Bring back zombies and have them infest the monuments for a little more dangerFix the animal AI it's horrible they run in circles on mountains and get stuck in rocksNeeds more irradiation i mean this game appears to be post nuclear war so where's me rads?Yes i know this game's in Beta but it has been for 2 years and needs fixing.But I love the way it turns everybody into survival mode. The adrenaline rush is real when you see another player with weapons or players raiding another base or even attacking you. It's hard but it's so much fun. 8/10

review: I like this game I've had it since legacy and i see it only improving but I would like to suggest some ideas to the developers (since I don't know where to post ideas to developers)1.Reduce the amount of time to actually use healing items (The bandage and the and Medical Syringe (cant tell you how many times I injected myself but still went down after a gunfight)) or stop the bleeding effects when applying medical items or just do away with the bleeding effects entirely (but this one is a stretch)2.Focus on horses instead of cars since most rust maps are mainly nature focused (if that makes sense) and the maps roads are only a small percentage of the map.3.Shields or some type of blocking methods to counteract melee attacks and archers (if shields are implemented) and to have better melee focused battles 4. (Controversial Opinion) Get rid of the twig system that allows people to build all the way to the top of the base and raid easily from there raiding should be challenging not a walk in a park where people can easily be offline raided. (and to some extend getting rid of ladders) Also this system makes walls next to usless limiting it to be more of a honeycomb.5.Make the food and water meter last a bit longer its somewhat of an annoyance at this point.6.Continuing on the shields I would structure it to having it on your back would protect your back only and not your head. When you equip your shield it should have three stances one where it protects your body (base stance) one where you hold right click to cover your head but somewhat reveal your body and the third stance which is when you crouch and hold right click for ultimate frontal protection but it leaves you slow and vulnerable to flanks and with these stances you should be able to hold a one handed melee and a spear for throwing and melee but no guns. There should also be catagories with light medium heavy and super heavy where small medium and heavy block arrows and give reduced damage to gunfire and while the catagories go up the shield gets slightly bigger and the durablility increases and the damage to gunfire is slighty reduced as you get higher and in these 3 catagories you can equip a melee weapon but for the super heavy shield you can't equip weapons but its bulletproof and it covers your entire view so you will need a buddy to point you in the right direction and its durability goes down as it gets shot up. Moving on to melee combat with shields it should be a timed block where if you block correctly you receive no damage and the fight continues until you dont block correctly your character should receive a staggering affect leaving you vulnerable giving your opponent a hit on you and the fight continues until one dies. That just leaves us with two handed weapons which should get the ability to block but the person wielding it should focus on dodging and the two handed weapon will be an anti shield weapon meaning it has an easier time breaking shields and the stagger affect is much greater if the shield person does not block properly.

review: FOR LATEST REVIEW SEE THE BOTTOM OF THE REVIEW.This game although is in Alpha as clearly stated is very playable and is great fun!Choose from over 5000 servers mostly UK and German servers and build and raid other bases.Make new friends and team up to suvive or brave it alone and shoot on sight.You get all kinds of people on Rust which is what makes the game so brilliant! The constant fear but also peacefulness of the surroundings.Updates for this game are regular and the devs are contantly trying to improve the game. I bought this game instead of buying DayZ because 1) it was cheaper2) didn't require a super computer to run3) and for the ability to build in an open world game all kinds of stuff from huge bases to a camp fire.Edit After 176 hours of playing this game it has changed very much to when I first reviwed this game. All of the above still is relevent. The requirements have maybe increased a little but I am still running it. The game is visually stunning! I have teamed up with many people on this game I have also killed many people and most of all be killed many time.Most of the time this game is a shoot on sight but depending on the server you join that can really change and people will help you and will let you live with them in the game. I have even been on a server where a group of 6 people controlled a rather large section of the map.9/10 because it's still Alpha and there are still things not complete but that is expected.Edit 2 30/05/2015This game is now uninstalled and now to most likely never be played again. This is because of a few reasons 1)Optimisation is complete rubbish and even if you have a great computer it will most likely run crap.2) Hackers ruin everything and has been something that the devs have done nothing about it seems.3) Spend hours of your life playing this and its wasted its a hitting stones simulator after a few hours of this game you will be killed 100 times starve 100 times but not achieve anything because everyone tom and harry are chasing after you. It's NOT WORTH A BUY! I bought this when it was 11 I'm glad I haven't been too ripped off but still ripped off.EDIT 10/05/2017 Still useless with poor optimisation and the devs just killed the game by bugging it out. GG.

review: First things first Rust is not a survival game persay... It is a game about surviving in on island with no social contract. This game is the closest thing to a political vacuum that any of us will ever experience. This game brings out the caveman in us all the mistrust the fear the covetousness the vengefulness the connivingness and so much more that you never knew existed in yourself. There are brief glimpses of modern courtesy and humanity but they are vastly outweighed by the uncaring crushing force of our base nature. Rust gets one thing very right about survival Nature doesn't care if you live or die. Unfortunately there is only one real way to die in Rust which is what makes it different than the ideal survival game. Nature is mostly forgiving in this game there will always be mushrooms clean water cloth and firewood over the next hill. Human nature is the real killer you will die thousands of deaths by the hands of the cruel the fearful the determined and the jealous. Surviving is uncomplicated if you know how to avoid other players which any lone wolf player can confirm. There real challenge comes when you decide to look for FUN. Player interaction is inevitable the game will not force you into it but you will force yourself into it. After half an hour of gathering materials you will hear a gunshot or see a distant figure and you will be filled with an irresistable curiousity. If you steel yourself against it and slink back home the world will pass you by. You have everything to lose by avoiding your fellow man. That distant figure may be a potential ally a roleplayer who can entertain you for hours or a dying man whose misfortune will become your livelihood. It could be a hardened no lifer whose zerg clan will descend on your like biblical plagues. As you approach this figure your hands will tremble and your mind will be filled with self doubt and terror. The firearm you cling to holds your future in its chamber. Each missed bullet is another piece of your past and future that you throw away. But maybe you will not miss today or maybe you will not need to shoot. As you step out from your hiding place weapon raised your target turns to face you. Their face is filled with surprise and they cry out "No wait I'm friendly! Please don't I'm looking for a friend." Are they lying? Are they trying to protect valuable goods? Are there hidden cries for the aid of unseen companions behind their pleas for mercy? How long do you have until some other vulture descends on this feast? Is this what you've become a vulture? This is where your story will truly begin. And believe me when I say that there will be stories. There will be tragedies that fill you with self hatred and shame. There will be comedies where new friends are made and many laughs are had. There will be epics where you defy the odds even just for a minute before the island crushes you into nothingness. You will have to make your fun. You will have to endure the slow grinding parts to make it to the climax. After every wipe you will have to ask yourself how much have I given and how much more am I willing to give? In my case my answer to the first question is that I've given over 500 hours since I first purchased this game in early access in 2013. I cannot answer the second question.LONG LIVE THE NAKAMAT TRIBE. DEATH TO THE TOWER PEOPLE.

review: I usually don't write reviews but for this one I will. Sure people are gonna hate this game with a passion thats how every game is. Without bad reviews it's hard for the game to grow and develop. Now I'm not saying this is the greatest game ever but it is the top game in my library even though i do not play it as often as I use too. I am wating until something BIG happens to the game so I can play this more often. It's just very slow as of right now and I've done it all and have had my fun. Eventully I'll come play this game 24/7 again. Alll games have toxic communities and when people complain about them with over 500 hours on the game I laugh. Don't write a bad review if you have more hours then me sure you may have liked the old rust but that does not mean this is the only game you are able to play. New games are made everyday. An opition can be found on the settings called "Hide Chat" or "Mute" please use them it will make the experience much more fun. Good luck and happy Rusting.

review: Rust is by far the most impressive early access/alpha build games I've ever bought. Just the fact that it's alpha but the lighting is magnificent and there are so many features that seem so fluid already. I spent my whole afternoon playing this with friends and in that time I'd found my friend we then killed zombies for blue prints and looted the nearby radtown constantly building up a nice supply of items we made an alliance with two friendly players whom helped us out immensely we met up with another 2 friends and then we started making out base. It's funny though we ended up with the best weapons we could get surplus ammunition decent clothing and a whole host of weapon addons but we we're still defeated by zombies when we went on an expedition. This game is really about survival no matter what you have you can still be as easily killed as the next guy over. The periodic supply drops are interesting hearying the plane go overhead watching the cannisters parachute to the ground and then running in that direction hoping to find them before any other players though it can be quite frustrating when they land on mountains that have no way of climbing.If you have a bunch of friends to play this with I would highly recommend buying Rust sure it's fun solo but it's worth it to play with friends and to co ordinate and build large fortress like bases. The upcoming features are really going to make this game stand out from all the other survival games on the market.

review: It's the most polished multiplayer survival game out there. Servers are around 250 players and this game is EXTREMELY PVP based. Everything you do is to defend yourself reinforce your base to protect from attackers or attack other bases yourself. The amount of adrenaline rushes this game causes is insane. Encountering another player whilest running back to your base in the middle of daylight with a full inventory really does get your heart pumping fast.This game is a full time job. If you want to play it be prepared to play for 6 hours straight twice a day.

review: Not too sure what's up with lots of people posting that this game keeps getting worse and worse..I have only been playing for about a year and a half or so but am always happy with the new updates. I personally feel like the game keeps getting better and am glad that the developers are constantly adding on to the game. I definitely agree that a lot of people can be toxic in the Rust community but I have also made plenty of friends on Rust. I think it all comes down to finding the right server. There are plenty of servers to choose from if you are just looking for a PVE experience or a PVP experience. At times I can get bored and not play for awhile but I always end up coming back for more. Definitely an awesome game to play with a bunch of friends.

F*** off Rust.

review: Originally I recommended this game under the condition that you be prepared for what is one of the worst communities of any game you'll ever play with. Of course it wasn't always this bad. In the glory days of rust you were only killed on sight by maybe 4 out of 10 people. That was manageable and it didn't destroy the experience of a game that relies so heavily on the people you play with. But as more and more people come to this game due to it's increasing popularity despite the fact you have zero loot you'll find yourself being KOS'd pretty much 100% of the time usually by some 14 year old who manages to squeak out "f ggot" before you bleed out.This means that the only instance in which you can survive the grind to a point where you can defend yourself is on a freshly wiped server where everyone else starts on an even playing field. You can forget joining servers that were wiped the day before as a single day is plenty of time for players to get semis and AK's.The more I play this game the more I realise this isn't something I can recommend to new/solo players. You may get lucky and find a random group that would take you in but the gameplay experience shouldn't rely on luck to be fun. It really is a shame too because the core gameplay is so well designed compared to other survival games like ARK. Your only chance is to search the forums and discords for a group of players looking for more people. Other than that you're out of luck.

review: This game was incredibly awesome when I first started playing a few years ago. Everything was new survival was extremely challenging and although there were some jerks out there overall the community was just as noob as I was and for the most part we worked together. The game has progressed well due in large part to the great development team. They keep the community updated with darn near every change they make and drop hints as to what lies ahead. With that team I have no complaints.However the community has become extremely toxic and KOS (kill on site) has become the norm not the exception. Fully geared mobs roam the island a day or two after wipe day and do all they can to make life a living hell for newly spawned nakeds. There is almost no cooperation on either sponsored or community servers except for real life friends that you dragged into the game to join in your misery. Then just as you finally get a base up and a perhaps get a gun it's wipe day and you have to start the whole process over. If you get really good and you have a skilled group you can rise to the challenge and compete with the other mobs. But whether you win or lose there will be massive amounts of cussing and cursing in chat and over in game audio. Toxic.Finally I saved the best for last. This is ultimately why I gave the game a negative review. Not because of the toxic community. Not because of the endless cycle of scavenge build die repeat. But because of the terrible ban system. I have zero count em ZERO cheats hacks modifiers etc. on my machine. I have put in 415 hours of clean playing into this game. And suddenly with no warning I am "gamebanned" and can never play online again. WTF? Once again I have never had any modifiers on my machine for this game. To make matters worse there is no recourse. Valve gives the power to ban solely on the developer and then wipes their hands of it. Yes Easy Anti Cheat are the idiots who banned a clean player but I paid Valve for the game. Ultimately it is their responsibility to ensure that the developer does not abuse this right. And clearly EAC doesn't know what they're doing. When searching for a way to contest the ban all I could find from EAC is that all bans are final and that there is NO inquiry system. So when they screw up and ban someone unnecessarily (which happens all the time just Google their track record... it's horrendous) there is no way to enjoy the game from there on out. And they never tell you why because "then the cheat developers would know". I'm sure those guys know very quickly either way. So at the severe cost of customer service EAC chooses to ban and run. Cowards.
title: Rust

review: I bought it a few years back and it was a fun game fairly challeging with the usual here and there. Fast forward to today. The dev team is still pretty great however I feel they try to micromanage somethings a little too much like with the roof exploit which gave smaller groups/solos a better chance against large clans that rule servers. The community has become straight unless you're a popular youtuber or one of the high and mighty of the server aka a member of the giant zerg clan that destroys everything. Your experience now is pretty much getting shot at by anyone mauled by most animals and spending your entire time grinding to pop down a base only to get mowed over by the first guy to pop up with a crappy gun. The games concept and dev team are solid 10/10 the community however has taken something great and made it unplayable.

review: i purchased Rust in the summer of 2013.the first day i played it about 4 hours in i had made myself a little 2 square house. had a fire a furnace and was doing alright though i hadnt seen another player yet. little did i know i built my base right at the bottom of a place called Hangar. on some night in the game i was crafting myself a revolver and heard a knock at the door or rather... a ticking. i was then very welcomes to two small explosions blowing down my door and gunfire coming through.i rage quitfast foward a year the summer of 2014i had gained some hours now. i played on a friends server i got to enjoy the luxxuries of making armor guns and being on the other side of the explosion. howver i havnt been on many "raids" more like demolishing empy bases and shooting some sleepers. much of the time i spend was on quiet pve servers or low populations that got along well. untill i came to a place called Smiley Town. the first thing i did was open chat and say "anyone wana team up" to which some replied "yes and i have a friend too" we met up just south of the tankers and made some small bases each of us our own little houses and then a fourth "community" building. we opened it for trade and such with the other locals. by the next weekend there were no longer 3 of us there were 6 everyone had assembled towering wood structures and the community building had turned from a happy open walled trace centre into a fortified metal prison for holding loot and players alike. the villaged was surrounded by wood and spike fencing and camfires were kept atop watch towers. we became that of a server police for there was an unspoken policy not to kill on sight and it was kept by the word and actions of other players. fights at first were a shot here and there then a stern talking to eventualy evolving into groups and clans that shoot and attempt to controll such areas fights began lasting hours long days in game so long as both sides could produce enough ammo.lets move another month aheadone of our men is now a mod on the server we had added several people to our group the core of wich being the original 6 then 4 that had houses inside our ould village and 5 with housing elsewhere on the map. the group became known as "admin village" though we did not pick that title ourselves. the fencing had gone from one to two then now 5 layers of large spike fences surrounding the entire metal vally and watch towers within resource hole which now was known on the server as admania. roles had changed those who protected people and chased after pvp thirsty are now out raiding and looting and eventually just leveling bases for no reason.... we started going through 300 c4 a night 1500 on weekends alone. pretty easy when there is now 20 people dedicated to farming alone. only about half way through the month another clan with about the same numbers had started to rise and at first we held a tenative peace. pranks were pulled snipers hitting out the front doors of eachothers base but there was never a raid during that wipe.month 3 of Smiley Townour mod friend is now the server owner and many others are now moderatorsadmania had renamed itself to the Iroquois and we dropped many of the players from our group to keep from otheres thinking admins abused their powers when we just played like everyone else. we and our rival faction now stood in a cold war many of the leaders friends well enough to play with eachother but on different servers. communication was scarce on smiley town between the big two. the atmosphere that was before welcoming and enjoyable for big clans and solo players was now bitter and enyone caught in the cross fire was in danger. secondary bases between the two were raided regularly though there was no way to be sure who did it it was usualy well assumed since 80% of the explosives belonged to 10% of the population. the iroquois wanted to make a base that could tower over their rivals something to remind everyone on the server who has been the biggest for the longest. the admins agreed to remove any foundations that we needed to build so long as it was by the players choice. so after finding a location large and flat enough i had walked through the houses and talked to players living there offering them new housing inside the larger iroquois base or full compensation of the materials into their current base or we demolish it with c4. Bandit Castle was created soon after http //steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id 300614054after the last server wipe in august of 14 the seerver population had diminished everyone hated eachother and the owner was fed up with all of the crap others gave him.Smiley Town died.you cannot play this version of Rust on steam anymore. and you cannot find people who will make you wish every week that you could go back to when times were simpler and there was only one row of spiked fences.
title: Rust

(something which apparently is a known issue but then why is the game is still being sold for Mac?)"Some things work some things don't." main menu works game doesn't.Even with this major drawback I still think it is a great concept and will wait to see a working version before reviewing the game.Update It's now been 2 weeks since I purchased the "game" and I am still uanble to log in. Logged 2 hours of playtime time wasted attempting to get passed the "waiting for Charcter" bit. So far no changes and it's starting to look like I've wasted my money on this title. NOT RECOMMENDED FOR MAC USERS!

review: Having spent a fair bit of time watching the forums I'd say the dev clearly cares very little whether or not people are enjoying the game. That or they kowtow to the vocal minority of old time players whose idea of a fun game is very different from the majority's.Due to this the game only gets new people during sales and hemmorrhages them between sales http //steamcharts.com/app/252490My personal peeve with the game is the stubborn refusal to allow character customization not even if it's only available once at the start. The reasons given are many and varied and not one of them holds water versus the vast majority of users being entirely for it. From what I see it's a matter of being too lazy to create an interface for it and/or some misguided SJW agenda about forcing everyone to live in racial harmony which clearly doesn't happen even without customization.I'd just say don't do it. I know it's only 20 bucks even when it's not on sale but there are cheaper ways to bang your head against a brick wall.

review: I had this game for a while but didn't play it much because of how hard entry is to new players. After coming back with some friends (everything is funner with friends!) I have found the game to be much more enjoyable. I have to commend the devolpers for updating this game and listening to feed back. It is of my opinion that they should stop listening to reddit though. Rust is intense and fun where the stakes are high. There are numerous obstacles in the way of players such as radiation hunger thirst and wildlife. Those are nothing to other players who can and WILL gut you like a fish for just being in there territory. Eventually this game will get a proper release I'm sure but it still is trying to figure out what kind of game it is.

review: The creators actively update the game adding new content and polishing the systems. One thing that I was glad to notice is that the game mechanics incentives playing in a less toxic way there is no achievements for killing players (it will still be necessary some times) but usually is much better to trade with them. Upkeep mechanics make the clans work harder to keep their bases and the new damage output on the missiles and C4 make raiding a lot more difficult for them. You can counter clans with traps more easily. Im a solo player and I have been able to play wipe to wipe with a big size base no problem. And even survive 4 raid attempts from clans. Also the skins are really great and Im glad to spend money on them each week.

review: This game is a survival and resource collecting with a hint of pvp danger type of game. Since its in Alpha there is no tutorial which I think is the biggest flaw and 2nd is when you log off and log back in all your stuff on your person disappears. Now you can prevent this by putting them in a container. You are limited on what you can craft which is enough to survive but not enough to get that shotgun to murder all those innocent zombie guys. You have to either A) Find a blue print that lets you learn how to build it or B) Find a shotgun that you loot and kill zombies to you get a research kit which allows you to make the object that you already possess. That feature is really handy cause the next time you log in you might not have that shotgun. For me this game satisfied something minecraft or DayZ(not including alpha version you can buy) or nether could not.

review: This game is brutally based on the concept of survival.Over the course of its development the devs have allowed modding to stay in the game as long as it is restricted to certain servers. Thankfully the devs listen to what we as players have to say about the game.The game play itself is unlike many I have ever seen survival is hard enough as i had to run around desperately looking for food while starving but i couldn't find any as all the supermarkets in the area were looted. There were no animals in the area to kill and for the first time in a while I found myself battling a concept in a video game I never thought i would have problems with. Typically there are 3 different types of enemy you can encounter who can and will attempt to kill you.1. Players The community is known for its toxicity that shows in the form of racism sexism and otherwise homophobic comments. Due to this games extremely toxic community you should avoid trusting other players with well anything. After someone as decided they want to kill you they will unlikely stop chasing you until you are dead e.g. I had just spawned and I found myself being chased by a naked with a rock who would smack me every time he got the chance. Eventually he gave up and ran off. Sadly the more geared players will often kill fresh spawns for no apparent reason so avoiding contact with further developed players is recommended. 2. Animals Annoyingly somewhere about maybe a year or two ago animals could glitch through walls/foundations and begin attcking you inside your own base. Around that time they were also even more unforgiving than the players and their AI would not stop targeting you until you were dead or moved out of their aggro range. This is sadly nearly improssible to do as most animals are either faster or just as fast as you are. Some advice to newer players is that after you kill a wolf you should not crush its skull for bones as it can be used to craft pretty much the best "primitive" helmet the wolf headress.3. Military. There are four military enemies including the scientist the helicopter the chinook and bradley the apc. All of these npcs are hostile but are difficult to defeat with the exception of the scientist. THe heli is an npc that has long been in the game which patrols the entire map before dissapearig and respawning later. It targets players with armour or gunpowder weapons/guns. The chinook is also a helicopter however after a certain time of patrolling an area and gunning down players (including nakeds) it drops a form of airdrop which typically has better loot than a normal airdrop an its location is marked on the map for everyone to see. The scientist is an npc that can be found roaming the military tunnels or nearby junk piles. They are armed with guns and shoot once you are within aggro range. They usually have mid tier loot on them such as med syringes. Bradley is an apc tank and like the scientist and chinook will shoot regardless of whether or not the player in question is geared or not. They spawn only in launch site and are armed with a primary and secondary weapon that either fires tank shells or guns you down with a turret.

title: Rust

review: I have 575 hours logged into Rust as of now.This game was in development for over 3 years and every two weeks for every single month with only a handful of breaks in between they updated and added new stuff. They never ever gave up on the game and even included Community updates and reached out to fans to promote fan art and content creators. They listened to the community and made changes and tried new things in the end they succeeded. I have played every iteration of Rust from the VERY VERY early to the zombies rad animals and the new version which premiered as vast empty fields where you ran around with only a bolt action rifle without being able to aim down sights firing bullets that arked like tennis balls and glowed like star wars lasers.While I guess the final version of the Legacy Rust is going to be something people talk about in reviews I say this is the better version. Legacy is forever burned into my memory. I spent countless hours playing it with a friend who passed away before the new version came to be so I understand the memories and quirky charm it had. But aside from that it lacked content and it lacked more refined mechanics.Garry Newman wanted to create a successor to Day Z after he was frustrated by the lack of updates the game had and wound up redefining the survival genera. What started as a zombie game turned into a brutal social sandbox where some of the most complicated interactions I have ever had with other users in a video game occurred. Factions wars rivalries pranks trolling and even acts of kindness carry weight behind them that few if any game has ever captured before.In a weird way you almost learn about human behavior where 0 accountability and high stakes pushes some people into becoming monsters. How massive groups of people faction together form alliances break them and in some cases resulting in civil wars. The randomly generated terrain are nice but what really gets me are the buildings. You can come across bases some that rival small cites completely abandoned with an odd player building a small fort inside of it. I have found fully realized towns with signs layouts and even a giant shrine. It was abandoned and had walls missing from rockets it felt eerie to wonder what had happened and why. Exploring the decaying remains of a these once impregnatable fortress always feel fresh and interesting like exploring an abandoned ship hoping to find some treasure inside.This game is not for everyone. It is harsh brutal and unpredictable like nature. No other survival game captures the feeling of raw nature like rust where each experience or encounter can lead to unforgettable stories.
title: Rust

review: In short no end game repetitive gameplay you need to commit to gaming daily npcs are too easy solo trios are penalized by not being in a big enough group zerg focused gameplay updates never fixed player concerns and they hardly got addressed overall stale game after one or two wipes not worth the $30+ pricetag it has i got it on special for $10 atleast I got my moneys worth before the game took a nosediveGame was decent before now it penalizes you if you cannot commit to gaming daily. Back then you could join a server late and still be able to compete with other players now you start out handicaped and have to grind an insane amount to even compete. It seems that update after update the developers want to emphasize that you need to be in a zerg inorder to have a chance in the game as progression in a zerg is way too quick example zerg can get end game items day one while a solo trio can't get all end game items by next wipe unless you join a montly wipe server which tend to be empty because zergs end up being too powerful and snowball. Biggest issue of game is there really is no end game and game gets too repetitive after your second or third wipe. Needs more npcs that make the game harder for both heavily geared players and beginers. After you get above bow phase the animal npcs are no threat the other npcs aren't that good either as you can easily dodge the tank and the helicopter won't attack you if you unequip items there is no real difficulty in this game from the environment. Just stale gameplay. Even pve servers for people who like the roleplaying aspect of the game is way too boring as the wildlife isn't challenging.

review: Rust is an AMAZING game and if you have a really good PC then I highly recommend you purchase it. It is one of the best 3D multiplayer survival games. There are a lot of items you can play around with and you can design your own base however you want. The graphics are clear and crisp and the combat is intense. You can see the bright tracers light people up in the air. The gun sounds are realistic and loud. They are also balanced in recoil damage and range. A problem with the game is that on a lot of servers there are huge clans that I call "Server Monopolies" which basically dominate the server by taking over smaller groups and individual's. It is easy to get raided by them and you would have to be online a lot to keep track of your base. Other than that Rust is a great highly competitive game and I recommend you play with friends in a group because it is hard to survive solo on large servers.

review: Rust...Rust is a mean game! If you like to give up easily this game isn't for you. If you don't want to grind and whine about having to do it this game isn't for you. If you suck at PvP and don't want to try to get better this game isn't for you.I wanted to give up my first week playing it. But I also mostly play solo.. which makes this game way more difficult and at times annoying. But in that challenge is what makes Rust a great game. When you succeed and make good progress Rust gives a very rewarding feeling of accomplishment. So I stuck with it. Everybody has their favorite aspects of the game. Personally I like base building and grinding for better BP's. The PvP is awesome even though I suck at it. It's a struggle.. which if this world was a reality it would be just as it is. You'd have good people (friendly) and your bad people (toxic..KOS) It is what it is. To find the balance you want you have to find the right server to play on. I have almost 1000 hours on record and I'm still not ready for large official servers. I don't blame the game. It's mostly because I don't have many Steam friends to join up and tackle the game. You will not make it long playing solo on a busy server. If you're new start out on a slow server. It will be easier to learn the grind build a base you prefer and have an easier time earning higher tier BP's. Eventually this will get boring as you will want to see more action. From there you just need to give it a try. If you have a good group of Steam friends that will enjoy playing with you then it will be even more enjoyable. Yes there are toxic players and clans that will make your life a living hell. But it is what it is. It's meant to be a gritty survival game. But again there are servers with admins that try to control the experience so it's enjoyable for all who play. You just have to sift through them. Most important you need to join during fresh wipes. If you join a server that hasn't been wiped for a while it is just going to be an uphill battle. But if you stick with it you'll find a server with a good group of MATURE people that offer challenge but don't aim to just be a D**k and keep killing you. Overall..Great graphics. I play on "good" setting and it still runs and looks amazing.Gameplay mechanics and physics are excellent. Not perfect but better than a lot of other games I've played. If you enjoy base building and foritfying this game is excellent for that.and the overall experience depends on your attitude and the server you play on. There are well balanced servers that allow the game to be enjoyable you just have to find the one that gives you the balance you're looking for. It is certainly challenging and if you embrace that and don't whine about it then Rust is the game for you!The only things I would change is tweak the sulfur to GP cost by 25%. And raise the % of finding higher tier weopons. It's hard enough to get them but then you need to research them. I don't think this will hurt gameplay but up the fairness for newer players to secure better weapons to defend themselves. Especially if they're joing later in a wiped server.9.5/10

review: Rust is a great game with very active developers constantly working on the game and delivering monthly updates keeps the game alive and fun. If you're scrolling through the negative posts please keep in mind about the hours some of these people have. Some of them are mad because they got killed by a screaming naked man or night is too dark. This game is rough for solo but there's an active solo server (CNDBlood's server) that has a lasting population if you're looking to play solo. Expect to die and lose your stuff in Rust no matter what server you are in. People are ruthless here and that's just the way it is. If the night is took dark use a flash light or a torch which you get free when you spawn in. Great game if you can't handle dying and taking losses then this game is not for you.

review: Rust is A fun game when you sit down with your friends and have a good time there are many things to do in rust from hitting trees to killing naked people who just woke up. While rust is a good game and it excels where many other survival games have failed such as good graphics monthly promising updates and a excelent dev team at the ready it also has alot of flaws and somewhat feels not ready. The Game is good dont get me wrong i still enjoy and play this game but its current updates have been turning me off from playing. It is almost impossible to play as a solo player now its been said multiple times and im saying it now rust with friends is rust without friends rust is not playable in its current state your better off becoming a pvp legend with no base. in the most recent update where player bodies float i dont know if it is a servers issue or not but stuff doesnt float when it should boats are a good step in the direction of rust but theyre so uncontrolable its terrible. A.I driven players (scientists) are a good idea but in their current form no road or powerline is safe from anyone as they will shoot theire pistol like an ak and have the accuracy of a hacker. chinook event is cool and helps alot of new players catch up but at the moment ive seen bradley kill the chinook 5 times leaving the crate up for anyone who can go in begin the hack and hide under the rocket for 15 minutes. the decay whilest it has been nerfed is still too high for these big bases the biggest base probobly houses 500 chests and is easily broken into. tool cupboard still has a very low amount of slots that you can put stuff into. and its starting to become a one base beats all scenario. now i love this game i really do but i feel like the game shouldnt have been rushed out of EA along with other titles such as subnautica which in itself should also be looked at before purchase.

review: The fun of this game depends on the kind of server you find. You can go from the most toxic kill on sight no chance to farm hellscape that forces you mute voice chat to a zombie apocolypse server where strangers running by rescue you from certain death and throw you some meat and a pickaxe before they're back on their merry way to stock their RP weapon shop. Best played with friends for raids and base building although you can go solo on the right server (with fewer people milling about looking to oneshot strays). With the right friends it can be fun to be killed gathering wood or have your stolen from strangers because of the ridiculousness of it. You can plot revenge raids and create trap bases that force players to off themselves to get free. Be creative for maximum fun.However I got tired of the obligatory server resets erasing all of my work and having to start from zero constantly. It was nice to start fresh for awhile because it put everyone including the decked out players/teams back on even playing field but that doesn't last long. Eventually I was just over mining for stone and metal frags just to strengthen my base to protect more stone and metal frags inside my base.After awhile the game just never offered anything more than mindless farming and anxious visits to common loot areas trying to avoid getting killed while you have 250 scrap in your pack. Still worth playing for awhile. Try different servers don't trust anyone and save your scrap.

review: First point Have a *LOT* of RAM. What was sold under the moniker "gaming PC" during the Christmas 2017 sales season isn't going to cut it without upping that 8GB so many sold with to 16 or 32 GB.Second point Have an SSD or M.2 drive. Your avatar goes to sleep in place when you get cut off or something crashes. You want to be reconnected and reloaded as fast as possible or you'll find yourself looted or dead before you can get back in if you're waiting on data from spinning rust.If you're playing with a few friends or are in a clan Rust is great. If you're new to Rust it's an exercise in repeated death and frustration. Find a PVE server (though griefers are still a thing for some forms of PVE) or a "newb" server and solo becomes tolerable possibly enjoyable. Running your own server is also an option. There are plenty of mods available for the community.

review: I couldn't think of what to say that hasn't already been said so here's a poem depicting my time on Rust We team up or go solo we gather some stuff build our base hoping it's safe and not hollow.We hit barrels my god how we hit barrels naked people with guitars singing christmas carols.We can be serious but also immature a blast with friends but time consuming that's for sure.We always come back to Rust promise ourselves we won't sometimes a break from rust becomes a must.We gain some stuff we lose some stuff in the end I had enough. A continuous cycle of raiding towns fighting clowns probably still worth the 15 pounds.I enjoyed it for the most part it will always hold a special place in my heart but for now Rust and I must part.If you have a lot of spare time I recommend this game but for me it's a shame I don't have the time to play the game.It's not a bad game it's not a great game it's just a game that will cause you endless amounts of pain and possibly make you go insane.But that's Rust That's Rust. Don't get salty when you get raided or shot don't get angry if you die from being too cold or too hot not every headshot is someone cheating with a bot!Enjoy the game don't be a pain can we try and treat each other the same? Just play the game give it a try! But when I headshot you try not to cry.Peace Cya again you lovely Rust community.

review: Woke up on a beach naked as the day I was born. Got killed by trying to break into some guy's house. He came out of the house and shot me dead on his doorstep.Woke up on the shoreline of a wide river. Found a lighthouse. While scrounging for scrap and food was sniped from a nearby hill. Hobbled away swam across the currents of the river and attacked another survivor hoping his house might have some bandages and food. He ran away screaming. House had nothing.Found a few corpses and found some clothes a steel mace and a bandana. Found a cave and went to sleep. Was killed in my sleep.Woke up by a abandoned port. Found a derelict ship. As the sun fell found a place to hide inside the ship. In the distance a wandering torch. Coming closer. Approached the torch and then suddenly the aggressor's torch went out. Doused my torch and took out a nasty weapon found in a box in the derelict. Complete darkness. Lit up my torch BAM I reel back half dead. He was waiting for me after all.Doused my torch got down on my knees waiting. The shadow of the nearby moon lit the figure's shadow. Swiped madly but nothing just air. The figure had disappeared and I was alone. Again.Found a quiet abandoned house and went to sleep. Woke up. Found a cave that went into the earth for an endless depth. Tripped and fell down a long long chasm. Not sure how I survived. Found a pair of binoculars. Progress stopped with an enormous pit cross hatched with broken beams.Very very cold down here.Jumped across. Tripped and fell to the bottom of the pit. Could hear bones break. Crawled back up. Leaped again. Twisted my ankle and fell. but this time couldn't get up. Passed out at the bottom of the world but at least I had a pair of binoculars.Woke up naked on the side of a mountain.Twisted sense of humor this world.

review: After logging 300+ hours of this game I finally entered the Rustopia server with 3 friends. We spawn naked and afraid...there is 290 people online in this server. One of us gets lucky and gets a bunch of cloth which means he can make sleeping bags for the other 2 guys (sleeping bags acts as spawn points when you die). So we go in to the consol and suicide and spawn in the bags.We're at a beach. It looks beatiful as the sun is setting. But there is no time to marvel at the graphics. Time to farm materials to build a little cabin. As our cabin is taking shape and the tool cupboard is down (the tool cupboard acts as a building blocker for anyone who isnt authorized on it) we venture out with bows and encounter our neighbours not far away. They viciously attack us with crossbows and waterpipe shotguns. One of us goes down in a heartbeat and starts screaming on the ground...Im thinking to my self we are ed. I cant get to him and save him in time but I can revenge his death. Me and my friend who is still alive keep our distance and headshot all 3 attackers and kill them. I scream in TS as I loot them and the adrenaline is pumping. We get a ton of loot and enter our cabin and hide the loot.Our 3rd friend who died spawns in again after a 200sec wait and we venture of to farm animals for animal fat and cloth. As we are up on a hill we encounter a naked man with a rock. My ptsd instantly kicks in from the fight before and I put an arrow in his shoulder. He screams "Im friendly please dont kill me!!". I come to my senses. Now we're standing there in a circle trying to apologize to this naked man with a rock.In my periferal vision I see a person with a waterpipe shotgun and a metal facemask. It must be our trigger happy french neighbours. I yell attack and charge with my own waterpipe and crosbow.The chase is on. The metal face maske is retreating in a military fashion swivelling between bushes and rocks.Oh no...it's a trap. My hot temper finally got to me. There is 3 of them. They are all attacking us...and somehow the naked guy with the rock is taking advantage of the situation as well as he is chasing me with his rock trying to bash my head in. But the 3 people that just attacked us is now fighting each other as well. What is going on...is my last thought as I get an arrow in the head.My two friends rage quit and do a fresh spawn and try to build somewhere else. I do not. I spawn in at the cover of darkness and return to our cabin. It has been raided by who I can only presume is our french neighbour. I do a pitty knock on the door and say hello in the most pathetic way...A teenage boy awnsers. Clearly not french...maybe dutch?He asks me if I want to come inside and hide during the night. He has a fire going and some food on the way.I accept.As I enter my old cabin I see that it has been redecorated. Nothing fancy just different. I tell the boy I use to live here. After some talking we realise that he was the metal face mask from before...My ptsd from the french got the better of me and I attacked an innocent bystandard that was just there to farm some animals.As we come to terms with the whole ordeal he invites me to his base. As we are about to leave the cabin as the sun is rising there is a knock on the door...I think to my self "What now!?".It's a russian dude. He is saying "Hello...come out plz...is iz new player"I say to my new friend "It's a trap dude dont open the door man...". We device a plan that I will be his meatshield as I have nothing to lose. He opens the door and hides behind it as I peek out. I see the russian dude.Behind him in a brush there is a guys in hide clothes with a waterpipe shotgun. He blasts me in the face as my newly found friend closes the door just in time for me to no die.We're stuck...we're like a fox in a fox den just waiting to be smoked out. I realize I have a sleeping bag at the beach from before so I say good bye to my newly found friend and die. I spawn at the beach use my stealth to get back to the cabin. I see the naked russian and the guy with the waterpipe.I yell "CHARGE!!!" and rush him with my rock. I hit the waterpipe guy in the head as my new friend rush out of the cabin and starts blasting him with a waterpipe shotgun. The enemy is dead and I get his loot. The naked russian is no where to be found...sly son of a .My new friend takes me to his fortress. Outside is a little 2x3 house that has a sign on it "Fighters Camp". I get a room in it with a bed and some storage. One other guy joins in as a fighter as well thru the global chat system on the server. As we settle in its time to head back to the god awful place I once called home...to farm some animals. Its me the other fighter and our lord and savior the teenage boy that rescude me from this tragedy.We farm an animal or two with our bows as we see a naked person with spear. It fits the description of the naked russian we encounter. We take pursuit.But not for long...7 FULLY GEARD people with ak's shows up behind a hill. We got to focused on reveng and let our guards down. The other fighter goes down with a headshot while the dutch boy screams "RUUUN!!!". I do as he says no further explanation needed.The dutch boy goes down...he screams. I'm to affraid to turn back to help him. I hear the finishing shots as he dies.I run...for about 1 2 minutes. I think they lost my trail. NO...they are close. I come up to a circulare base with a geared guy. I beg him to let me in so I can survive this onslaught. He says nothing.I hide in a bush outside his base as I hear the fully geared guys run past me. As I'm collecting my thoughts and trying to figure out how I will find my way back to camp I hear the door open to the base. The fully geared guy who did nothing to help me comes out. I greet him and he greats me. One of his friends comes out...he is naked. I walks up to me as I am about to greet him...he pulls out a hatchet and says " you" with a russian accent. As I see the hatchet coming at me I realise its the russian from before...but its to late.I ragequit. 10/10 will play again tomorrow.
title: Rust

review: Toilet paper orientationA toilet paper roll has two possible orientations the toilet paper may hang over (in front of) or under (behind) the roll if perpendicular to the wall the two orientations are right left or near away. The choice is largely a matter of personal preference dictated by habit. In surveys of US consumers and of bath and kitchen specialists 60 70 percent of respondents prefer over. 1 Some people hold strong opinions on the matter advice columnist Ann Landers said that the subject was the most responded to (15 000 letters in 1986) and controversial issue in her column's history. Defenders of either position cite advantages ranging from aesthetics hospitality and cleanliness to paper conservation the ease of detaching individual squares and compatibility with setting specifics such as recreational vehicles or having pets. Some writers have proposed connections to age sex or political philosophy and survey evidence has shown a correlation with socioeconomic status.Solutions range from compromise to using separate dispensers or separate bathrooms entirely or simply ignoring the issue altogether. One man advocates a plan under which his country will standardize on a single forced orientation and at least one inventor hopes to popularize a new kind of toilet roll holder which swivels from one orientation to the other.

review: Buy at your own risk. And please read reviews before you buy this game. The community is TOXIC.Any random servers it's very likely you're going to be killed on sight. KOS is everywhere. Not if you're a newspwan or a collector. Highly possible to get killed on sight with no question asked. The game has a mature building mechanics and plentiful items and nice graphics it's possbily by far the most developed survival/Early Access game out there. I personally think the game is like an upgraded Minecraft with a lot of matture building and construction mechanics. But gameplay has been bogged down to the pleasure of KOS there's no fun at all if you play at a populated server and trynna take 2 or 3 hours to get your own residence done. Because either way you're going to get killed by strangers at the process OR found out you're lying on a beach with nothing else after you log off the game for some time.Very unfriendly to new players. So there's some noob servers take some time to find one but whatever got killed either in noob server. No learning curve at all because you're just constantly getting killed don't even bother to learn the basics of the game. Unless you open your own server and lock it play a single player. If you enjoy raid and constantly getting killed buy this game. If you just want to build somethings or play nice don't even think about it.

review: It's still not what it could or should have been. Either you're forced to play on a community server that constantly wipes your blueprints and thus any progress you've made. Or you can play on officials that are constantly the target of hackers including vicious ddos attacks that leave the entire server helpless.It's sad because they're STILL adding worthwhile content to the game despite the core system being fundamentally flawed. They can tweak the loot tables and such but ultimately modded servers will be completely different anyway so someone who wants the "core" Rust experience is forced to choose an official server that will always be hacker infested and subject to ddos.Also the community has gotten worse every year and exponentially worse since it left EA.

review: TLDR I want to like it but it just isn't fun due to the necessity of constant activity in the server you are on or a large group of people to split the activity 24/7. Overall I hated the experience with the game (other than the guitar. That's a gem). On top of this the community is extremely toxic. I really wish this game was enjoyable to me because the idea is wonderful but it just isn't enjoyable. I played the game about a half a year or so ago with some friends and it was relatively enjoyable. That was until we had to get back to our usual lives and were therefore unable to be on relatively consistently. At that point we ended up loosing everything rebuilding to an even further point loosing everything again rebuilding again and then loosing it all again. This was a result of us not being on at 3 o'clock in the morning and therefore getting raided and killed with absolutely nothing we could do about it. I then uninstalled the game because I didn't feel like wasting hours of my time trying to build stuff up only to loose it because I'm unable to be online 24/7. After a year and a half I decided to try it agian per my buddy's request. This time I come to another conclusion that is very similar. We tried to start and found a server that was relatively busy but not overly populated. Each time when trying to meet up we would get attacked and killed by people with guns and bows and all that with high end gear. This was on a server that had been wiped the day before. We kept trying but after about the 7th or so time trying to meet up I decided to once again uninstall the game as it just isn't fun at all. Not to mention the community is overly toxic. At one point a clan of about 20 or so people teamed up on me and my two friends and hunted us down even after killing us once and us moving elsewhere. It just isn't enjoyable. You build everything up only to have it taken away without any chance to stop it. If you were able to play the game with only your group of friends easily it would probably be amazing but in its current state it is absolutely terrible. I hate to say that because I want to like it as the concept is nice but the execution is terrible. I shouldn't have to play the game 24/7 in order to progress. I shouldn't have to have a rotating team of people to always be online so that I don't loose everything for actually living a real life. In the moments were my friends and I were actually able to play the game we absolutely loved it (especially the guitar. That's the highlight). So overall it's an interesting take on this style of game but it just isn't enjoyable if you can't dump tons of time into the game or if you don't have a large team (probably around 10 or so people) to rotate activity. I wish I could like this game but I just can't. It's not fun to build everything up with your friends only to have it ripped away when none of you are on because you can't be on all the time.
title: Rust

review: This game is fantastic. The PVP is intense the sounds are realistic. I actually hate pvp but my husband loves it and I do go with him at his request to hunt players. I get soooo scared in pvp in this game because you can actually lose things that you've worked hard to earn. Some people may think that's a con but honestly I believe that the ability to lose your time is a boon in games. The fear aspect makes your heart race and makes it exiting. So many times we've gotten angry and quit over pvp only to come back because there are so many aspects of it that we love that keep us coming back.Personally I love the building. I love creating as massive a base as we can designing it to be a maze. We try different methods to make it more secure each time we build. I love the upgrading of the base. I love the farming tool crafting hunting animals even if on some servers the navmesh is disabled and they are stationary. We enjoy trying to snipe animals from as far away as possible. Fighting the helicopter is so thrilling. I used to just shoot at it to have it engage me because I would laugh out loud at parts of my base falling to pieces when it gets napalmed. Now we actually build towers and reinforce them to take it out.Many people complain about the recent update. I enjoy it so far. I believe it slows down the game a bit. It used to be that when a server wiped you'd have the players that server jump just to build get guns make one or two c4 and raid your base early. Now they have to actually play for an amount of time to do anything and time invested yields reward.I find it amusing that someone gave the game a negative review calling it garbage after he played it for 1 000 hours. My only guess is that he rage quit as we often have and wrote a review while upset. I certainly wouldn't invest 1000 hours in a game that I call garbage. This game is cheap and is amazing. But you need friends or a companion to play it with you. That's when it's is amazing. I only enjoy it alone when there are no players to fight against (Dead server) I actually purchased a server recently with the intention of it being just my husband and me playing on the server and was surprised that apparently buying a premium server with great ping brings flocks of players. I live in fear (and excitement) but I organize and strengthen our base and sneak around farming as my husband pvps and draws me from my nest to occasionally scout for enemies as he burns down doors.
title: Rust

review: I can recommend this game if you have at least 4 friends to play with and you are into resource gathering and progression in techs and so on. It's cool learning the blueprints and grinding for items and blue prints. It's a good time coordinating with friends in a more serious version of minecraft to put it that way.I cannot recommend this game if people that kill you on sight are going to trigger you. Or if everybody double crosses you at every turn. Build up a small community that farms together and has each others backs and kill on sight yourselves and raid the hell out of people that annoy you. Otherwise you are wasting your time since going to the places with good loot will get you killed. Gathering resources will get you killed. Spawning will get you killed. Dedicated PVE servers would suite a certain player base and that player base that wants to play PVE will have a very hard time getting anywhere that feels accomplished in Rust

review: Game just became one of my favorite games of all time. The new component system makes it so you cant dominate a server just by having more playtime on any given server for the most part. The new max group 1 2 3 4 5 servers make it so you and your tightly knit group of friends can thrive and not get dominated by groups of 20+. Best survival game yet imo. BUY IT. Some servers do have admin abuse going on so if you run into admin abuse just report it to facepunch and continue searching for a fair and balanced server. review: Its alright.Probably one of the more basic survival games out there. easy to play.All you have to do is play for a weeks (unless you are on a modded server) Build up supplies then raid your neighbors while they are offline.I feel like there needs to be offline raid protection. maybe there is? but ive not seen any servers like that.This is kinda discouraging for new players. You come into a game get set up collect resources log off and go to bed. Then wake up and all your stuffs gone and now there are holes and doors blown out every where. But once you get settled and learn how to secure your items and base a little more the games experience changes for the better. I dont feel there is any buyers remorse for buying this at full price. But i would recommend holding out a little for a sale price.

title: Rust

review: Great game! Its a extreamly unique game you have traditional survival stuff like food and thirst but you also have stuff unique to Rust such as the Patrol/Attack chopper (There the same thing but people call them both) and supply drops that make for real blood baths! The developers will liston to the community on most changes but as it says in the games description its only early access and alot is broken and will be changed but they have a vison and to trust them. And boy have they delevered! Some people b**** about how there is no single player but when your game is based on pvp and player interaction then why would you have a single player? Also if you looking for a game with friendly people you might want to look some where else because almost everybody in rust has a hidden agenda if they dont kill you on sight then their probably looking to kill you later. The game is great solo but can get stale after a while but if you have even just 1 friend to bounce jokes and gather resourses with it makes the game SOO much more fun. Also if you dont like people stealing your s*** then rust might not for you. People will as we call it Raid you also know as blow into your base and steal your gear and materials. All you have to do is be able to get over losing gear if you do then rust is a great game. Comment if you have any questions and Ill reply as soon as posibleEdit This review was made back in the day. Back in the good times of rust. Back when the game wansn't a full time job. But those days are gone long gone. Now adays to be successful you have to not only play in groups you have to live in your parents basement and play the game 24/7. The way that the devs took the building makes it impossible to build big and if you try your base will become an actual job just to keep from decaying. Then you have the hackers. The people who get hacks kill the whole server for days sometimes even weeks before an admin decides theyre too good to be legit. Like when you get headshot from 1000+ kilometers multiple times by the same person something isnt right yet its just left to happen because... well there isn't an answer to that question. Its just left to happen. With the way the rust devs have taken the game I cant see myself playing it anymore and I DO NOT recommend any of you to. Its a chore and isn't something I find myself wanting to play becasue I have a life I have friends to talk to school work to do sleep to get. I like most people cant afford to play the game for 200 hours plus per two weeks just to get a good base. Its dumb and Im not going to put myself through it anymore. Facepunch yall had a great game and I thank you for the countless hours of fun I had meeting and killing people but this will probably be my final goodbye to this game. Its sad and I bid you farewell my friends

review: As someone who LOVED Rust Legacy (Or just Rust as we called it back in the day...) When Experimental becamse "the new thing" and tried to replace Legacy completely I was not having it and was kind of turned off of the game for some time... During a spur of the moment decision that changed my life I redownloaded Rust and HOLY CRAP! Experimental Rust (Or just Rust as it is called now...) is awesome. It kept everything that was great about the original rust and amplified it x1000. Uploaded a tour of my bases here https //www.youtube.com/watch?v DlfL91qy loOwning my own server I am able to choose from an insane amount of "map seeds" which gives each server a differnet experience and the added danger of taking a missile to the face from a helicopter or tank really keeps you on your toes. The base building is where the game won me back over. The process of building has become so smooth and gives you the ability to absolutely do anything your little heart desires as far as design goes. THANKS RUST!

Yes yes I know this is in alpha but this problem should be fixed above all else in my opinion because this is otherwise a good game. Been playing 70 hours but I don't think I will be playing this game and won't recommend this game to anyone yet until that particular problem is fixed.
