review: Summary It's like Minecraft 2 but without singleplay and with super toxic communities on every servers.Graphics and Spec The graphics looks very nice only if the graphics settings are high enough.The graphics is very heavy so you will need a super strong gaming setup. I have a laptop with Intel Core i5 8th Gen (i5 8300H) 8GB ram (One slot) and an SSD (M.2). This setup was enough to run the game on Fantastic settings. Of course the ram is not enough but apperently virtual memory or "swap" on the SSD was fast enough for me.I've tried to play this game on Linux but it seems like the game crashes during the asset loading. There was an update but I have not checked on a physical Linux machine.Multiplayer Gameplay Get some friends or play on solo only server (mod) because these ing people are not nice. If you really have to play solo on most servers because you got no friends and/or girl/boy/bothfriend(s) then you must get a microphone to minimize a change of getting randomly killed by s. Some of these s ask you to talk in the game through a microphone before they decide to foot you so having a microphone ready is really important. If you decided to play this game without microphone and/or as a solo you will get foot ed by racists feminists communists socialists animal protesters and neo nazis in about every 10 minutes. Simply don't expect these s to show mercy even if you are not wearing anything and have nothing but a rock and a torch because there are a lot of s who loves to shoot newbs with bolt action rifle from long range.Many servers will completely wipe out on Thursdays so if you are starting new then you should wait till it's thursday and then start playing. Yeah it's kinda sad to let go of your super huge base with tons of guns and because 'Murica but it's somewhat necessary to prevent those clans from completely consume the whole server.Gameplay Overall it's fun but you should expect to do a lot of man labor works. You can literally craft everything but you will also need to collect tons of scraps to get all the blueprints for everything. Goodthing is that you can take a short cut by trying to get some air drops and locked crates however if you are on a highly active server expect to see other players targeting the drop and the crate. That's the other fun part too.It's just so fun to go PvP and stuffs for both sides but raiding someone's base is always fun on one side of course. Good thing is that making traps to prevent raids is also the fun part too you know. Seeing some deceased poor dudes with assault rifles and buncha C4 who got foot ed by your traps is also a lot of fun.
title: Rust

review: This game is crazy. My first time playing I loaded into the game and was immediately murdered by a naked black girl with a rock. I love games that have a decent learning curve with enough opportunity to get going but not too easy. And this game does that. I also like the fact that playing does not allow for you to generate your own character. Like life you are what you are. May seem counter intuitive but I have played games that you could spend an hour getting a new character just right only to find out the playability of the game is boring. So this game flips that on its head. One complaint though is that it takes a long time to load into a game. And I think that when you start loading you are already in the game. I have come across a bunch of people who were just lying there waiting to be murdered (which I was happy to oblige). So there is room for improvement. Also the game supported servers tend to be crowded making newcomers pretty much meat. The upside though is you respawn in a random location if you don't have a sleeping bag to spawn to. SO you can at least respawn away from the last thing person or environmental hazard that killed you.

review: After playing rust over a time span of 2 years and sometimes taking month breaks due to bugs and glitches that made the game unplayable I have finally decided to write my review as I think the game is finally in a state that is playable and enjoyable.Most people ask is rust worth the money I say yes rust is only $20 and compared to the price of games these days its pretty cheap theres no in game content in rust and the only thing you could spend your money on is skins and cases.Over the years rust has built up its community and development team and for as long as I can remember there has been an update every week. The developers dont stop there is always new content to explore and new things to do if the game ever gets boring you can just wait untill the new update and have more stuff to do and explore with your friends.Cons my only problems with rust is the insane fps drops and insane lag on rust offical servers if you want to play on a offical server just remember theres gonna be hackers and no admins to stop them theres going to be server lag so if you get angry easily go to community and lastly if you have a laptop dont buy this game.If rust gets there servers under control and hires some admins for the offical servers this game could be even better.Lastly if you want a good fun cheap game to play with your friends get rust just remember if you have a laptop the game will not be playable unless you want to turn your graphics down to 2D.
title: Rust

review: Its PVP survival game with awesome base building wall by wall. You will die to random people all the time and lose your stuff. I played Reign of Kings before trying Rust so kinda used to that hardship already. After a few times dieing to a smack talking punk while I was holding alot of resources and loot that took me a long time to gather I really lost interest. Its good short term fun though! Got a good laugh the first hour or two fighting other noobs with rocks. If someone was to make an MMORPG with the same kind of base building mechanisms build castles towns etc it would already be a good game. Unfortunately Rust and Reign of Kings are unfinished free for all PVP "lose it all" type games and the special building features are getting lost or perhaps type casted into the genre when they could be really great features to another type of game.
title: Rust

review: My new review Cheaters all over the place at the moment. I can't recommend this game anymore. Just too frustrating to play against aimbots. Like tripple headshot in 1 2 sec with PYTHON from 50 meters from a guy with 200 huours. Bchilz posted video half year ago about graphics exploit and it's still isn't fixed. Devs are focusing cosmetics instead of game breaking things. My old review I am fan of hardcore PVP games and this is one of the best game I ever played. This game shows the primitive nature of modern humans.Attention! This game is not cry baby friendly. You will get killed a lot. You will learn to loose everything you have and live with it. If you play alone (I very recommend to do that dont rush to find team) you will be forced to use your brain to survive hide build plan solo raids scavange scout other players. Community is salty but it's even more fun to beat those salty dudes and make them rage quit hehe. Cheap investment for tons of fun.

review: Me and my friend decided to buy this game the other night (about 21.00). It was very confusing coming into the game with no predictions but we managed. He spawned in as a female and I as a male. So we decided to roleplay and call us "Hussein" and "Fatima". We raided couple of left over buildings found a nice looking mountain party and decided to build there. It was perfect!Everything was going fine until a group of raiders came by and harrased us. I told them to my wife and leave me alone. Instead they Fatima and killed me Hussein. Looted our house and left it burning.We wanted revenge! Rebuilded and found out where they lived. Now the time was 07.00 in a working day where did all the time go?The world of rust is magical. 10/10 recommanded for anyone with a bit creativity

review: Have heard many people talking about how fun this game is. Don't get me wrong I don't mind challenge. I used to be an end game wow raider killing raid bosses in greens and blues early on. This game is poorly conceptualized. Is it a survival game? Nope! PvP Surivival. Encourages group play strongly discourages solo play.Mess up a build cannot unbuild your own structure.New Content released? Total server wipe.This game supposedly came out of EA in Feb. 2018. Don't believe it. This is still a crunchy Beta AT BEST.Gotta scavenge for really anything in game. Ok cool I'm good with that. 99% of the things in the game are cosmetic. Beans on the shelf in the store I'm looting HAHA JK there is one box in the entire store you can loot and it has a single granola bar in it.Game is trash from so many perspectives. More power to you folks who need something like this you can't get from a battle royale style game or a better survival PVP game that is more finish than this junker.

review: Rust is the best survival game out there. It doesn't only have great looks the gameplay is absolutely amazing. The reason for this is because of how much Facepunch updates their game and how they actually take feedback from the community. Every part of this game is incredible from early game to later in the wipe as the combat evolves from simple bows and spears to heavy weaponry and armour. For some it can be challenging to get started (especially further into map wipes) and most of the random players don't make it easier as they can be toxic at times. Not all players are this way though I've ran into many helpful people.

This game is well worth your $20 as long as your start of on a community server is not many people playing then as your skills get better switch to official.

review: Rust is a fun game for people that are a fan of Minecraft. It is a survival game where you have to survive along with other people on a multiplayer server.(Yes it is MULTIPLAYER ONLY as of right now) It does have the same collect and craft as minecraft but there's alot of other stuff like guns and clothes and things. But because it is only multiplayer it is hard for noobs or people who aren't that great at first person shooters because everybody just kills you the second they get the chance. It also has a few bugs too. Like it gets a little laggy sometimes even on a beefy computer but it is early aplpha and they update it pretty frequently so play at your own risk. I would recommend it though it just depends on who is playing it.

review: Slight update since I now have a different better PC than before. Still very system intensive have to run on the lowest settings to play it. Reccomend the game if only on sale. Main drawback for me is no single player mode.My PC specs OS Microsoft Windows 10 (build 16299) 64 bit CPU AMD FX(tm) 4300 Quad Core Processor RAM 6.0 GB Video Card NVIDIA GeForce GT 740 Video RAM 4 GBI plan on adding more RAM to my PC soon maybe I will have a better experience then. My 4GB card has no issue with most games of similar age as Rust. I know my RAM is my bottleneck mostly.So yeah I understand my PC is old but I'm on a budget and have to make due. I am NOT giving this game a bad review I am only stating that it doesn't run well on older low end PCs. So those who don't have at least a quad core don't even try this game. The servers are always laggy as crap and I am always getting dc'ed.

review: This is a game like many other survivor pvp games. You start with nothing and have to gather materials to make a base. The combat is decent definitely has room to grow in terms of controls hit reg and balancing. You can make a decent base with the materials you gather in the world as well as hunt to feed yourself if you manage to live long enough. For higher leveled tools/weapons/armour you need to gather what are called blueprints to reveal the crafting recipe.Here are the problems You start with only a rock and a torch the torch may as well be useless the light is too low to be useful and you don't exactly want people to know where you are. There are many servers to play on you DO NOT want to play on a populated server you WILL DIE many times. People will not hesitate to gun you down repeatedly. I have not had a situation where I saw someone with a gun not kill someone and 90% of the time they know they get nothing from it. Players will camp the sites where blueprints spawn with the best gear kill on the beaches where you spawn most of the time. The way the game sets it up requires you to play at the very start of a server after the wipe or have a clan. You cannot be successful on your own on a server with more than 50 people.Do not expect a single person to help you. Even if you ask in the chat in the many servers I asked new player questions to see the responses most of the top players of the servers would rather insult and flame the new players rather than help someone in the slightest way. The community has no dignity they will kill you trust means nothing no one owes you anything for anything you do.Developers if you are reading this your game needs to have something you can earn preferrably crafting recipes rather than having all comodities be able to be camped hoarded and trolled. As well as guns are far too common it simply makes it easier for people who know what they are doing to kill new players. This puts off anyone who has a small interest in the game and for those who have higher interests in the game follow suit when they finally get a gun.

review: positives very refined game for early access. extremely easy to play with friends and work together (the funnest ways to play rust). lots of content. immense amount of replay value.(as you can see by my amount of hours ) the developer (Garry) is very active he uploads an update every week or so. if you get bored you can leave the game for a month or two then come back and there is a whole bunch more to do. you can play all kinds of styles you can solo the game and try to survive in the shadows or make friends with your neighbours and thrive you can join with a group of friends and excell through the game faster with more action or you can join a massive clan (20+ people) on a server (you can join clans either by talking around or go on reddit).negatives extremely brutal to noobs (suggest play with some friends first so u get the hang of the mechanics etc.). very hard to solo on high population servers. lots of people are s and will shoot you in the back straight after you make "friends" with them but others aren't. just a very important tip never give your door codes to ANYONE no matter what unless you are friends that started off from scratch together in the same base.overall this gaem is DEFENITLEY woth the full price of $20.note If you are a completely new player look up some beginners tuitorials before you start.GOOD LUCK!

review: All the cools kids seem to be doing their "first few hours" of games so I'll give it a go.Joined a random public official server. I had next to no idea what I was meant to be doing but I had a rock and three meters. I spawned in at night on a small beach so I instantly began to freeze and lost a bit of health. Following the coastline I found many houses (in hindsight they were all probably abandoned) and pilfered some pumpkins and corn from a small crop field. I then immediately hightailed it to the mountains and began cutting down some trees for wood. After about 45 minutes of running around and trying to figure out how to cook food I died of food poisoning from stolen food after starving and drinking salty water.Spawn back in again and this time I go straight to looking for food. I found some mushrooms but I guess they belonged to a guy as he shot me with an arrow. I managed to hide inside a bush but I spent the next ten minutes hiding inside of it thinking he was still there until I poked my head out and found out it was a horse. Didn't find any food but I found a player idling on the beach. Died of starvation.This time I went inland. There were a lot of gunshots in the distance and people getting angry over someone cheating. I got shot in the back by a guy with a bow who then apologized thinking that I was a threat and let me go. For whatever reason I thought it would be a good idea to run towards the gunshots. Got scared and hid in another bush. I slowly snuck inside an empty house and took my bearing. Killed a horse (first kill!) and ate it over a fire in the empty shack. I then got out of the warzone and headed towards the beach. I was still pretty hungry so I needed to get some food. After following the beach for some time I found and killed a wild boar who happily dropped four pork for me enough to sustain me for a long time. After chasing down another boar a man saw me shot me berated me for my sloppy fighting (despite never really ever fighting before) and then murdered me with my own spear.I joined a new server (my dignity was low but spirits still high) and went exploring the forests. The people here (if there were people) were a bit more friendly keeping their distance from me. I actually managed to make myself a bow 100 arrows and a burlap suit. But food was another story. I searched every forest and valley for food and all I could find was the occasional mushroom. No deer horse or boar to be seen. I pilfered another pumpkin farm and set to work building a base only to be suprise attacked by a bear and killed. I did build a sleeping bag this time but the bear just turned around and immediately killed me again anyway.After 3 hours 4 or so deaths and 6 or so kills I think I'm done for the moment. This game is fun but I don't think I can get too invested in it what with all the raiding and such.

review: Rust Made a friend lost him in the dark running away from a zombie. I think he is dead.Rust Ran around naked with a hatchet stalking some guy at night while making scary noises.Rust Spent 3 hours stuck on a rock surrounded by bears until the zombies came. Then I was surrounded by bears and zombies.Rust Everything tastes like chicken.This game is great. Start out with nothing and rise to be the most feared person on the server. This game is still in Alpha but I have already spent many nights trying to master it. There is still room for improvement but I'm sure it'll be amazing on launch day. Join up with friends or be a lone wolf whatever you desire.7/10 as it's still in Alpha but this game will be a smooth 10/10 once it launches.Tips Build yourself a shelter with a furnace campfire and sleeping bag as SOON as possible. Wooden doors can be broken down easily try to make a metal one to ensure your safety.Don't light a fire at night! At least until you are in a very secure building. Fire draws attention and can be seen from leagues away at night.STAY AWAY FROM WELL GEARED PEOPLE. If they approach you be kind hopefully they will spare you.Find resources. Trees Wood Piles large Gray/Brown rocks that spawn Animals... Farm them but remain safe and aware of everything around you. Find a friend and watch each others backs.Don't mess around with people until you are ready to do so. Be well armed and prepare for any situation.Last but not least Have fun. It can be a bit frustrating at first but you'll get the hang of it.

review: One of the best survival games !
title: Rust

review: EDIT You can read my original review from December of 2013 below the line.It has now almost been 4 years since I got Rust and wrote my review on it. I remember when the game first came out the idea was generic yet ambitious since the guy behind the game is the same guy that made Garry's Mod. People weren't sure what to expect but were hopeful for the most part. Boy has the game changed from what it once was. Rust used to have zombies and radiation infected animals now it has a player base. The game is so much more detailed and thorough than any other survival game out on the market at the moment. It blends base building PVP interactions and hardcore survival against the elements (mostly when you're a freshspawn) into a nice little bundle of absolute frustration. Oh and it doesn't even stop there. If you're fortunate enough to build up a decent base you now have other players to worry about. Raiding is one of the most heavy aspects of Rust invading other bases and taking the spoils for yourself. Unfortunately most raids are offline but if you get the opportunity to defend your base while both parties are online it is one hell of a rush. If vanilla Rust (Rust without modifications to the game settings) then perhaps modded and community servers are more your type of thing. Most modded and community servers tend to have tweaks and modifications to the base game in order to create a less grueling experience. For example if you decided to get the game for you and your friend but always fail to find each other on the map modded servers grant the power of teleporting to your friends. Another popular attraction of modded servers are the increased gather rates of resources. 2x 3x 4x 5x and so forth are the increased rates at which you would normally receive resources in vanilla Rust. It makes for a more enjoyable experience if you didn't join the server at the beginning of the wipe. Overall Rust is a pretty fun game but it is in Early Access which means the game is inclined to having bugs crashing freezing etc.. If you're willing to bear through such things and acknowledge that the game is still in Early Access then you should have an enjoyable experience. Completely disregard what anyone has says about Rust still being in Early Access. You have to keep in mind that the development team behind Rust is extremely small compared to the say the development team behind H1Z1. Considering how much the game has done within the year it has been in Early Access then they have come pretty far. They've fixed their fair share of bugs and they've completely updated the look of Rust in the most recent months. You also have to keep in mind that Garry also has other things to work on and doesn't have a team that is literally dedicating their entire lives to developing Rust. In my honest opinion this game has an extremely positive future and you should buy it now while it's still $20 and before it rises in price.

review: I have played just about every early access survival game there is. Previously I had vouched for DayZ for years saying it has the potential to be the best game ever made and all the hate was unfair blah blah blah. When I finally purchased Rust I was completely shocked with how much fun it actually was. DayZ ARK H1Z1 the forest etc. Can't compare to how well put together (relatively speaking) Rust is. For the genre at this point in time it is hands down the best game to play. At the cheapest price point (I believe) It is much more fun Runs much better Has better building. The only aspect of the game that is rivaled is PVE and ARK wins in that field but I wouldn't say to the degree that it even competes overall. At the end of the day I would say Rust is well worth the 10 20 dollars and it still receives consistent (FREE) updates.

review: Okay i will try to summorize my experience with this game so far. You start at a beach with A stone and a torch and immediately you're faced against people with guns spears bows and other stuff. They kill you so they can eat you that's a thing now. When you by some miracle manages to get past them you have to use your stone to gather resources. when you got enoguh resources you build a hatch (takes 2 min) and then someone kills you. then you do that all over again and manages to stay alive for over 5 min. After you've collected a bunch of wood you run around looking for stones once again you die. when you've managed to find wood and stones you start building your base. immediately some s with a bow come and ruins your house. they break each wall in 1 shot and then they kill you. When you actually have a house some food and some other resources you either start looking for friends or try to find barrels so you can get blueprints. you'll get one every 15 barrel or something and they will mostly be useless. If you find a friend he will straight up murder you the sec you turn your back and then proceed to mutilate you. if you by any chance do find someone that isnt a blodthirsty he will have friends that s everything up and by the end gets you and everyone killed by inviting every naked man he sees to your home. After you've collected a few more resources and killed a couple naked guys just to get your revenge you log off thinking it was worth it. the next time you log in some s have stolen your base and everything you had. you spawn back at the beach and get spawn killed and all you have to show for it is some blueprints that teaches you how to make shoes. this is my experience and it took me about a day (IRL) to do everything and now all i got is some blueprints that suck balls cuz you wont find any animals so you wont be able to craft any clothes and when you finally do find some animals they use their noclip to walk through rocks and their super speed to outrun you. To make a bow you need cloth and the only thing you can kill without a bow is either wolfs or pigs. both of witch are rare as . once now and then a air drop will drop things right next to your house so people will come guns and bows blazing shooting each other and then taking a giant dump on your house. If you try to go for a airdrop you will get anally by people with AK47. They have a cold system now also and at night you will die from freezing unless you make a fire and if you do make a fire you will get hunted and killed by people with weapons etc. you cant defend yourself from them all you can do is bend over and take it. and forget about running if you encounter a small hill you're ed. Hills slow you down with 80% or something. I would rather suffocate on a balloon then play this game again it gives you nothing and then they steal it from you. Kicking yourself in the nuts is more fun than this game

review: A beautifully polished game with decently sized updates packed with bug fixes and new content. This is how you keep your game shooting past early access with spectacular colors. Its quite unique you have events clan battles incentives to keep playing and of course friendly fire (I'm looking at you naked clan.) The new content added monthly shakes up the gameplay making it hard for a meta to form as its still an developing experience. I would highly recommend this game to anyone looking to add some hours.

review: This game was awesome me and a few friends found a nice quiet server that unfortunately never had any admins on... but still it was quiet and fun and we had a great time building huge homes and teaming up to destroy bandits. We single handedly kept greifers in check until that one day... when two hackers came on and executed 7 people in less than 3 seconds. Yet somehow VAC and facepunch didn't detect when one of them jumped so high he came up from beneath us and shot us in our respawns.literally in less than 3 minutes I was killed over 8 times along with all of my friends. SO. that being said we have found a new home to play on another quiet server that hackers wont bother with due to low population but now airdrops dont work because of the low pop.... Still I totally want everyone to play the classic version and I pray the experimental can come up to par really quick because the lack of updates it losing my interest.

review: For you people who are looking to get this game it's a Really Good Game even though it's in devloment. But just to say make sure your playing with friends. Most of the fun comes out of that. The concept is like any other survival game but has some unique twists. The towns you loot have radiation and you have to keep track of your rad bar. Also you have the animals. The Bears Wolves and other players are your real enemy so watch out. A recommendation for you noobs just starting out add variety in your servers. Even though your good in one server you always need variety and to have different play roots. Just to remind you this is a good game for you guys who love survival and don't mind trying this out. Have fun and Good luck.....You'll need it &gt )

review: Helk the worst game Dev of all time just because you are an excellent coder doesn't make you a project manager. His scatter brained development process introduces things into the game just because he feels like it. So called features left to be untouched for months even years. The game's population fluctuates frequently because Helk changes his mind every 3 4 months. Claims the previous systems introduced were inferior when he never takes any time to balance anything. Listens to the shills of the loudest player base and cater's to their play style. Don't bother with this game because it will never be finished. Helk will decide something isn't perfect remove it and replace with some thoughtless idea he came up with while browsing reddit on the toilet...The final nail in the coffin is he uses Twitter to troll his player base promising features that should be implemented but never will...Just Remember the History of his Incompetence Stairs still don't line up with Doors and the stairs only face one direction and can't be mirrored.You're defenseless if you lose your rock you can't punch or anything...a game without punching made by a company called "Face Punch" Melee Combat is a ing joke.A spear costs a whole tree.....you need a workbench to craft a stone spear... A spear is a simple weapon made from a long piece of wood... how does that equate to a whole tree? you find a stick and sharpen it... i feel spears should be a more accessible weapon not spend 15 minutes chopping a tree down and another 3 minutes crafting a damn spear..Most Loot you get from barrels and boxes are utter trash Blue Prints that are purely cosmetic or for Role Players... Yeah I definitely enjoy risking my life to gather mailbox blueprints and bear rugs...You can't even remodel your own base if you mess up you are stuck with it. Sure you can destroy objects but only within the time limit.The Survival aspect is a joke. Thirst and Hunger really have no effect on the gameplay. you can practially bandage through the damage..You shouldn't be able to abuse the healing mechanics in the game spamming Bandages and Medical Syringes just makes the game feel like who ever has the most Medical Supplies automatically wins the battle. Also why have Large Medkits if no one uses them?The Game is just mindless PVP now no objectives or endgame.. its like a Free For All where you have to build all your gear just to lose it to someone who is better geared than you.They couldn't even hatch up some Bounty system that rewards players for killing someone thats been on a kill streak etc. The are no incentives for peaceful interactions in this game. If only they added a safe zone where everyone could come and trade and pick up bounties from a bullentin board. I dunno something more engaging than... Gather Die Gather Die Build Die Die.This game is the literal definition of Insanity.

review: Police Constable Nicholas Angel.Born and schooled in London.Graduated Canterbury University in 1993with a double first in politics and sociology.Attended Hendon College of Police Training.Displayed great aptitude in field exercises.Notably urban pacification and riot control.Back off!Academically excelled in theoreticalcourse work and final year examinations.Received the Baton of Honor.Graduated with distinction intothe Metropolitan Police Service.Quickly established an effectivenessand popularity within the community.Use your brain.Proceeded to improve skill basewith courses in advanced drivingand advanced cycling.Became heavily involvedin a number of extra vocational activities.To this day holds the Met recordfor the 100 meter dash.In 2001 began active duty withthe renowned SO 19 armed response unit.Received a bravery award for effortsin the resolution of Operation Crackdown.In the last 12 monthshas received nine special commendations.Achieved the highest arrest recordfor any officer in the Met.And sustained three injuriesin the line of duty.Most recently in December when woundedby a man dressed as Father Christmas. Hello Nicholas. Hello Sergeant. How's the hand? Still a bit stiff.It can get awfully hairy out there.I'm surprised you weren't snapped upsooner for a nice desk job. That's what I did.I prefer to think my office isout on the street.Indeed you do.Your arrest record is 400% higherthan any other officer.Which is why it's high timethat such skills were put to better use. Yes lovely.Isn't there a Sergeant's positionhere in London?No. Can I remain here as a PC? No. Do I have any choice in this? No.Sergeant I kind of like it here.Well you've always wantedto transfer to the country. In 20 years or so yes. Well done you.Hang on I don't remember telling you that.Yes you did. You said "I'd love to settle downin the country sometime Janine."I'd like to talk to the Inspector.You can speak to the Inspector but I can promise youhe will tell youexactly the same thing as I have. Keep your seat.Now I know what you're going to say but the fact is you've been making us all look bad.I'm sorry sir?Of course we all appreciate your efforts but you've been ratherletting the side down.It's all about being a team player Nicholas.You can't be the Sheriff of London.If we let you carry on running round town you'll continue to be exceptionaland we can't have that.You'll put us all out of a job.With respect sir. review: So much to say though I will try to be as brief as possible for people who just want a quick review. I've been tracking on this game since it's release in 2013 and yet the community that supports the development of this game is still going strong. It's games like these that make the market because they keep the player coming back for more experiences and more memories within the game. It's release from early access should definitely increase that player base in the future as well. The progress that has been made on this game is outstanding. Since the first version of it in 2013 the development team made canyons wide leaps in making this game look as beautiful as it does in it's current state. They also engage their community and ask them what they'd be interested in seeing in the game both in mechanics and in content. These ideas aren't ignored either and the development team really does consider any really good ideas. Easily the most fun 333.9 hours I've spent in a game. I usually choose server populations of around 15 or 20 to get a good start solo which is what I usually play as. On servers with more than 50 it can be a little suffocating and difficult to get anything done as a solo player however it's these servers that maximize the most on the competitive side of Rust. Let me give you a rundown of my kind of typical day on a modded server on Rust you spawn in gather your resources and you choose a spot that's safe enough to build in. With low pop servers you'll occasionally run into a fellow naked or sometimes stumble upon an active base but for the most part I avoid areas with a high player concentration. Once your base is up and running you begin the ambiguous process of upgrading. This is where the fun begins because you're not technically just focusing on upgrading but also improving upon your knowledge of the server where the best guys are how much stuff (bases people etc) is around the map where the radtowns are etc etc. This process is also a great time to make friends join clans participate in raids and destroy other peoples livelihoods within the server (lol). While doing this it goes without saying that you will also run the risk of being raided yourself and once that happens all you do then is just dust yourself off and repeat from step one. It can get frustrating at times but it can keep you coming back again and again. While playing I've also met some very interesting people within the servers some of whom I still talk to and play with today. It's these social encounters within Rust that give it it's amusing quality because in real life unless you're living in a nudist colony where men in bucket helmets shoot at you on a daily basis you don't expect someone to come up to you brandishing their testicles and shouting an incomprehensible mixture of memes and gibberish. On top of that the ragdoll effect within the game makes for some interesting death scenes. Overall this game has been a great purchase and has given me many memorable moments to look back on as a gamer. I encourage anyone interested to pick up this game as it will undoubtedly give you the same experience and quite possible more. With an open ended game like Rust anything you think of doing can be done.
title: Rust

review: This game is brutal but fun. The more hours you spend learning the more payoff for the first 100 hrs then it's just luck and what you want out of it. The PVE seems to be improving. review: I've tried again and again to have fun with this game. "Hey there is a tutorial let me try to do that!" Killed numerous times by other players while trying to learn the game. "I get to build a home for myself cool." People come over and kill me and take everything in my home so all those hours of effort are gone. "What's that? A whole group of people are attacking your home and there is literally nothing you can do about it while they spawn kill you over and over again until you give up? That's rust!" This game will never be a good experiance for new players like myself and caters only to those who have played since it first entered early access. Nobody cares to help out new players. Nobody cares if you worked days on your home. Nobody cares if you just spawned and have nothing. They kill you. They just kill you over and over and over and over and over and over and over again. Never have I had a gaming experiance so frustrating in my life before. I will never touch this game again and I regret ever buying it.

review: Rust started out being a fun game you could jump on and hang out with friends build forts and raid stuff.Now it's a game filled with some of the very worst trends in gaming right now and oddly the price keeps getting higher.I've followed this game since it was in it's very early stages and I have to say im very disappointed with the way the game has ended up. The game went from being a trend setter to "I have no idea what I'm doing" through literally hundreds of developer updates. By the time this game is finished I predict most of the player base will have moved on.For me I won't be playing anymore because I can't stand the 10+ minute load times constant wiping of maps due to performance issues and ever changing strategies required to play this game. On the off chance I find a fun group to play with it can be fun but right now it's way more entertaining to just watch popular streamers play the game.

review: Love how high you are allowed to create buildings and structures and the fact you can build on bodies of water! Once you learn the controls and kit and teleport commands the world is your oyster. Hopefully you get on a server with helpful people or play with friends. You need friends in a game like this otherwise you better be careful how much you player kill or karma will come back bigtime. Some of the pitfalls (at least to some) are you cannot dig underground the zombies are gone in rust (not sure about legacy people can and will break into your base kill you and take your stuff (happens often if you do not fortify) gathering is tedious if not on an excess gather server and gathering supplies in the dark is downright dangerous because you cant see the bears and wolves until its too late. Still for all its faults Rust is a great game highly addicting and time consuming. Many of the things which make it most annoying are also its best attributes you have to build elaborate bases dummy bases sniper towers and use friends to keep from being raided. Learning HOW to outsmart the other players is half the battle.

review: I ONLY have 500 hours in RUST so not as many as some. It is a very rewarding game but can also be hard. If your the type of player that longs for an adrenaline rush Rust can most certainly give that but it can be frustrating when you are trying to get set up and keep getting killed by people with better guns big bases or a large group of players working together. The game is amazingly fun with friends and some of fondest gaming memories are when we had a group of 5 6 RL friends and built a large base to defend. It is a very hard game solo but not un enjoyable you will just need to invest a lot of time to enjoy it that way.The devs are constantly reworking major systems in order to try and accentuate the best parts of Rust which doesn't always work but the new updates seem like a step in the right direction.Rust is at it's best during an intense bow fight a feud with your neighbour or 2+ real life friends trying to stake a claim on a server. It's visceral intense and sometimes frustrating but it can be very rewarding. The graphics and base building are also great.

review: After a decent amount of hours on the game I can highly recommend it to anyone thinking about jumping on board. While some vocal members of the community are outraged by the balancing taking place as of now (FYI both major and minor updates occur on a weekly basis which always makes the game refreshing to play) I would gladly say that it is heading in a direction that promotes a game in which all can enjoy not just zergs. This game is harsh. It always will be harsh. It's one of the most survival esque survival games I've ever played. But don't let that discourage you. The fun is in the brutality of it which sees regular players turn into immoral monsters as you forge friendships and hatreds in a game where you do all you can to both survive and dominate.

review: Been playing Rust for about 4 years now. When the game came out it was truly a one of a kind experience and the market quickly populated with games that emulated certain aspects of Rust. While it could be argued that DayZ was the originator of this genre I would argue that Rust innovated enough with base building and brought much more depth to player interaction. But the question at hand isn't whether Rust is historically relevant in the gaming world. It's whether Rust is a good game or not. While I might claim that this game sucks when I'm angry it also has brought me a lot of joy. I've met some people in the game that I've gone on to play other games with too. The daily life of Rust can be sometimes frustrating but thats what's amazing about the game. It lends itself to large amounts of randomness and unpredictabilitly.Buy Rust. Play it. It's never too late to get started tbh.
title: Rust

review: Best game I have ever played insanely addicting when you actually have friends!
title: Rust

review: While Rust is an early access game the developers and designers are constantly making updates and changes not only to the functionality of the gameplay but to the graphics and perfomance as well. While the constant updating can be an upside to the EA norm of getting greenlit and then never touching your game again the updates have also been a headache to those that loved the game at a specific stage of development and would rather it not change.It's a fun game with a really fun premise of survival and base building. PvP is constantly being tweaked and PvE is having its ups and downs as well. If you get this game don't settle in for how it is at any given point and expect things to change from week to week each Thursday.I would recommend this game to anyone that likes PvP survival games with crafting and building elements. I would not recommend this game to anyone wanting a finished game that won't change. Please believe me when I say this game will change. The hings you love may be deprecated while the things you hate may be promoted.
title: Rust

review: Rust is a game of patience and persistence and you experience that the moment you start the game and that turns a lot of people off. As of recently updates have been kiling the game but I have hope for this wonderful game. This game attracts the player who enjoys sitting down and grinding and having their work pay off (most of the time) but it also attracts cucks so watch out. I reccomend playing this game with a veteran if you're new but once you get the ist I reccomend playing solo to better understand the game. Overall I rate this game 7/10.

review: If you're looking for a game review you've come to the wrong place. But if youre looking for a fantastic ravioli recipe you've come to the right place.Ingredients To Make the Dough375 grams (3 cups) plain flour1/2 teaspoon salt2 eggs1/4 cup (50 ml / 3½ tablespoons) olive oil1/2 cup (120 ml / 8 tablespoons) waterExtra flour for dusting To Make Cheese Filling15 ounces (425 grams) container Ricotta cheese5 ounces (142 g/about 1/2 cup plus 2 tablespoons) "3 Cheese Italian Blend" (Parmesan Romano &amp Asiago)Note grate these cheeses yourself and create your own custom blend.1/2 cup cheddar cheese2 eggs lightly beaten1/2 teaspoon salt1/2 teaspoon pepper ExtrasYour favorite sauce for the ravioli (i.e. marinara/ marijuana)Parmesan cheeseBasilFried vegetablesShrimpFish slicesChicken pieces Make the Ravioli filling. In a small mixing bowl add the ricotta and mash with a fork. Add in the 3 cheese blend Cheddar cheese eggs salt and pepper. Mix all ingredients thoroughly until you have a smooth paste like consistency. Cover the bowl with plastic wrap and place it in the refrigerator for about 30 minutes. Make the Ravioli dough. Crack eggs into a large mixing bowl and beat them with a fork. Add water oil and salt. Mix. Add 1 cup flour to the bowl. Use a fork to mix the flour with the eggs water oil and salt. Repeat with the rest of the flour. Mix until a smooth dough is formed. Clear and clean off a large work surface and dust it with flour. This is where you are going to roll out your dough. Take the dough out of the mixing bowl shape it into a ball and place it on your work surface. Knead for at least 10 minutes or until it becomes elastic. Dust a rolling pin with flour to prevent the dough from sticking. Roll out the dough until it is about 1/8 inch (1/3 cm) thick or about the thickness of 2 stacked quarters. With a cookie cutter or upside down water glass cut out circles in the dough (will make about 15 20 dough circles). Ball up the unused dough and either roll it out and make a couple more raviolis or wrap it and put in the freezer for another time. Dough can keep for weeks when frozen. Just make sure to wrap well so that it doesn t suffer from freezer burn or absorb freezer odor. Fill the Ravioli shells. Take the ravioli filling out of the refrigerator and place a tablespoon of it in middle of a dough. Fill a small bowl with water dip your fingers in and moisten around the outer edge of the dough circle. Fold the dough in half over the filling making a half moon shape. Be sure all the filling stays inside. Pinch the edges together and then seal the edges of the ravioli with a fork. Make sure to press firmly and go all the way around. This will add a homemade touch as well. Repeat this process for all your dough circles. Dust the finished ravioli with flour to keep them from sticking together. Form the Shells and Fill Using a Ravioli maker. Roll the dough into two sheets Place one sheet on the ravioli maker and form the filling cups. Fill with the ravioli mixture. Lay the second sheet of dough on top and roll it out. This will seal in the filling. Remove and separate the finished raviolis.Cook the Ravioli. Fill a large pot with water and bring to a boil. Place the ravioli in boiling water for 5 6 minutes or until they float. You can also test for doneness by nibbling on the edges to test. If you don't want to make all the ravioli at one time you can freeze the rest Take ravioli out of boiling water with large slotted spoon and place on warmed platesServe it up.Top with your favorite sauce grate some fresh cheese over it and enjoy!

review: I think i've had enough playtime to justify a review. This game is incredibly fun especially if you're playing with other people or friends. You get into the routine of starting over so much that eventually you get completely used to it you also realise that only 1/100000 people are geniunely friendly in Rust but when you find the odd friendly player you can have some great fun. Base building is very solid if you have a small team of players you can make some huge bases that last a long time (a long time in Rust is probably more than a day without being raided) likewise raiding is just as fun although you have to grind a lot to get the bombs/rockets/guns (at least on non op vanilla ish servers). You also die a lot in Rust if I haven't mentioned already here are some fun ways to die Get killed when you are a naked (freshspawn) most common. you get used to it Get raided online and die whilst witnessing your hours of work put into your base gone probably most depressing Get killed on the way to a raid very annoying Get killed by abusive admins there are more than you think! Get killed while raiding a base annoying if you have good loot Getting killed by a wolf once one locks on to you you are ed ) Getting doorcamped definately very annoying Realising the server has been wiped just after you made your gigantic mega fortress base it'l put you off Rust for a while hahaThis game I definately think is more fun with friends or other people although it is definately still fun by yourself but I only really fine myself playing it when a friend is on etc. There are regular updates which add some cool content and it definately feels like a finished game already despite the many years it has been in Early Access. Probably the most hours i've put into a game in my Steam Libary.

review: I have only played 24 hours so far in Rust but they have been fun filled and exciting! I watched a few tutorial vids before starting and used some recommendations and advice to choose a suitable community server before starting out. Go for one that isn't super packed and you stand a good chance of avoiding the spawn killing chaos that so many people rage about. A couple of highlights from my time so far I woke up on the beach with no idea where I was and a guy runs up to me with his buddy. Rather than slashing me down with a sword he pulled out an acoustic guitar and played a song for me whilst I jumped up and down naked in a desperate attempt to play along and not be killed on the spot! I built my starter base with an airlock type entrance as advised and I hear people outside. I hear them knocking on the door as I try to make as little noise as possible in the hope they'll just leave. Time goes by and I realise that I cannot wait them out. I think "hey I've only started what have I got to lose?!" and open the doors with spear in hand. By mere luck I manage to head shot both with my wooden spears as they peeked into the open doorway. In any other game this would be nothing but Rust makes it mean so much!So many people bash this game for poor community aspects. In my experience so far I think I have played the Rust that the developers intend. IT IS GLORIOUS. Be clever with your server choice and don't be too precious with your stuff and you'll have a blast too!

review: In all honesty unless you know how to get aimbots or whatever you won't get very far in this game. The game itself super cool. The whole surviving stuff is pretty fun. However as with many games the players are what completely ruin the game. Finding another player that will actually work with you or just simply not kill you is especially hard to do in this game. Here is a breakdown of a Rust experience.Wake up on a beach naked. You have a rock and a torch and that is it. You use your rock to get wood make yourself a spear. Find some cloth make yourself some clothes. See another player running towards you. They might be friendly you are obviously a freshly spawned person who has close to nothing and for sure have nothing they need judging from their fully armored body and the AK 47 they are carrying. You give a pleasant hello and start to ask Dead.They shot you. Why? Because you are playing Rust at the same time they are and they found you. So unless you literally play this game non stop for days on end play unfairly or have three other friends that play with you you most likely will not have a good time playing this game.

review: I had this game for a long time as part of a STEAM SALE (Not sure which one) and after getting frustrated with Destiny 2 i decided "Sure lets give this a go". I thought it would be a minecraft style game mixed in with PUBG. Boy was i mistaken.First 5 minutes of playing i got blasted with a shotgun. Then a crowbow then a shotty again. I figured wow i cant wait til I can craft those.I never did. Begining in RUST is IMPOSSIBLE unless you have friends or you hide on the outskirts of everything where resources are even more scarce more wild animals can decimate you and you base is widely out of place making it a target for raids.After 3 days of running around getting materials and avoiding fights i had a solid Metal base 3 layers thick with multiple doors and i thought "Now i can rest and start working on guns and other protections over the next few days." So i signed off and went to bed. Woke up the next day and my base was gone. All my items were gone but the other 2 bases near me were fine... Thats Rust in a nutshell.Dont have friends who play? Dont get Rust.Dont have 8+ hours to devote to a game per day? Dont get Rust.Dont like running around naked and getting shot at? Dont get Rust.Its not a BAD game its just way too difficult for what it should be this game shouldnt be a full time job. When you spend 3 days making a nice place and it gets destroyed in a night really makes you wonder why you started playing in the first place. I wont be playing again.

review: Edit 08/29/2015 Okay so I thought I would give this game another whirl seeing as how a lot of the reviews have gone from negative to positive. I fired it back up and it is a fantastic game now. The graphics are stunning and there is finally no more wild hacking being done. They have changed the crafting system as well as quantity of resources. I am happy to say that this game is once again fantastic and I look forward to playing it a lot. Changed from not recommened to definitely recommended.**** DO NOT BUY****Okay so at first this game had A LOT of promise. There were days I really looked forward to playing the game after work and seeing all the funny fights between naked dudes with rocks. Now though.... It's different. There is so much hacking and cheating it is unreal. They have programs online where you can pay like $20 a month and be able to do pretty much anything. I watched a friend use it once and he could press like F5 and everybody on the map would pop up with a box around them. Then he could press F2 and kill them from anywhere on the map then pretty much fly to where that guy was at and steal all of his stuff he had on him. He also had infinite C4's which was ridiculous. Graphics wise I can't really complain. For being an Alpha game the graphics are actually really nice looking once you turn it to the "Beautiful" setting. Fires looked great as well as pretty much everything else.I just miss the days of night trolling. Nights on here get dark. Like REALLY dark. At times when it was night I would go around and try to creep people out. The way voice chat works on the game is if you're really far you're barely audible. But if you're close you can hear the other person just fine. So I would go around to these run down shacks where I knew somebody was at due to like a campfire and maybe the people inside talking to themselves. At that point I would keep my distance and play "Tiptoe through the Tulips" by Weird Al. People would stop talking and immediately extenguish the fire and run out with just a gun to kill whoever was doing it. But now I can't do that thanks to the hackers. Now I just get killed by a hack as soon as I start (3/10 Will not be playing again. DO NOT BUY THIS GAME

review: What's the objective in Rust? For most people in Rust it's establishing a base that you can defend while you learn new technologies and advanced from a rocket wielding naked to a fully geared killing machine.There are multiple roles you can take in your group. You can hunt people and steal whatever they are carrying you can harvest resources raid bases explore monuments or be the dedicated builder in your group.There are many sandbox elements in this game which allow for a lot of creativity. You can chat up your neighbors and try to form an alliance but can you ever really trust them?Cons The biggest problem in rust is unbalanced mega clans. The team that has the largest number of player hours to spend dominates every time. You have no chance if you play solo. This could be fixed by implimenting something like factions in game but there's nothing on their current road map to address it.The meta game. If you want to optimize your chance of not being raided you need to build specific base designs. Being creative will give you a good chance of being raided.
title: Rust

review: Rust is a hardcore survival game with a heavy focus of player interaction and raiding. The game revolves around talking to people and forming different types of relationships whether good or bad. These relationships alter the way you play and can dictate whether you are peaceful to your neighbors or wild savages that become their worst nightmares.Everything in this game is nerve racking and tense regardless of how many hours you have under your belt. I find myself feeling the same emotions the same fear the same rush the same nerve racking tension that I felt when I first got the game and it doesn't get old. The game feels ruthless and the more you play the more you see your own ruthless tendencies.Other than blade or gun fights the game allows you to raid your enemies. Building a base is a must as you're going to need a place to stash your goods. At any point with enough materials you can attack a rival's base bombarding it with explosives. Raiding becomes a game of strategy in which the defender must use their base and its layout to take down any attackers or at least outsmart them and run them dry of firepower. Regardless of the results of a raid it's an intense feeling being part of one and the rush alone is worth it.Facepunch the developers of the game have shown an extreme dedication to the game. They push regular content updates harsher anti cheat and quality of life improvements. These arrive monthly and throughout the game's early access development have always given us a reason to keep playing.Lastly Rust isn't for everyone. It's a very harsh toxic and blood thirsty world full of savages ready to spear you down in an instant. If you can handle it Rust can offer small rays of hope in a dark desolate place. Small towns are sometimes formed trading posts bustle with industrial product and sometimes you meet people that stick it through the thick and thin with you.I highly recommend Rust for one reason alone. The bonds you create with others within the game aren't like those in any other. It's an experience you must try for yourself to understand. It's not easy to survive but when you do and you do it with others it becomes a whole different game.

review: Update 11/30/2017I really like this game it's not a bad survival type of game and it functions pretty well.But this game probably has the most toxic player base I've ever encountered. Now of course in PvP you're going to die here and there that is a given. But between hate mongering and people who act to almost cruel degrees it makes this game extremely difficult to enjoy.Example Get shot by player I'm annoyed and ask if he can at least not kill me. He picks me up gives me back the resources he looted off me and says he's "sorry." No more than a couple seconds later he puts an arrow through my head and laughs. Another game where people calling themselves "pirates" somehow changed all my door locks in less than one minute which only increases my loathing for PvP gameplay. Along with this one thing I've noticed a high amount of people in this game act rather immature and do everything ranging from idle threats acting profane and being plain rude. Most of all though I do understand it almost all players are kill on sight no questions asked even when your fresh off the beach nude and armed only with a torch and a rock while they're sporting an assault rifle.But of course there are plenty of people who can be very friendly. Though most are located within the PvE servers and seem rare to find in the PvP aside from people who run hotels. But most friendly people will express a healthy cautiousness of other players they don't know KoS doesn't apply to that group.As for the game itself. The graphics look pretty good. Nothing mind blowing but things like lighting and shadows are fairly well don and textures remain consistant thoughout. Plenty of graphics options to get things tuned to your likeing which is always a plus. Though some textures or actions look a little weird here and there the game is still receiving updates so this is a plus as well.Gameplay feels pretty solid. Though a bit grindy depending on what your doing or what server your in. But there's a great range of servers to choose from. Everything from battle royals high resource count servers which create a battle that spans the island roleplay and PvE servers and a few others with their own additions in the modded servers.All in all I really like this game but a majority of the player base are incredibly immature and it appears that majority are in their teens. The only other game I have to compare the player base too is GTA Online. People just being rude and thinking ruining others experiences are fun when their just out trolling. So honestly my recommendation is a soft yes but a yes no less. But this game isn't for people who are tempermental.I will say I'm done with this game for the time being. Far too many hackers. Between changing the locks on metal doors in thirty seconds aim bots and fly hacks I'm honestly done.Update 11/30/2017 The hacking situation is getting worse servers are dying faster. Game is becoming a bit more balanced and sharper looking. But I have to say something very specific about this game well it's advert on it's Steam store page. It's lies. You're first day in Rust will not be peaceful. The first few minutes will not be peaceful. It's trailer should show you waking on the beach cutting some wood and then suddenly it cuts to a fully geared individual running down the beach with an automatic weapon mowing down naked people while making inhuman noises into their microphone. That is all for this update.
title: Rust

review: Great game with original gameplay. However new players need to go into this game with a certain mindset.Gameplay Players need to be able to commit multiple hours to a play session. trying to play for 30 minutes at a time will get you nowhere fast. You will have setbacks in this game and will almost certainly be killed multiple times or have your base demolished before you figure out how to survive for longer periods of time but that is the point of this game. To Figure out how to survive. While you can play this game solo it is 10x more fun to play with friends or have a clan. This makes it harder for you to get greifed and a overall better experience as playing solo will get very lonely the majority of the time as pretty much every random player you meet will try to kill you on sight.Development This game has received major overhauls and is currently recieving major updates on a weekly basis. The devs listen to community feedback and have an overall great commitment to getting this game out of early access and into a full game status. This game is probably the single greatest example of a early access developed game as most other titles have lost dev support or ended up bascialy being scams.10/10 Would recommend to anyone who loves FPS Survival or teambased games.

I FINALLY GOT AN M249 AGAIN AND I HAVE MY BASE NEAR THE SHUTTLE LAUNCH SITE SO I AM REALLY RICH. review: Used to be so much more fun. With the introduction of all the new elements it really is just not the Rust that people had come to love. I would say that the blueprints are its biggest downfall. Now if you want to make anything in the game you must either get blueprints through random drops or pay heavy amounts of scrap for. It was a bit of a grind before but now the grind fest is just too much. I really hope they take away the blueprints. That would bring me back to this game. But for now I really do not see any point in continuing with the game in this state. Or maybe if they were to release an old version too before all these updates that would be really cool. They tried upgrading the game but just ended up downgrading it. Really sad.

review: I love this game it is my favorite game. The graphics are great the community is but thats ok. It is hard as a solo player but a lot easier with another person. not everybody is a i have gone outside my base and made friends with man people. Some guy and his group raided me as a solo plaer and now we are pretty much best friends. I say all you have to do is make friends and you will be fine. I recomend this game to everybody. I think it is a great game with huge potential. EDITED VERSION Current version of Rust is still a lot of fun but for me where I don't have much time to play a game it is very hard. The blueprint system they added makes the game more grindy. You have to play for a very long time to get things simple like pipe shotguns or armored doors. You need to gather a lot of scrap to craft these things and it is a high amount of scrap. I still think the game is fun but it is just to much to play.

review: Review Contents Abstract Gameplay Graphics Biomes Audio Performance Bugs Final Verdict 1. Abstract Rust is an online survival game that puts you against the elements and other players. The video shown on the store page does not accurately depict the gameplay. Yes you will have many intense battles only if you play the hours of grinding before hand. The game in its current state (First day post release) is playable doubt its worth $40 to anyone. In this review you will be reading my perspective on the game may not reflect everyones but I have over 100 hours in it most of which were played in Legacy Rust (pre unity 5) less than half on unity 5 and then 10 ish hours post release. 2. Gameplay Rust's gameplay is very grindey to start with but this isn't the most boring grind on earth. You need to learn the mechanics of the game to enjoy it a short few youtube tutorials should get the game going. Playing with friends is a sure way to also get your money's worth. The grinding is to get materials for the crafting system. The crafting system is well designed with a tiered system requiring different tiers of tools to create better weapons. Ontop of the tiered system there is a certain level of unlocking to do it's not through a pay wall or through a grind wall. You can unlock by finding blueprints by scavenging dangerous areas or by researching the item you want to create in the future by finding one and using research tools. The PVP aspect is where the game shines but also takes a dive. The PVP is well made great netcode great gameplay. Only issue with PVP is that most people are s you will forsure get killed many times as soon as you start the game dying without a chance to achieve shelter and basic tools makes the game impossibly hard to progress in. If you can over come the horrible people you will forsure have fun. 3. Graphics Graphics are quite impressive although on release day there's still some work to be done. Your character will not render feet but your body can cast odd shadows foliage tends to float and occasionally building bits will clip with eachother although easily fixed by careful placement. During sunrise and sunset the game really shines with the colours day time is nice and bright allowing players to see far for enemies and gather materials far faster. Nights are pitch black scary and the best time for sneaking around. Night time is immersive with how the lighting works when other players run around with torches. Expect nothing short of wonders going into this game. 4. Biomes The biomes in this game deserves its own section facepunch studio went through great deals of changes to masterfully craft the biomes in this game. There are a few biomes to name forests flat planes deserts oasis and caves I'm sure I missed a few. The forests feel really thick with foliage all over the ground thick trees to obscure vision and the audio rustling when you run through the foliage. The desert is baren with occasional sections of cactuses or palm trees. Oasis' form between deserts where you might find horses or pigs to kill you can even set fish traps there! The most interesting and awesome biome are the caves deep webbed caves that go far down have small platforming puzzels and lots of mineable ores. 5. Audio The music in the game is quite minimal very ambient and fitting. You won't find the music overwhelming in any situation though it can feel off sometimes when nothing is happening around you but the music picks up. The sounds of the guns firing is loud and clear allowing players to hear gun fights from afar. 6. Performance I tested the game on max settings on a GTX 1070 i5 6500 and 8gb of ram. On max settings the game ran 99% of the time over 75 fps. Although performance for lower end computers may vary wildly. The settings allow for all sorts of adjustments to allow the game to look and run the way you want. 7. Bugs I mentioned before the foliage tends to float. This probably happens due to the fact that the maps are procedurally generated. Small issue but quite noticable along cliff edges. Sometimes items in your inventory will switch to boxes in troublesome ways I occasionally find myself losing items only to realize the game put them in the storage boxes I was interacting with earlier. 8. Final Verdict The game provides good content for its money if you can learn the game mechanics and have friends to play with. If you plan to play this game solo maybe wait for a price drop to $30 CAD or eqivalent in your currency.

review: Until one can host one's own server rather than either paying for private hosting or playing with a bunch of strangers under the threat of griefing and/or the server going down due to any moronic reason (or simply stopping to pay the host and thusly being closed) plus having to deal with high pings or players you can't avoid (as doing such would force you into servers with higher latencies) this game is not worth buying not because it is bad (for it isn't) but because playing it with friends on a ping friendly and safe server is impossible not because it hasn't been implemented but because a password is required for the game to be playable and as of yet only hosting companies have access to said password.The main problem is not paying for hosting it's being forced to pay for a service I do not need that after having paid for the game already I understand this is an Early Access Game and crashes instabillity and such should be (and are) expected however servers are running! In fact for it to be expected of me to pay for the servers they ought to be rather stable so it's not a stabillity issue.I (and obviously I can't speak for anyone else) don't mind hosting a server even if it might crash or freeze or just die on me out of the blue this is an Early Access Game after all. Renting a server either it is always an option for the people who can't be arsed to port forward and set things up and are not bothered with the problems I brought up in paragraph 1. I expect in the future the release of a dedicated server client for players but until then the game good as it might be or become is simply not worth buying which is a shame because I'll most likely change my review once the server hosting is released. The game as of yet without a 'single player mode' (which I don't know if will ever be implemented as I haven't seen any mention of it) or a server client avaliable is unplayable (to me obviously This is a personal review).I bought the game this early on its develpment because I believed in Rust's premisses I still do this game has a lot of potential and I ween it will fulfill itself as a game that's why though I may not recommend it being bought If you happened agree with paragraphs 1 and 2 I eagerly wait the full release of the game as I'm sure I'll have a lot of fun with it and my friends.Until then Ph'nglui mglw'nafh Spycrab Steam wgah'nagl fhtagn.

review: Rust begins off as a love and hate relationship. But it slowly becomes one of the best survival games you'll ever play. First of let me say Rust is not an easy game. You'll have to be active work hard and learn the game. It's a very time consuming game. The devs are passionate about the game and update it every week non stop with no excuses. But of course theres always some cons about every game. First wipe day is crazy. Servers are full. Everyone is naked and trying to kill you with a rock. Second the servers slowly die down in days. There should be a bonus for staying on the same server. Third raiders can place twig structures anywhere on your base. To me this defeats the purpose of the tool cupboard. SummaryPros One of the best survival games. The devs are passionate and listen to the community Theres building Challenging A new experience every timeCons Wipe day is crazy The servers die in a few days Raiders can place twig structures anywhere at your base.Conclusion I highly recommend Rust. It's a very challenging and fun survival game. There is some cons to the game but it can always be fixed with the dev team. P.S. making a clan for Rust if you wanna join friend me and leave a comment that you wanna join.Thanks for reading my review )

review: This is my review for the game if you are still on the fence. I have had this game for 2 years already with a little over 1k hours. I took a year off because I hated some of the updates. As of 09 OCT 17 I came back because the new blueprint system came back. I love it and hope they keep it.So this game is the most addicting game I have played ever. The grind in it is reasonable and it feels like you have actual goals and when you achieve them it makes you feel accomplished. When you are in combat I have never had the same feeling in any other game. Just the pressure of not getting killed when your inventory is full of loot from a raid or you have been farming wood and stone is just thrilling. I have been fearing for my life not to die and lose all of my stuff and it s every fight every fight I get that feeling if I die I will have to go back out and farm for another 15 minutes if not more just to get all of it back. I love it.The combat in this game has improved drastically. Great weapon selection and fits anyone s fight style if you want to be a sniper in the back they got that or a run and gunner they got that too. Since 2 years ago Everything feels a lot smoother and the combat faster paced. All of the rad towns just look so much more alive since 2015 and now their is harbor gas stations and rocket facility. All of them have a their own personality and benefits to going too. To me it s incredible how much more detailed they are from 2015 from looking like some barebones models to now having plant life growing on them graffiti and rubble all around. Hats off to facepunch .Only thing I can saw to improve the game is to stop listening to the community as much especially the subreddit. It s mostly screaming 14y/o s and just toxic. Their have been many good suggestions but the complaining their is far too much and not enough constructive criticism. Also it would be nice to have official 1 3 man group servers because many of the community or modded ones do not have enough population or die off quickly.I just recently tried playing solo on a official server and it s difficult. Just imagine playing a game on hard mode. That is what playin solo is. Granted I don t want FP to cater to solos or small groups but neither too clans. I believe their is a happy medium and FP will find it through CONSTRUCTIVE CRITICISM. I started playing the game with about 5 guys from work and I believe to get the full rust experience you have to find a group. I felt like I was part of something when I played and legitimately cared when someone was hurt or when we were raiding the relief of finally getting into the loot room and all of us screaming about the loot. This game is great to play with friends and you really build bonds. This game currently is only 20 bucks a low price for the amount you get. If you have it buy it find a group to show you the ropes and enjoy. Also for new players PLEASE read the dev blogs so you know what s going on so you are not blind sided by something. No matter how many times you get killed or raided this game is still very good. This game is special even after a year break I came back too it and plan on keep playing. Buy the game and you will see what I m talking about.

review: This game and I have a love/hate relationship....I credit the developers with this unique experience brought to the steam gaming world four years ago. Legacy Rust had a great community of people. To this day I am still in touch and playing socially with several mature players that I met during Legacy Rust from the U.S. Europe and Canada. Almost 4 years later this game's perhaps younger community has created an unfortunately toxic gaming environment to which many of my original Rust team players now stray away from and with good reason. Still Rust is fun depending on one's "social toxicity tolerance" level on a given day it has stolen many hours of my life due to it's unique concept sandbox setting addictive base building freedom and team strategy based elements.

review: AMD 4.2 gHz 8 cores.16gb RAMGTX 1060 6gbSSD_______________________________________________________________________________A lot of people complain about optimization but with my specs above i get around 100 120 fps on high settings.About the game It's a good game but not perfect. It really take survival to another level and it makes really angry when you lose all your stuff after countless farming. The only thing that bothers me is the update that allowed other people to be able to place ladders and twigs on your base even if they are not authorized to the tool cupboard. And if your are playing solo you are kind of playing the game on hardcore difficulty.Here's some pros and cons.Pros.Good GraphicsMany weaponsGood crafting systemUpdates every weekBuilding system just got better aswell ( it was still good before )Cons.Ladder/Twig update.It's still in early access (although it was released in december 13 of 2013)Community is worse than in cs go but better then in dota.Overall If you are not ready to get killed hundreds of times and lose your stuff then this game is not for you.7/10 Will kill nakeds with rocks again.
