review: They should rename this game to "You're Gonna Die. A Lot. No Really A Lot. We Mean It." We would call it YGDALNRALWMI for short.First love this game it's as addictive as Minecraft or 7DTD combined with the added bonus of you constantly being hunted by real people not AI. Highly encourage anyone purchasing this game to hit YouTube and watch some of the community "get started" videos. If you watch the vids you'll be frustrated for the first two hours. If you don't then you'll be frustrated for many many more.Casual gameply will require some hours. You can't launch the game play for 10 minutes and quit long play sessions are about the only real way to make progress.Once you get the hang of the gameplay and get yourself a cabinet established the game will change a bit. Oh you still die a lot but you'll get the hang of venturing out scavenging/mining resources and returning to base to stash your loot. When you choose a server look for one with a very recent reset or everyone you meet will have machine guns. I found one with a reset two weeks prior and even that was a little brutal but I'm working my way up.The only downside is the long loadtime especially the first time you play a server. The load times are definitely better on subsequent plays but that first one is brutal. Very fun game happy I stumbled onto it. I can see spending hundreds of hours in Rust.
title: Rust

review: This game was "officially" released solely for the purpose of revenue. Wolves still bite you wile facing the opposite direction. lots of cheats and admins only on community servers (if that). the community is full of kids who aren't even supposed to have the game and constant racism and general hate fills the chats. My first experience on the Official Hapis server was like this farmed for 2 hours built base out of stone made furnace made sheet metal doors (including airlock) made boxes logged off next day gathered resources for about 2 hours but log off because work for a living log back on next day find my doors destroyed and new door with key lock stuck inside cant break out leave server. My second experience i decided to go on a smaller server as to decrease the likelyhood of me being griefed as well as hopefully find a community of newer players to trade with and overall have an enjoyable experience play for 4 days over break making a large house and trade with a few players log on fifth day died by (Chinese characters) while offline spawn nearby and head back to base completely intact no doors broken hmmm go inside go through 6 airlocks closing doors behind me and find my inner lootroom stairs destroyed as well as TC everything else fine including walls get shot in back by (same Chinese characters) return again only to see them seal the base off just so i cant use it they leave I give up on game.Overall the game can be fun but playing something for a few days straight only to have some cheater log on and ruin it all as well as monthly wipes is not my idea of fun i would not recommend the experience to anyone. They need to change some things to make the players work together or focus on another foe altogether or have some in game punishment for griefing or destroying people unprovoked such as a heli and group of scientists. until then this game is a pointless grind.
title: Rust

review: First impressions are it would be an amazing game but as usual the kiddies who really should not really be playing this sort of game just have to go and ruin it for everybody with their toxic attitudes. It's a shame there are not any servers that implement an age verification system as i imagine playing this on a server with mature people would be an amazing experience.I also wonder if it was created as some kind of social experiment. It has the potential to change you into some kind of sociopath. When i started playing my mindset was 'I could never loot items that someone else has worked hard to gather' half hour in am desperately hungry and thirsty find a dead body with some food and water on them i loot it and feel bad about it. Another half hour goes by and i am killing and looting people without a care in the world.Update being new i did not know about 'server wipes' so basically once a month all the materials you gather the base you build the weapons and armor you craft as well as everything else you manage to gather gets wiped so every month you have to start all over again. Sorry but that makes this the most pointless waste of time/effort game ever.

review: Oh boy this game is just a chore that doesn't let upFirst off you don't get to customise your character a creative choice by the dev.......that makes no sense. "Oh you don't get to choose in real life so you don't get to choose here" Because in real life I gather wood by hitting a tree wtih a rock after I arrive with nothing but a rock and a torch ........this isn't real life so why deny me a little customisation.Secondly the game makes it needlessly annoying to gather resources. Wood is fine enough stones can only be gathered by finding the small stone clusters on the ground or the minable stones from the very few rocks out of the very many textured rocky areas in the land that you need to get to grips with fast. Most of the time you will be running about trying to find these...then need to worry about your hunger levels which start off drastically low and continue to drop as you run about making a race of who can find the first canned food or chocolate and actually be able to concentrate on normal resources.But it doesn't stop there oh no if you want to build anything and have it last more than a few hours....enjoy stuffing your cupboards full of more resources more running about trying to find stone and other such just to maintain what you have done.Unless you have a lot of friends with you working to help you with this skip it.

review: This game is horrible in its current state. my first life I spawn in and go to a tree when i hear over the voice chat "start chopping that tree down before i add another death to your usless account peasant". He then forced me into becoming a slave and joining his already growing slave labor force. I had 2 other people helping me get wood for theses people with guns. then after we got them a couple thousand wood. they lined us up and shot us. By this point I was a lightly salted but I respawn. I go towards some trees and start to get wood I craft a few basic tools from the wood and rocks near by. then i start to get hit i turn around and there is a bear. "I can take this bear down" I think so I attack it with my spear. It kills me in 2 seconds. By this point I've moved past lightly salted and more into the salt induced coma. i ask in the chat after i respawn "does anyone want to team up?" I rappidly get a responce telling me to kill myself and respawn at the sleeping bag they've made for me. i knew it was a troll but i had nothing to lose so i killed myself. I then respawned in a walled in space with a door and no roof with 5 other people. all we had was the starting rock. then we hear "who ever survives gets to join us kill each other" then out of no where they all started to beat each other with rocks. i died again and waited the the required time before respawning in the sleeping bag. I respawn in and its night and they are all gone and sleeping. so i walk over to get my revenge and kill 2 of them in their sleep before being killed. then they destroyed my sleeping bag so i couldn't do it again. after that I still havent returned to this excuse of a game.0/10 would play "Click the respawn button every 30seconds" game again

review: Great game fun concept and difficulty is just right it's not too easy when you begin making you work to learn and understand the game further progression allows you to understand more of the mechanics of the game and learn how to speed up the process of starting.Basics for starting off Get off the beach preferably into a thicker forest a place that offers protection and gets you out of the main eye sight of looted players begin by collecting Hemp and Wood and the ocassional stone by this time you need to begin thinking about water and food I'd say hunting is your best bet however the more you feel comfortable then I'd say go ahead and walk into a gas station or supermarket. (Fair warning this one is risky) From this look on the map and try to find the best place with easy water access don't worry about food as you can always plant food or hunt either work and if worse comes to worse and you live near enough to clean drinking water just eat other humans...Simply put the game is hard however slowly becomes easier as you get better towards the game and allows you to open up a great game with friends. BUGS There are a few simple bugs that occur killing an animal on a foundation usually glitches the animal through the floor making it impossible to loot or harvest.If you purchase any skins either from the direct store or from the Market you might get the "no icon" bug where it either has no icon in your inventory or has a massive bugges icon.The game also needs some optimization increases personally I don't get many FPS realted issues I can pull just about 60fps at a stable rate but I hear and see a lot of people with the issues.Other then that the game is cleanly made and as already stated brilliant!I love the many differences between textures the attention to detail and the fact no map is the same it gives the game a load of replayability.NOTE Don't play on Community Servers unless incredibly popular most community servers wipe every 4 days due to the fact thier population drops so fast so to get it back up they wipe I'd say go for either an incredibly popular community server or join an offical.Good luck!Still going strong!

review: Rust is yet another early access gone down the drain. If you like killing and trolling rust has now joined the ranks of sooo many game developers catering to one architype player. I recently revisited rust to find many advancements (visuals / stability) but severe gameplay regression. Rather than moving forward with what rust was originally and building upon it It has gone in reverse and has become the empty shell it is today. Whether or not this is developer resources limitation or lack of vision Rust is no longer the really fun and full of potential game I originally purchased....

review: When you first buy the game your experince depends on the server you start on. I started on Offical and didn't like the game that much but i kept playing and found a server I liked which really got me into the game. I think it's an amazing game but it does have its down sides. It has a very toxic community but you can run into some really chill and nice people. All I would say to a noob is "Just keep playing don't worry about dying don't get upset if you get raided and be ready to deal with a toxic community." Rust in my opionion is better with friends or a clan. The game takes allot of time to get good at and learn recole patterns but when you do I insure you that it'll be worth your money.

review: For people who want a quick anwser well there is no really quick anwser because everyone is different but go try it out it's performace is great and graphics are beautiful but be aware that a lot of people are really unfriendly...(Sadly it has become like this before it was a very friendly community now it's hard to find people who are just nice)And now i have played this game for a very long time i even played it cracked but i always knew that i will buy this game even if it is to support it and so i did.But the problem i have with this game is that a lot of people are very unfriendly they don't even let you build anything camp even sometimes trashtalk you...I would highly suggest to ignore those people and if you can have friends playing with you so you will have a higher chance of survival.And then there is the modded servers which are fine but it killed my motivation to play proper vanilla so if you can stay away from it unless you are just fine with playing both.And again i'm not saying that modded servers are bad it's that you get everything really fast and you just don't have any other reason to play really just pvp.And talking about PVP youtubers of rust kinda ruined it with their 'Raid Cams' everyone wanted to be like those clans and missed a very important thing it's a game and people want to have fun and not be sniped from a tower or camped at a spawn.So if you can deal with these problems you are good to go but before that i just want to say that developers are doing a great job of keeping this game alive and fresh i just hope people start changing for the better!Good luck and remmember to have fun!

review: Fun to play with friends but dont trust anyone. No one is really friendly...Edit I'm 2000+ hours in and my honest advice/opinion to anyone looking to play this amazing game is the following. You will need to have no social life. The game takes a ton of hours just to get to a point where you feel you have some sort of level playing field with large clans that basicly have 6 10 people. The blueprint grind on this game is hectic. Especially if you play solo on a heavy populated server. (Low pop servers tend to die out quick and get really boring) Watch youtube movies on how to build a proper base otherwise you get raided instantly and you're immediately discouraged from playing the game again. Best server configuration in my opinion is 2 week wipe. (and 2x resource gathering if available ) The grouping system that's been recently introduced has made the solo gameplay really difficult. So I suggest making friends in game and use the system to your advantage.Besides that the game is really fun. During your wipe you'll experience up's and down's. Killing a semi geared guy with a bow and grabing his loot will give you such a rush but minutes later you'll find yourself raided and lose all of it.Nature of the game so don't get attached to anything you make or loot.

review: This is a game that in regular gameplay requires dedication at the cost of corruption.You build a base and spend hours building it up and someone can undo your progress swiftly with a raid. In fact most raids are offline because you weren't on. You have to invest more time to prevent a raid by gathering materials and resources at the cost of losing more progress because of it. The problem is there's no such thing as an "unraidable base" because of two things. C4 and ladders. C4 is expensive but it can make short work of external walls and ceilings. Next are ladders. You can place ladders and twig on buildings without build permission so nothing stops you from filling gaps with twig or entering your base at practically any floor because of ladders. Because you can basically always get raided and because a lot is at stake people tend to take it personally. I'm not sure if it just attracts toxicity but people tend to get absolutely I'm fine if people say things in a jokingly hostile manner like opening fire on a building saying "FBI OPEN UP" but the people wandering around who kill at random do it mostly for protection as opposed to "I have a voice in my head. It says I need to harvest you for your flesh" that's a chaotic violence that's more fun.In terms of irregular gameplay such as Deathmatch servers and modded the stakes are lowered and your progress is not at as much risk because resources gains are higher or there are restrictions preventing you from losing as much. They reduce the burden of being on as much as possible because radiation and decay are reduced or removed and make it more casual so if you have a life you can spend more time with it than worrying about the responsibilities of having to log in a lot or else risk losing your hard work from building. You can't really put it down unless you're fine with putting it down for a while. Or pick a day on a server that wipes and when it wipes retire for a while. Though wipes itself is flawed because you lose all your progress sometimes not including blueprints but with the addition of multiple new researchable items like electronics which are already expensive it raises the stakes even more and make the cost of actually using them where they're worth it is higher. You need to be dedicated and spend a lot of time while be willing to lose that progress to people who are ether faceless or toxic.
title: Rust

review: Rust is a beautifully made game. The landscapes are detailed the monuments are unique and thought out and all of the building materials items and weapons really fit together in this game well. The sound is awesome hearing the chopper in the distance makes you prepare hearing a sachel raid will bring you in for a closer look and hearing the distinct sound of an AK or M249 will make you want to go jump into the action. No other game has made me use my headset as much every footstep matters. All the amazing content being considered it is the lack of content that really defines this game in my mind. It is a very well done open world concept i especially like the procedural maps each wipe keeping things fresh and exciting. What you do where you build how you interact with people is all up to you and makes for a different experience almost every time you turn it on. There is a lot of reviews and comments about a "toxic community" but there are plenty of servers to consider to help filter your experience. You can go to a map with 200 people running around on it and get killed around every corner or go to a map with 20 and have mixed to even more positive interaction with people. All this being said it is a pvp game and one should expect to be shot at or raided it is simply part of what this game is. I've only been playing a couple of months but the extra content that has been added including balloons and electricity in that time has all been very cool and interesting. The APC heli and cargo ship are challenging yet excellent ways to get high level items and even more fun when others arrive to take whats yours! The game has it's bugs snags crashes hackers (which i did not experience) and im sure these things will continue to be fixed and optimized but the overall game as a whole is very good in my opinion.

review: An open world multiplayer survival game sporting monthly updates that are sure to keep you playing in the next wipe. This game is unique in its wipe mechanic meaning that on the first Thursday of every month when the update hits every server and map are reset completely and players start from ground zero once again. This ensures that everyone has a fighting chance in this game and you won't have to worry about going against players with endgame content while you yourself have but a stone spear while keeping the game feeling fresh.I would highly recommend this fun yet challenging game for anyone looking for an online survival experience! review: Pros Great game decent graphics with good mechanics the process of farming building and upgrading your base is definitely worth your while on the other hand PvP is another amazing style of gameplay you can experience (In case you made it out alive) . highly recommended.Cons Duo trio and clans have the high ground against solo player unless you're a ninja with 196 Meds!You have to have time to be online ALOT or expect offline raid quite often.Community 75% Toxicity 25% friendly. it really relies on your sociality and the team based approach.Advice As you accept victory accept defeat too! dont get stressed out you'll most likely lose all your stuff you might not! Do rage quit it helps to get back on track again after time!Kill or be Killed! Do Not trust anyone at all. you'll be tempted with lots of offers from players. complying to "follow me I have an AK for you" basically you're digging your own grave..Trust me I know.Don't be greedy when looting at high risk level in a second of thought you're dead treasure and a nakie at the beach!Expect to get base raided take a deep breath no need to rush. plan your strategy on how you could handle it as a base owner while enemy's digging your base. you have more attempts to kill the enemy once and for all is a victory! while 1 mistake costs your base!Finally don't get rusted!

review: Rust is a great game that I have thoroughly enjoyed playing over the last three months since i have purchased it however there are some aspects of the game that are very irritating as well as some information on the store page that is quite misleading to say the least.Lets begin with the positives. The game is very fun to play particularly if you have another friend or two to play it with. The community is also not too bad not the worst or best that i have ever seen. However be careful of who you trust in this game cause not everyone is friendly but there is the odd few who you can trust and maybe join forces with. When you get started in this game there really is no limit to what you can do.The negatives that i have is the crappy optimisation of the game more specifically the fact that the game is plagued with a memory leak that eats up all of my 8gb ddr3 RAM making multitasking on my pc an impossibility so checking discord is a no can do unless of course you want to wait forever and risk crashing the game. This RAM issue is very common and leads me onto my second point which is the minimum system specs that facepunch has advertised for rust. More specifically the RAM requirement which states 8GB but not whether you should have DDR3 or 4. I can answer that question very easily it CANNOT RUN on 8GB DDR3 it has been a pain in the for me running this game and apart from chopping wood mining and crafting anything else is verging unplayable especially when there is such a heavy emphasis on combat in this game so you can't really play the game if every time somebody shoots you your game becomes a power point presentation. I can however run on 8GB DDR4 ram according to my friend so if you have that no problem however i would severely recommend upgrading your ram and/ or mobo (if cpu needs replacing).In conclusion i like this game it is really really fun (when it works) however i regret buying it without looking into it more or upgrading my specs beforehand and honestly i would like them to make the game more reliable especially for the money that you have to pay for it now.

review: Do you have a job college or school to attend? Do you have a life that exists beyond the confines of your bedroom? Do you have an obligation to leave the house at all? Then Rust isn't for you.Doing anything is a long and tedious process building your first base will likely take you a couple of hours. You need to have a good chunk of time to invest in just getting set up in whatever server you choose to join but rest assured that if you have anything at all dragging you away from the PC you'll be back at square one when you return.In order to have a base that you can realistically leave overnight without getting raided it needs to be stone/metal with perimeter walls. This takes HOURS of grinding. Your simple wooden shack might survive without getting blown to kingdom come but only if you're really lucky. If you do manage to survive and over time upgrade your base to something a little more robust than a pile of planks then you'll get to experience the joy of raiding.In between chopping down trees foraging for hemp/mushrooms and mining stone you might have crafted yourself a nice little crude arsenal of spears arrows and hatchets. No doubt you'll be feeling proud about this and certainly more secure knowing that you're armed. You might even feel like you're ready for a little PVP... Spoiler you're not . You will get absolutely f*cking shredded as soon as you come into contact with anyone who isn't a naked. You might think that you can band together with others and face the harshness of the Rust world in solidarity with another mortal but you'll be lucky if you encounter someone who isn't going to kill you steal your loot or flat out ignore you. So then as a new starter "raiding" for you will consist solely of wandering the map areas digging through boxes for scrap and cowering in fear whenever you hear another player approach knowing he's going to be fully armoured and sporting an SMG at the very minimum.No matter how much time you've invested in scouring the empty parts of the map for items you'll never be as well equipped as the kids who've been grinding all their waking hours since the last server wipe. Even if the server was only wiped a couple of days ago there'll already be monumental stone and metal bases guarded by turrets. The only way you can get ahead in this game or indeed have any kind of fun playing at an even level is if you and at least two friends can devote HOURS a day every day to grinding and maintaining your base. When I bought this game I was led to believe it was at heart a survival game that rewards co operation and skilful play. The reality is that it's essentially Minecraft with nudity. From the tedious crafting to the aimless gameplay and the autistic shut in playerbase this game apes Mojang's virtual lego in almost every manner except it fails to provide the player with the choice to actually do something else with their time.Frankly the only other thing I can think of that requires this degree of effort and commitment whilst being equally tedious is a full time job. And just in case you have trouble choosing between Rust or a job remember that at least the job pays you.

review: I would not recommend this game to players who do not have friends that want to play with them and players who do not have over 15 hours a day to put into this game going offline for the smallest amount of time is almost certain for an offline raid at the hands of a bigger group who does not sleep modded is a bit more forgiving but does not yield a true rust experience as vanilla does. building is too complicated for new players so they are easy targets for SOME of the toxic community to screw over and take everything they have built up over the multiple hours they have built up. the game used to be better with offline raids only happening 2 3 days into the wipe which is enough time for anyplayer to get a good experience out of the wipe it's enough time for them to experience everything in the game and have fun whilst doing so. Now you can spend 5 6 hours just focusing on building a base and when you log off you can check for big bases around you might not see any but whilst your asleep another group will have stayed up all night building a bigger base than you and then raid you before you can even wake up the next morning. Rust is not worth the $50 Aus to not be able to properly play vanilla if you do not have 15+ hours on your hands each day and a group to work with the only servers that will yield fun and satisfaction will be those that are modded modded is not worth $50

review: Well here we go i started playing Rust when it was still in early access that said it's fair to say i saw a lot of changes through my time playing this game. What is Rust? Rust is a survival game that let's you farm hunt animals build a base and interact with other players that are doing the same thing. I would like to explain how a wipe is played in rust in 3 sectionsWipe A period of time which you play before the server restarts and everyone starts fresh without any bases etc...Early game You first spawn on the beach and with a rock you work your way up to your first base that's usually takes an hour or so depends on what server you play and how lucky are you on the position you spawn. In the early game you will use a bow or a crossbow to protect yourself from other players or animals when you will fell confident enough you will start going to rad towns to loot from boxes and pvp. But the most important thing will always be resources.Mid game You start to get better weapons and you have a good amount of resources to work with your main objective is to get c4 and AK crafted as soon as possible to give you the edge in the pvp's. You will also start hearing explosions of satchels that are going off it gives you the chills if you are going to be the next target.Late game You have all the gear you want you also have the best weapons out there just pvp every time you see someone you feel confident enough to take him out you start raiding the big bases with rockets and c4 if the defenders are online the experience is soooo much better.The game is fun if you play with a group of 3 or 4 you will have tons of fun.PROS The graphics are good maybe not optimized for every graphics card there is but still very enjoyable graphics.Fun to play with friends but you can always play solo if that's your thing.You have so many weapons to choose from so you can pick your style of pvp.The system of crafting and farming is easy to learn and if you don't have the components for the item you want to craft there is always trading with other people that's why there is a server chat.You can make so many different bases layouts it's kinda insane )The devs are very interactive with the community and are also featuring the content creators that are making Rust videos.There are skins for the weapons and also updates every 2 weeks.THE GAME WILL NEVER BE P2W the game is about skill.CONS The community is really toxic.If you don't have a decent internet connection you will not be able to play on the official servers if the closest is still far away from you.ZERGS i have so many complaints about this but i will keep it simple. Zergs are usually 10 or more man groups that usually get the best weapons first and just on the smaller groups that are just starting to get to mid game and you can't really win with 4 friends versus 15 man groups in a small area and if they decide to raid you your base is gone the biggest problem of Rust is toxic zergs and zergs in generally if you ask anyone about zergs everyone will tell you the same thing over and over again. Also i heard of 30 man zergs but never actually seen one on the servers i was playing.I don't play Rust anymore because i lost the hype for playing it and the new updates are not for me liked the old Rust better but that's my opinion. But i will recommend the game to people who like this type of games. There is a ton of gameplay to learn from and also to see how the game actually looks like. The game is a solid 8/10 for me.Gl and HF in the next wipe guys )

review: I Billy Herrington stand here today humbled by the task before us mindful of the sacrifices borne by our Nico Nico ancestors.We are in the midst of a crisis. Nico Nico Douga is at war against a far reaching storm of disturbance and deletion. Nico Nico's economy is badly weakened a consequence of carelessness and irresponsibility on the part of acknowledgement but also on the collective failure to make hard choices and to prepare for a new MAD age.Today I say to you that the challenges are real and they are many. They will not be easily met or in a short span of time but know this Nico Nico they will be met. In reaffirming the greatness of our site we understand that greatness is never given our journey has never been one of shortcuts. It has not been for the faint hearted or who seek the fleshly pleasures. Rather it has been the risk takers the wasted genii the creators of MAD things. For us they toiled in sweatshops endured the lash of the spanking. Time and again these men struggled and sacrificed so that we might ... LIVE BETTER.We remain the most powerful site on the Internet our minds no less inventive and services no less needed than they were last week or yesterday or the day before the day after tomorrow. Starting today we must pull up our pants dust ourselves off and begin again the work of remaking Nico Nico Douga.Now there are some who question the scale of our ambitions who suggest our server system cannot tolerate too many movies. Their memories are short for they have forgotten what Nico Nico already has done what free men can achieve when imagination is joined to common purpose.And so to all the people who are watching this video from the grandest cities to the small villages where IKZO was born know that Nico Nico is a friend to every man who seeks the future of love and peace. Now we will begin to responsibly leave authorized common materials to Nico Nico people and forge a hard earned peace in this MAD world.What is required of us now is a new era of responsibility. This is the price and the promise of Nico NiCommons citizenship. Nico Nico Douga in the face of common dangers in this winter of our hardship let us remember these timeless words WE CAN.Let it be said by our children's children that when we were tested by DOS attacks when we were refused by YouTube that we did not turn back nor did we falter and we carried forth that great gift of freedom be delivered and safely to future generations.Thank you. God bless and God bless Nico Nico Douga.

review: This game is by far the funnest game i have ever played! I dont know how i didnt quit playing when i was new to the game i basically only played solo and would constantly get stomped on but as i got better and better i found it harder and harder to stop playing! this game is great and i would 100% recommend it to anyone especially if they have someone else to play it with. the best thing about this game is the endless possibilitys and how different it is every time i play! if i were to play fortnite 100 times it would be basically the same every time i played but if i play rust for 100 wipes every wipe is different one wipe i might make a shop and a hotel and then the next i might research AK and dominate military tunnels ect. what im trying to say is this game (even though it might make you want to quit at first) is the greatest game ive ever played. &lt 3

review: I reviewed this game in 2015. I played it maybe 20 hours and I gave it a negative review because logging on every day getting raided while at work wasn't fun. Gave it a go in the following years and more seriously here lately. To be honest I only have 350 hours in the game and learned a great deal. But messuring my disapointment vs fun disapointment always seem to win out. Working all weekened to make supplies to raid and getting head shot before you get to use them. Logging in and finding your base has been raided and taken over. Honestly I can get over it and move forward. All apart of learning. But what I can't get past is the scrap grind only to be met with a reset later. All my time is focused on grinding luckyt to get a decent gun which is short lived on how long you can have it before your killed so you never get the exprience to use it correctly. Mean while I could play any FPS game and just be given what is needed to have fun. If I wanted to play a build game I could play something like minecraft and login to all my stuff the very next day. So I find myself asking why don't I just do that? That's exactly what I do each year I try it. See you late 2019 and well see where it's at.

I can get 120 frames on max settings in PUBG easily but in this game I struggle to consistently hit 100 and average somewhere around 80 fps and this is not even at max graphics. review: After starting rust shortly after the component system was introduced this was one of the best games i'd ever played. It was fun and I didn't have to spend all week playing to have fun. After the blueprint system was introduced it is nearly impossible to join a server and stand a fair chance. You will be fighting guys with AKs with your crossbow. Nearly all weapons are locked behind RNG of trying to find the right item to research or blueprint. The scrap system is incredible unbalanced requiring an unimaginable amount of time required to gather enough to even make a high enough tier workbench to even craft weapons. With no balance against clans on offical servers you will spend a lot of your time dying to not more skilled players but trihard teenagers with better gear and more teammates than you. The game requires all of your time to keep any decent sized base up for any long period of time and weapons are not satisfying to use with the exception of the bow and crossbow and a few of the higher tier weapons. This game is not fun solo and you better pray your group is skilled enough to survive. I cannot recommend this game with its current blueprint system.

review: This game is fun but you do need at least one other person that you know personally or that you met in game that you trust. The lonewolf mthod of getting to the top is extremely hard for newcomers raiders and jsut overall game experience cause you need to grind. Having two or more people makes the game more fun in general and can make grinding more interesting. For example if you are getting resources and talking to your friend you could be discussing the game base layouts raid plans etc. But by yourself you are thinking to yourself and feel lonely sometimes. I regret not haveing anyone else that I know play on a computer. Most kids in my school are playing Fortnut on the Xbox and PS4 (looking for a friend). The community can be toxic with people cheating and backstabbing but if you are lucky the game experience will be good. Summary9/10 recommend it bring friend(s) leanr mechanics in low pop server and don't switch servers because the blueprints that you have in one doesn't transfer to the other. I learned this the hard way by only going into one server and got raided. Lost my entire base. Raged and promised myself not to ever go into that server. Went into a different server and needed to start from scratch. It really frustrating when you are near endgame with electricity and stuff.

review: Rust is a hardcore survival game that heavily focuses on pvp elements with pve as flavor. Yes people get clans together to dominate servers but that happens on every game with servers that's within or even remotely similar to the genre. The gunplay is good each map is beautiful and unique and the experiences cam be priceless. Is it worth $34.99? Yeah but I'd grab it on sale or on because why wouldn't you? The best part of this game though is the developers. They released a game on early access and they delivered whole heartedly. FacePunch Studios contiues to update this game every single month with updates on what people in the community are up to as well just to keep everybody a little strung together and in the know on what's poppin. Grab some friends play Rust and have fun. will happen.

You also need to keep up with updates and changes which happen every week or 2. The community isnt as toxic as people make out. Modded servers are great. The occasional cheater. review: My first review.After years of playing the old version of rust i decided to give it another go.after loading up the game i wanted to play single player just to see how things work there is none your forced to play on a server. So i decided lets take a server with less players the lowest was around 30 aftter loading the game ( took almost 30 minutes) i landed on the beach and decided to lower the graphics down a bit.The game tells you what to do like gather 100 wood and so on i never got to the point of finishing the quest why well the game shows its true color you get killed alot by other players people in full gear and ak 47 or bows that are hunting noobs because they cant fight back and there to scared to lose there gear to other players that are geared to the teeth.Ill call this game the bullies simulator.Iff you like been killed over and over again getting not even to the building base part then this game is for you.Looking around to find stone thinking there are so many mountains and big rocks but you cant mine them no its those weird looking stones with a small sun shining on it those can be mined.Not to mention it takes 100 wood to make a simple wooden spear.You would probebly say why not go to a differend server i did i even encounter a guy who cheated and i got 1 shotted by a ak 47 from far away.I cant recommend a game that has a toxic community that like to kill and humiliate new players iff you die they take your stuff and iff they dont need it they drop it somewhere so it despawns.

review: I actually do love this game it looks like I have more hate for it than love but thats not true. I may not have alot of hours in this game but I do have the understanding of rust's mechanics. I am a guy who mostly loves FPS games since I was a child and this is just a unique one ( off ark)You start with a rock and a torch you hit some tress down get a stone node get a hatchet and pickaxe build a base and then the rest of the path is in your hands its truly magical what the paths can lead up to but it can be a rollercoaster of emotions.What I love Just pop into a server and start doing what u are able to go from nothing to a king having the feeling of winning 1 v 3 battle raid someone and it actually being worth it learn everything once and be able to craft it all the time until the server wipes actually finding someone who won't betray you (super rare like a shiny pokemon) having people around with an actual mic so you can negotiate something getting your first gun is a incredible feeling having a great start in a freshly 100+ player wiped server not dying getting to the dome top or the water treatment plant parkour the bandit camp has been a pretty good addition in my opinion.well I listed everything I really love about rust theres no way its perfect tho.What I HATE in rust 1) Most of the people in a rust server cause they don't ever use a mic2) When exploring barrels you can get blueprints like 5 or so no one needs them JUST ADD MORE RANDOM BLUEPRINTS FFS THAT ACTUALLY HELP 3) Getting raided as a solo player against 3 fully geared guys who know they wont get materials to break even spending 4k of sulfur (kys but to be fair solo players should stick to solo servers5) optimization of the game is aids I play on very weird and mixed up graphics why cant it just be more simple and understanding for everyone?6)I love losing all my progress by a guy with a semi auto in a server that was wiped 5 hrs ago 7) I mean you still may be in denial about it BUT DONT TRUST RANDOM PEOPLE IN RUST ITS JUST A SCIENTIFIC FACT8) Getting outplayed but a guy with worse gear and beating you is super infuriating9)Compound bow is dog thanks. Nailgun is even better.10) You killed a guy who had a custom smg? TOO BAD FOR YOU SMG BODYS ARE SO ING RARE (not rly green crates just look for places with green crates like Dome top or something casual like a supermarket its a 17% chance for it out of them) SEMI BODY'S ARE SO MUCH EASIER TO FIND LIKE CMON.11) as a wise man once said ' YOUR SKINS' fREAKAZOID 2k1512) Some people say some of the dumbest on the planet in this game no joke. (if they even can talk)13) Getting spawned and chased by a guy with a bow.14) random pernament characters I get what the creator wanted to do with this BUT LET US CHOOSE THAT TO SOME EXTENTIf you want to buy the game 1) actually have a good pc 2) store this on SSD ONLY3)if u have money sure buy it full price I would recommend for a sale tho.4) understand that this will make you a sick degenerate person.5) your gonna want to ragequit a lot but never give up.YEEET

review: If the game was still back in it's original BP's and XP stage I wouldn't be able to find fault in this game at all. This is to this day probably the game I've enjoyed most coming on every day and grinding the game for multiple hours on end with friends. It's given me probably the most saddest of times when you farm a full inventory and loose it to a naked with a bow and the greatest times raiding and gaining the best of loot.Atm the stage where it's at the Component/BP stage. It's a game you basically cannot play solo unless you play on a strictly SOLO ONLY server.. Most of the times you'll be killed by 3+ groups while you're roaming around farming or going on scrap runs and it gets pretty frustrating.I would recommend this as a 8/10 for now and i'm still wishing that they renewed the good old bp's.

review: I see a lot of complaints but pretty much everything some people hate about this game is fixed on modded servers. Don't like the grind? Go to a 5x gather rate server. Don't like having to supply your tool cabinet? Go on a no decay server. You want to explore and get used to the game without dying every 5 minutes? Go on a low pop server. You want to log on and instantly go kill someone with a big rock? Join a 300 man server. Whatever playing style you like there's a server for you.But no matter what....expect to die and get raided. I probably was killed 10+ times before I got my first kill. And just remember...just because you're naked and just have a rock doesn't mean you can run up on a guy with assault rifle and kill him. I've done it! I've also been the guy that got taken out by 2 spear chuckers when I had an SMG.

review: The last time I reviewed this game I gave it a thumbs up.Now I can't recommend it anymore.The gameplay is fun and challenging base building is awesome and seeing everyones creativity in how they make their base to counter raiders can be very unique and interesting. For most the climatic moment of this game is when you/your group finally has farmed up enough to which you are loaded with gear weapons ammo and C4 and are reading to go out and raid some major base and have a big battle against the Base Home Owners and counter Raiders. For me the climatic moment of this game is after building my base w/ my group the base being put to the test and defending our loot and home against the army of +5 &gt +10 raiders.However overall the community and the games current state ruins it all... AdvancementWant to be geared up with the top notch guns armor and base defenses?1. Find a AK (very rare) (can take hours)2. Farm up a bunch of scrap (can take up to 30mins)3. Research the gun using a blueprint bench w/ your scrap to guarantee blueprint (gun breaks)4. Farm up supplies to make the AK since the last one broke (also rare) (can take hours)5. Craft your AK!Congrats you have a AK!Now do this process again for the AK ammo(s) (regular explosive high velocity) Pistol ammo(s) Thompson Pump shotgun Shotgun ammo(s) Turret Shotgun trap Bolt rifle Sub gun Semi rifle Rocket launcher Rockets C4 Revolver Python Revolver Semi pistol Chest plate Face mask Bucket helmet Garage doors Giant walls LR 300 (Assault Rifle) M249etc.I think you get the point.Unless you're lucky enough to find the blueprint while you're gathering resources it's going to take days to perhaps even weeks before you get even a fraction of good gear equipment and base defenses. All in which time you will likely get attacked and raided and have to rebuild your base and refarm the resources for upkeep.&gt As a solo player that is. If you're lucky maybe you can find a group of players who already have the blueprints that will get you farmed up. But good luck finding a group to join.Solo playing vs Team playingUnless you're a pro the only way to enjoy this game is with friends.&gt The only way to be successful is if you have a group of +2 players.Good luck finding anyone to team with as no one is looking for teammates.If you do manage to find people to team with there's a chance you may be betrayed by them because they joined another team.As a solo noob player good lucking gathering resources to build your base repair the base keep supplying your tool cupboard to keep your base from decaying away and creating tools/weapons to match the other players around you. You'll never make a base that can defend against the groups of dedicated players that farm up C4 all day and are all geared up. while you are still stuck with crossbows / basic weak gun weaponry. You'll never be able to raid your gear back from those dedicated players when their base is huge filled with traps turrets armored walls/doors large walls surrounding it multilayered walls (hunnycombing) etc. as making just 1 C4 can take forever to get the ingrediants for let alone getting the blueprint to be able to make it in the first place and getting the weapons and armor to match fighting the other groups while also being outnumbered etc.ZergsRust used to have an issue with lots of zergs.&gt Aka groups with mass amounts of players that dominate the server.And some servers still have many zergs.Servers have begun countering this by making server rules that are Solo Duo and/or Trio groups only.But this just leads to a new problem in which you have a hard time finding a group to join since everyone is either already maxed or satisfied and untrusting of bringing in new players to their group.Casual vs Pro/DedicatedIf my previous points haven't made it clear already you can't really play and enjoy this game as a casual. This game is a grind fests. Constant farming to keep your base standing while also trying to advance to be able to match the players who have teammates.Closing ReviewI criticized this game when they removed blueprints in exchange for the XP system in which you unlocked blueprints through farming however before the XP system blueprints were not extremely rare and resources to make equipment / weapons were not rare either.&gt It wasn't quick either but getting everything didn't take weeks of farming (solo player).It seems that with every update the developers are trying to find more ways to make players grind. Trying to slow the pace of the game more and more.I used to hop on this game every few months to see the new updates. I would slave for a group until I earned their trust and I would join that group and assist in raids defending farming etc.Now it seems no one is looking for slaves no one is looking for additions to their team.The game does seem to be taking a direction into PvE by adding NPC Scientists and Bandits along with Outposts giving some sort of civilization which adds a Fallout vibe.&gt Hostile Scientists (Blue Scientists)&gt Bandit Outpost (Friendly NPC Bandits but NOT a Safe Zone) and Military Outpost (Green Scientists / Safe Zone)However the NPCs are currently broken with having perfect accuracy.Plus the Attack Helicopter that has been in the game for a while the Tank etc.I know its cliche as everyone else says the same thing but "the community is toxic".Its very difficult to find anyone to team with so you'll likely be stuck solo unless you have friends who already own the game or plan to buy the game with you.You won't get far solo unless you become a pro and invest the majority of your life to grinding and playing all day and night.I am hoping for the old Rust to come back.&gt Not Legacy as that is already availableBut I am hoping for team finding to become easier in the future and for this grindfest to be toned back down some.In it's current state find some other game. If you don't have friends to play with this game will be a stressful waste of time bore of a grind...

review: Rust It has its ups and downs. While it is a very nice looking game and is fun to play there are a couple negatives to counter it and even the playing field out.Graphics Exceptionally good sunsets are very nice IMO. Large forests and open areas both look beautiful. If you want to pump up your graphics you'll need a pretty nice PC to get acceptable frame rates. Although there are a lot of hardcore players on here to get the best performance PVP wise you need to tweak your graphics to see other players with the best quality.Gameplay Very fun to play with a group of 3 or more. Gives the battlefield more diversity and it allows you to make some admirable plays on enemies. Even larger groups make it hilarious to play as you mostly mess around with eachother and roam. The larger the group the more you dominate. Friendliness is a give and take. Too much friendliness leads to you losing most of your items and gets you killed. But enough friendliness lets you team up with others and can lead to some pretty cool raids or PVP fights. Be careful who you team up with though. Lots of backstabbers in this game that are selfish for loot.This game requires a mid tier amound of farming but that depends on what kind of server you play. The server browser allows you to make your own server as well as choose from modded vanilla and custom build servers. Custom servers let you train and get a feel for what most of Rust is like. This game has its wins and losses. Don't make any stupid moves that you think is logical but could cost you hours of farming. Treat everything with care and make sure you design your base well so it has a better chance against raiders. Location of your base is key if you want to succeed. On the flip side if you're the one raiding make sure you know what you're doing. Explosives are valuable and rare in this game so wasting them will cost you. Make sure your friends are trained to play this game. Watch your back. Have fun playing solo. Community Whoa.I would divide the community of Rust into 5 sections The nice people the zergs the tryhards the toxic and the suspicious cheaters. Everybody except the nice people have a fair amount of toxicity. 10% tryhards 25% cheaters 35% toxic 20% zergs 10% nice people overall. The cheaters will always dismiss that they're cheating and will rain toxic comments down upon you to make them look better. Before I forget There is an overwhelming amount of younger kids on here. They're annoying cocky as hell and get super toxic when you have the upper hand.Early Access That's about it it's in EA. Only problems with this is bugs can be found optimization could be improved and there is a chance of future updates that could ruin the game. That being said about EA let's move on to the PRICE.PRICE It's not worth $35 IMO. If it were a full game with a little bit more content sure. I'd say right now it's worth $20 $25. Wait for it to be on sale. Sure it's fun and it has its moments but this game has been out for 5+ years. TL DR This game is often toxic full of cheaters and little kids but the graphics are pretty nice and gameplay is always diverse giving you hours of endless play. Super fun to play with groups that know what they're doing. The occasional disoriented player in your group is fun too. Just don't let them go out with a full metal kit and an AK.7.5/10.

review: I used to play this game back in legacy. I loved it then. Now it is a completely different story and nothing but a waste of time in the end. Unfortunately that's how it will always be.This game is a breeding ground for the worst types of behaviors that can come out of people and perpetuates its own toxicity by actively punishing players who try to play without being rude and rewarding players who are. Because of this the community will always be one of the most poisonous and disgusting things that i've ever seen come out of a game.All the things that make this game great... or should I say once did are now what cripples the game. The combat system is fast paced and gets your adrenaline going the downside is that the combat (a VERY large part of the game) is also completely broken. Hitboxes are about as fine tuned as CS 1.6 guns are sloppy and have no actual feel to their weight or usage. The survival aspect of the game is all but gone. Food and water? Nah not important just pick up the hundreds of scattered mushrooms all over the ground and you're set. This once great survival game now no longer has any survival aspect to it the goal of the game is a rush to gather resources and blueprints build a base raid people and then have the server restart two weeks later so you lose your progress. Imagine playing a campaign game GTA V for exmaple getting to the final moments right before the final heist and your game crashes and corrupts your save and makes it unplayable. That is what the game in turn forces on to everyone.Want to know why servers have to restart every two weeks to a month? It's because the game lacks any sort of balance and in the end it corners server owners to have to restart the game so that it "levels" the playing field. In reality this doesn't fix anything. Once it's wipe day zergs come to the rescue to loot everything build a massive base and then proceed to raid everyone else without any challenge thus making it impossible for anyone that has a group of four or less to survive and actually progress.TL DR Quick List VERY POOR Optimization Broken Combat Unrealistic Weapons Unbalanced Awful Community NOT NP Friendly ZERGS Galore Overly Complicated For What It Is Lack Of Actual ProgressIf any of that sounds fun to you go ahead and "enjoy" the game. As for me i'll go ahead and leave this game uninstalled until the end of time wanting for the days of legacy when the community was good and the game was fun.

review: I feel as if the game has so much to offer now that I have returned and feel fresh than ever. The game is best played with a team because you can gather resources faster you can farm faster and you can fight others together! Do not get me wrong teams can get defeated if the right player is on the other side of the battlefield. If you are going to be the only one playing you are going to have an issue with the word Zerg (basically a group of people) The game requires strategic playing and awareness very primal survival adds another layer of showing that even if you have just started you can defeat a geared player. You might not like the game at first but a few hours in and you will get the feel that's how everything works. The game is also built off of servers meaning there are servers that are easier than others (loot wise) To wrap this up I have a few more player to player advice The game is a grind you need to play a minimum 5 hours a day to ensure up keep on your base as well as getting weapons PVP and getting loot. Do not rage quit even if you have been farming for 30+ minutes and you get killed it happens to everyone (it's part of the game) you have to be willing to take the risks. To finalize everything I said Great game to kill time kill off people and actually feel amused by taking your hard earned loot and getting better. The game also offers amazing base building where you can store your valuable loot from other players and to craft items. But be careful others can raid it and steal it all!I suggest you watch some youtube videos on the game and see if you like it!

title: Rust

review: After playing rust for over 250 hours I can safely say that this game is not for everbody. It really appeals to a very hardcore audience.Pros Very Engaging while playing Rust it can feel like time flies by if you are having a great time. I have had a lot of nights were I will get on at 8 00 and I will be shocked to check my phone and have it display the time 11 00. Great Pacing If you can "get gud" you can have a base and loot withing a few hours on wipe day and the grind isn't super long and tedious like in other survival games (like Ark). It is all paced so that a small group of maybe 3 5 people can reach end game within 4 days and go raid and have fun for the rest of wipe easy to start Each server in this game has a wipe cycle which means they wipe the server of bases change the map and may clear all learned Blueprints on a regular bases. This makes it really easy to start on wipe day were everybody starts from the ground up and if you don't make very good progress just start again the next week or find a different server that has a different wipe schedule.Cons Toxicity is a huge problem Players in Rust will gladly kill you on sight whenever they see you even if you have nothing. Hell when you spawn on the beach with nothing but a rock and a torch you may be suprised to see another naked trying to kill you just to get your rock. I don't know why people even do this maybe they don't like the way there rock is looking at them so they want yours or they just think "HAHAHAHA I just killed this other naked with a rock EVERYBODY LOOK AT ME IM A GOD." Whatever the reason people do it so be prepared. Zergs a Zerg is a huge clan with at least 10 or 13 consistent members that are consistently online. These groups can be really fun to play in and I myself have met some awesome people by joining these clans but going against them is going to make your life a living hell. If you are on an official server solo you are pretty much screwed. You will constantly be mowed down by these groups who accumulate gear like a hoarder accumulates trash. Playing alone is super hard Playing solo is like playing Rust on Ultra Mega Hardcore even for experienced players. If you don't have friends that play rust or can team up with you expect a lot of frustration. The Skill Gap Calling the skill gap between new players and experienced players a "gap" is like calling the ocean a puddle. This usually isn't a problem in games because usually experienced players play against experienced players but this is not at all the case in rust. Everybody is thrown onto the same servers which means that you are going to consistently encounter players with 500 1000 2000 or even 5000 hours in the game. They may be nice to you but many out of fear or their twisted ways will try to kill you the moment they see your ugly mug. And often they will succeed in their efforts of turning your skull into another trophy.AdviceBeing a new player can be extremely hard so here are some things that helped me when I first started out Try to get your friends to buy the game If you can get just a few people to buy the game with you then you will have 10x more fun. Even though you may still die and lose progress it will be way less painful if you have some people to support you. Play on a modded server Even though I personally think vanilla Rust is the best way to experience the game playing on a 2x 3x or even 4x server can help you learn the mechanics of the game at an increased rate and with much less punishment for failure. Play on a server that restricts player group size If you are playing solo or with a group up to three playing on a server that only allows for solo duos and trios can eliminate the threat of zergs which is one of the biggest challenges a person can face. ConclusionRust is honestly one of my all time favorite games because of its challenge and mechanics. It can be really fun to try and compete against other players but expect to get your handed to you on a silver platter until you can learn the games mechanics and get semi decent at PvP. All in All I would give rust at least a 8/10 because this game when it comes down to it is a beautifully crafted survival game that is usually spoiled for new players by its community but if you can get past that early frustration you may find yourself loving this game.

review: This games difficulty slider is the number of people you play with. Play with a 10 man zerg and it's super easy. Play solo is ultra hard permadeath I hate my life mode. As soon as you understand this lesson you will start to appreciate the game. If you don't you end up like that poor guy from Gamespot and hate it. This game is not beginner friendly but if you master it it becomes the best game you've ever played.Everything you acquire in this game can be taken away. You die people can steal your stuff your base can be raided for all your posessions and after a few weeks the server wipes and everyone looses everything. The joy you get from this game is not permanent achievements a high experience level or constant shooting like other games. It's overcoming difficult situations outwitting and outplaying others. That rush you get when you acquire a powerful piece of equipment and make it home alive is unique and you can't get it in any other game. Just beware the rage when you loose everything is emotionally tilting as well so be prepared ).

review: I've played this game for 660 hours and as much as it pains me to give a negative review on a game I loved for so long I feel that I have to. This game was VERY good at points. But now it is just people who KOS clans or zergs of people (big groups of people). I still play this game on a regular basis but I can't say I enjoy it. Rust is just a big grind to build a decent base and as an almost solo player (I have a partner who sometimes gets on) it is hard. I get raided atleast once every wipe from a big clan or when I'm offline. It is impossible to defend your base while your offline. I know raiding is one of the key elements of Rust but when a group of 12 people come to raid me there isn't much I can do. Which brings me on to my next point clans. Clans/zergs are a HUGE problem in this game. I can't count how many times I've been roaming and getting destroyed by a huge group of people. FPS is a one of my biggest problems in this game. I have a decent PC GPU 750ti CPU i5 4460 RAM 8gb Ripjaw. It runs most games no problems. I am aware this game is in early access but come on its been 3 years now. I average about 45 FPS with discord and steam only open. That's not including the the ever so often drops to 1 2 FPS I get about every 5 minutes which last a good 10 seconds. I have died so many times from this. I would only reccomend this game if 1. You have friends to play with 2. If you have a decent PC 3. If you know someone with backround knowledge on the game (It is hard to get a grasp on the game by yourself) That is the end of my review but in my situation I can not reccomend this game.

review: This is a great game depending mostly on pure skill + experience and the situation you are in. Ive always loved waking up on the beach to some random kid screaming while smacking another kid over the head with a rock. The difficulty truly varies between these factors Who you play with What server you play on Your skill and experienceI remember one of my first memories in rust where i didnt know how to make a furnace. Playing a wipe on a server has tought me something new about the game every week ive played. Almost everyone who plays over wipes slowly turns into a cold blooded killer.If you are a new player looking to buy this game or who just recently purchased it watch youtube tutorials teaching you how to start off. You can also learn from a friend who is willing to teach you. Ive tought many friends how to play since they first got the game and its more like a job than a game. All you have to do is listen to your more experienced friends and you will learn fast. There are also many servers that are meant for practice which helped me alot.I recommend this game to dedicated people.

review: Y'know sometimes you need time to actually understand things.I will be brief the game is good it is a wonderful survival game probably the best out there.The building mechanics the looting and the procedual worlds are indeed something that no other survival game has achieved.But then you get to the bad part the community.Well all games have a bad side of their communities right? I mean look at League Fortnite and all that stuff.the thing is you're playing a surival game and if you're playing alone oh dear i'm really sad for you.You will die and die and die and die and die. there is no limits. No matter if you're carrying a damn rock completely naked hitting a three YOU WILL GET SHOT IN SIGHT IF NOT BY ONE BUT BY GROUPS OF 3 4 5 OR EVEN KOREAN ZERGS OF 10.They have no use for you or your wood or your stone they WILL just kill you for fun.But hey isn't that the premise of the game? Its a pvp survival game right?It is! But the game lacks PVE aspects things that should make people get together a kind of equilibrium to make people decided if they want to cooperate or not and if they don't they would just have a hard time. Armed groups will roam the whole map with Ak's and stuff killing everyone in sight big clans will take over big part of the map and if they know where you live YOU'RE GOING DOWN.I will say it here if you're playing alone you need to be a God a literal GOD. Because you will be bombarded HARD and you WILL crumble. The game wasn't like this before today Rust is just a Zerg simulator. Not that friendship is bad or that overwhelming numbers are wrong as they are all friends they are just playing the game. But be prepared to suffer get frustrated die and lose all of your time in a matter of seconds. The game really needs some kind of punishment or "balance" for solo players this is just looking like Fallout 76 "Its fun with friends."A game shouldn't have to be like that to be playable this is wrong and the game will eventually die.

review: I've tried quite a few survival games as I love the idea but never really gotten into any of them. review: There isn't a reason on Earth not to buy this game. Exhilirating gun fights an in depth looting system and screaming into your microphone this game has something for everyone. With developers constantly adding new features every month and a community that isn't only stable but thriving you can be sure this will not be a regretable decision. I have so many fond memories of playing with friends on this game. Some of my best friends to this day I met on Rust. This game has countless possibilites endless fun and will live longer than an anti vaccination parent's kid. I definitely reccomend this game to everyone. There is some nudity but that can be censored in the settings menu. Pretty much the only good multiplayer survival game on Steam right now. Enjoy!

review: I don't know where to start with this game. There are many things that make it so unique and fun but there are a few that get frustrating. Before I start with pros and cons don't buy this game if you don't have a lot of time. This game is extremely time consuming. There are so many things that you'll need to grind for. Your going to end up getting raided and having to grind back everything you had before. This game is not for people who give up easily either. You are going to get killed over and over again by someone who's better that you or just has better gear than you do. It's inevitable. But you have to keep going if you want to have fun. Just hit that respawn button over and over again until you are able to get a start. There's also something called a zerg. They are basically a group of 10+ people who kill anything that moves and are nearly impossible to beat because of their sheer numbers. A good thing about this game is the graphics. They are absolutly beautiful if you can run them. It not opitmized very well but it has gotten better. I'd recommend this game to anyone who is looking for a rewarding and fun open world FPS that doesn't mind doing some farming.

review: The 2 Beautiful Cycles of Rust!!1. Good Great Wipe Day Progress Get Satchels + Beancan Deal With Ridiculously Long Crafting Times Die A Couple Times Kill A Couple People Deal With Ridiculously Long Crafting Times Raid The People Around You Save Up For Bigger Raids Make A Compound Deal With Ridiculously Long Crafting Times10% Last Whole Wipe vs. 90% Offline Raided2. Bad Little To No Wipe Day Progress Can't Find The Satchel + Beancan For Your Life Get Some Bad Teir 1 Guns Deal With Ridiculously Long Crafting Times Die A Lot Of Times Kill A Few Nakeds Deal With Ridiculously Long Crafting Times Get Your Empty Base Raided Finally Find Beancan + Satchel Make A 2x2 Deal With Ridiculously Long Crafting Times Kill A Semi Geared Guy With A DB... Die Running Back Home100% Get Off Until Next WipeBoth Scenarios are still an amazing experience!! Although it is known for it's toxic community I think it actually adds to the environment of the game and sets it apart from the rest! HELK is doing an amazing job on the monthly updates bringing in more and more content every time! 10/10 This Should Be A Buy For Every Survival Game Enthusiast!!($35 Is A Bit Pricey!! Wait For A Sale And You Can Grab It For $17 or Less)

review: First off. I want to make clear this is MY opinion of why i do not recommend to new players.I love rust don t get me wrong with nearly 1k hours over a few accounts.At the current state of rust would not recommend rust because of the simple reason of Zergs and weapon balance. With the AK having learnable recoil you come across people using recoil scripts on the regular. The M249 being uncraftable you would think its balanced right?? Wrong with it dealing 65 damage so you can mow down anything under a Coffee can and having learnable recoil... A hackers wet dream. The bolt is beyond rare and is only used by Zergs having a base the size of a small castle. The MP5 is also terrible and are underpowered and tends to be out DPS'd by AK's or a SAR. Now to Performance My specs are Cpu i7 4790K OC 4.6GHz (H80i)Gpu EVGA 980ti Hybrid SC x2 Ram Corsair Vengeance 16GB With my specs this game runs like A S S with potato mode and gibs turned to the lowest i get around 30 70 depending on the server. Now this problem isnt strictly Rust s fault its more of the servers you decide to play on. Modded servers are the worse with multiplied gathering there are more bases and structures hence the lower fps.In conclusion if you don t have a group of friends to play with and don t mind the current meta and balancing get Rust it s one of the most enjoyable and well developed Survival game out there with regular monthly updates there is always new content to comeback too. But Rust will always be riddled with Zergs specially in Offical.LAPD For lyfe

review: Worth the buy if you like to respawn a lot lose everything you spent hours worth to farm for or if you're sadistic and like doing the taking. There are a multitood of classes to pick from in this game The Bot Terrible at building Terrible at farming can't aim the gun for his life and never gets 20 feet away from the baseThe Farming Bot Not too bad at the game but relies on clan mates for protection but can farm materials quicker than you canThe Builder Can build a hecka beefy base design that's either good at defending while online or is terrible for defending online but good at confusing offliners.The PvPr Mostly older people who only play rust in their spare time and doesn't need clan mates but could use them to distract other people. The Zerg This is a mutiple people class and (usually) are really bad at the game or extremely good. Raids occur day one.The Chad An all around Rust player can lazer beam you at 200m with an AK roams with Incendinary Rounds and mutiple clan mates that either have m249s ir l 96s + aks.The Sweaters These people try hard at everything they do usually raid the second or third day with tons of rockets. Will yell at you if you mess up.The Joker Typically a solo player doesn't take wipes super seriously will play for real on some occasions these are usually really good players that can make plays or really bad players that act this way to hide their lack of skill.The Roof Camper Perhaps an annoying asset to the game espically in a fight but shoot at you from the comfort of their base to prevent their items from being lost. They claim they can shoot from anywhere in the game.Pick it or not this game will eat all of your time if you let it.

review: You never win you just do a little better each timeThis game made me ragequit several times. You spawn get killed. Respawn and maybe craft something. Get killed. You finally get a grasp of what you can craft and build and you'll get killed building your first base. You're smart so you're gonna farm rescources and then immideiatly build a fortified base. You get killed farming. This game is all about having your short life exterminated as unexpected and inconvenient as possible. You get killed just for the fun of it. You might be swimming in water and your foe has no possible way of getting to your loot they'll still shoot you on sight just for sh*ts and giggles. Watch a lot of youtube in advance so you enter the game with some knowledge of how to play. Don't trust anyone. Build a lot of bases because they will get raided when you're offline. The bigger the base the sooner the raid so stay small. I recommend this game but beware In order to not be the bottom feeder you'll have to grind 12 hours a day!

review: One of the best games i've played in my life this game keeps your busy for days on end. With the gradual progression system in the form of blueprints there's always something to work for and one of my favourite things about rust are the monthly wipes. It's like a monthly christmas where I get to hop on my favourite game with a few of my friends and feel like i've just bought the game.This game also teaches you to be untrusting and relentless since most of the time you have days worth of grinding to be lost within an instant and anyone can take that away from you.All in all a really intense survival game with some fun pve elements. Would recommend 9/10
title: Rust

review: I've been playing Rust since the legacy days and I have a love hate relationship with it. On the one hand You don't get the hardcore survival experience anywhere else. Everything is always on the line confrontation is always just around the corner the game doesn't like to help you and everyone is out to kill you. It has an awesome atmosphere and combat really makes you feel alive You don't respawn close to your killer you don't respawn with any loot. In every gunfight your entire inventory is on the line. Which really helps with ramping up your stress levels. Don't play this game if you hate losing. Because you will lose. Often.But that also makes winning more satisfying. Winning big gunfights and demolishing an entire enemy base is very satisfying and can feel amazingly rewarding. On to the cons Mining and gathering resources can be a chore and sometimes you just want to get some loot up without getting shot by some dude with an AK. Getting raided can be incredibly Also the game has a bad code. The content's awesome but at even the highest framerates the game feels choppy. It's because of bad code they haven't replaced for years. The lighting system is so good and so bad at the same time.... At night campfires look absolutely amazing. Natural lighting or electrical lighting at night looks so god damn good. But without light it's borderline impossible to see anything and the lighting during sunrise/sunset looks very ugly. They changed the lighting system to stop people abusing the "increase gamma" exploit which would allow players to up their gamma to be able to see more at night Which is understandable! It's literally impossible to see anything at night especially if you're above someone. Every shape or landscape just turns black. It's quite annoying considering midnight gunfights and raids seem like the most awesome thing ever but in realism they're extremely difficult cause you can't even see what you're shooting.Anyhow this is why I love and hate the game. I'll continue to play it on and off probably until it dies it holds a special place in my heart. Would certainly recommend trying if it appeals to you.
title: Rust
