review: I used to play this game a lot. That was until they ruined it. The current progression system is ridiculously unbalanced compared to previous ones and the devs don't even acknowledge it and keep adding irrelevant stuff to the game. I'd even prefer the XP system over the current one. At least back then no one had AKs on the 1st day of wipe.Another thing that the devs managed to ruin was the gunplay. It used to be nice and balanced quite skill based where someone skilled enough could take on someone with better gear due to their superior skill. These days this rarely happens because the easier to get move primitive weapons have been nerfed to the grave. Crossbow headshots that used to be able to oneshot a player with a metal facemask if hit in the correct spot now struggle to do 40 damage. The team UI update was another nail on the coffin and has sealed the deal for me.Without significant changes to the progression system I most likely will never play this game again and can't recommend that anyone else should either. It's simply too unbalanced and unfun in its current state. It's a shame really considering how great the game once used to be and how much potential it used to have.3/10

review: 2014 10/10Rust is the best survival game I've ever played. I've already played Infestation Day Z SA for some hours. But I can assure that the experience of this game is the best of all. I can say also that Infestation is garbage and Day Z SA needs lots of improvements. Also the graphics of this game are awesome and they're even running very well on my Nvidia Geforce 9800 GT(AND IT IS ON ALPHA TESTING). I've watched Nether and I didn't like the gameplays of that game but nether has other logic(and as I said I didn't like it).So in my opinion RUST is the best optionGood Simple and complex system of crafting. Beautiful graphics. No lags. There are not many bugs Very good gaming experience. Hardcore SurvivalBad Some minor fixes should be made. Some things should be added to this game(like the option to destroy our buildings).2018 The game is awesome and keeps getting updates however it takes a lot of time to load even if you have an SSD. Also I get framedrops even with good pc specs and with settings lowered.
title: Rust

review: The game itself is fun and the server admins I've interacted with have been really nice. I personally loved grinding for materials and building up bases with my friends. Building and gathering is what got me hooked on Rust but other random players is ultimately what made me stop playing. Even on "noob friendly" servers I was getting raided almost daily and if I didn't log on for a day or two my base would have a wall or doors blown out and all my hard work would go to waste. On normal servers people immediately kill on sight even if you're naked with no supplies. People will also camp bases and make it their mission to murder you as many times as possible and take all your stuff even if it's just a rock. One time my friend was wrongly accused of raiding someone's small starter house and they mercilessly killed her and then me as well. Other players' toxicity and general want to kill everyone in sight really put me off. Overall Rust is fun but just be ready to have your heart and soul absolutely crushed when some bloodthirsty vindictive monster comes along and takes and destroys everything you worked days for. Don't get attached to any of your items or buildings.

review: Rust is very unforgiving and especially difficult when you first start. But if you find a good server and play with a group you will get endless hours of enjoyment out of this game. So be aware you will have to put some time into this game to keep up with others on the server. However you will likely find that Rust holds your attention with the building raiding social (or toxic) and sandbox elements that keep this game exciting.

review: The curve of this game is so steep that in order for you to have an understanding of what you're getting into when you start playing you need to either experience constant failures or have an experienced player who is willing to teach you thousands of things.This game could be good but it is definitely not good. After a 10 minut eloading screen with no sense of when you're about to actually load in lag often occurs every time anything serious happens making even the hardware curve way too steep for an enjoyable experience.Just yesterday my game forcibly closed 10 15 times in about a 4 hour window of time. Sometimes the game would freeze while I am simply replying to another player in the in game chat other times it freezes when I have 1000 scrap on me and im crossing a very exposed river causing me to get raided due to disconnect.My video settings are on potato and I have everything turned off (EVERYTHING) and have everything turned to to 50% that can be. The only thing I didn't change was the draw distance because I assume (the game doesn't tell you of course) that that would affect how far I see other players which I left alone.With potato quality and everything on the lowest settings possible I can't understand why my game closes so often that I now expect it to close 2 3 times per hour of actual game play.Seriously beyond the toxicity and near impossible defense against zergs and random trolls that are literally destroying your game this game simply doesn't hold up like any other game like it.I have never seen graphics become such an issue.What a shame I wasted my money and time playing this game. This game should go back in development until you stop seeing 20 recent complaints per day about how this game doesn't play on peoples' computers short of a beefed up Alienware.UPDATE DEC. 7 2018 Decided to get back into Rust because after a reinstall it was working better.Played for 6 hours until I got disconnected due ot the Dec. 7 update. After restarting my PC the game no longer works. I can't load into a server. I have tried 3 modded servers 2 official servers and even the Intoxicated battleground one. NONE will let me load in. The game freezes before I can wake up.How did the game go from being to not being able to load at all? Seriously they got my money. And this is what I get? You ruin the game I paid for months after the fact? How is that even legal? I was literally just playing it before you forceably updated it to a non working condition. t and no refund is to be expected. They can just ruin the game and make it unopenable.I contacted support for help about this and they sent only one email one day later saying to verify the game files. That's all they told me. So of course I had already done that and re installed Rust and reinstalled Steam nothing. Sent them 3 update emails to my ticket and it has been 5 days now no reply.I guess Facepunch just chooses when they feel like helping certain owners of Rust and when they decide some you should just sit at home wishing you could play your game but cant. Is this part of the games' challenging meta?Unacceptable.

review: Now a few sweat nerds may say i don't have an opinion cuz I don't have 30 000 hours on the game and im no zuckles or hjune. But then that would pretty much mean half the people who play this game don't have an opinion which is kind of sh!t. Some of the best pvp i've ever experienced in a game due to its fast pace and now all I do is play combat tags. But I think everyone can agree that some kind of nerf needs to happen on zergs and clans I even have a few ideas one what to do about the problem like 1. Upkeep depened on how many sleeping bags are in that base and the size of the base This will force zergs to have more than one base and reward people who do not play in outrageous numbers I think if there are more than 3 5 bags in a base the upkeep should increase.2. Make the green dots above teamates invisible until you hover your mouse over them for 2 seconds This will reward good zergs for comunication and will punnish the unorganized zergs with the two seconds Thoose are the only two I can think of right now but comment some more suggestions below Anouther thing that needs to happen is that scrap costs should be lowered. The reason why they're so high is to stop big clans from getting everything day one and to have a sense of progression but since their so high all it's doing is encourging claning and punish small groups of 2 or 3 for not having 8 people grinding for scrap and lets be honest clans are still going to get everything on day 1 or 2 so you might as well just help the smaller groups and lowering it just by a little (like the revolver to 50 scrap semi rifle to 200 or 175 and the Assault rifle down to 650 or 550 scrap) Then optimization should be a bit better (and no my pc isn't . My pc has the reccomended specs on the store page but still gets lag on official servers like rustafied long two weeks into wipe. But after that I think rust is a really good game and most of the problems are somewhat easy to fix I think. If you are planning on purchasing this game do it on a good sale (40% off).

review: First of all Rusts community is possibly the worst community you have ever seen in any game. Even regarding that it is a PvP survival game. There is like not a single friendly player which i don't expect to be honest but would be a nice thing to see. I think people are confused and think that Rust is a Battle Royale you'll often see fresh spawns killing each other for literally the sake of the kill and nothing else.Nevertheless Rust is a well made game. The community surely isn't the fault of the developer and i like the quiet times in the game when you're just farming with you friend as well as the casual reasonable fights between me and another player. Rust would be a seriously nice game to play if it wasn't for this community.I think Rust doesn't deserve a thumbs down for the community because it really is a good game. Thumbs up to the developers but thumbs down to everyone who has this game. And yes even thumbs down to myself and my friends. The toxicity is infectious and since everyone is doing it we also started to kill every single living being on a server. In the end buy it or do not. Just keep in the community in mind. It's not that there is this one player on the server who always trolls you the whole server trolls itself.Final rating 7 out of 10

review: А теперь разберём по полочкам стоит ли вам покупать данную пародию на DayZ или нет?ПлюсыРазработчики поддерживают связь с игроками. Есть немного атмосферы Хорошая графика(может быть минусом) Интересно играть МинусыСкины Обновления стали 1 раз в месяц вместо одного раза в неделю. Хорошая графика (нужен мощный комп когда на серваке слишком много домов и они гниют.) Есть читерыВыживает тот кто раньше зайдёт и набьёт ресов.(тк как Топ лутеры мешают кепкам выживать)Можно играть только после фулл вайпа с рецептами.(Сразу Топ лут зарейдят)На модифицированных серверах есть донатеры. Цена теперь вместо 419 рублей 619 рубНету Rust LegacyЧто же это такое Rust LegacyЭто совсем другой раст который зародился в 2013 году как браузерная игра.Вскоре появившись в стиме набрала популярность.Это игра где я прочувствовал атмосферу постапокалипсиса и нашёл друзей.Rust Legacy 9.5/10Rust Experimental 7.5/10New Rust 6/10 Вывод Играть можно если вы не играли в подобные игры.

review: Honestly the best PvP survival game on the market currently. It's PURE PvP and survival and nothing else. You start with nothing and try to get the best gear you can by whatever means possible.This game will make you feel every single emotion except love. There is no love or trust in Rust. There is anger surpise happiness boredom anticipation fear etc. And you can experience all of this within mere minutes. You're going to build up a sweet base in a great location and get your chests full of good items then you're going to lose it all and you have to be okay with that or else you're going to hate this game. You're going to have to start over and over again and everytime you get more anxious. But when you finally get in a position to pull of a sweet play and kill someone with loot it's a wonderful feeling and you'll want more and more of it. You can't be scared in this game or else you'll have a bad time. You have to walk around with your in your hand and a spear in the other ready to ruin someone elses day. The memorys you'll make on this game will be some of the best when it comes to video games this game feels raw as hell in the best way possible.

review: Have you ever wanted to experience disappointment after disappointment? Have you ever wanted to play for a day then wake up the next morning to find all your progress gone so you can do the same thing over again only to loose it all again? Have you ever wanted to meet toxic people? If you answered yes to any of those questions rust might just be the game for you. Yes at times rust can be fun and occasionally you may meet someone who seems to not be totaly toxic they may be a nice person but more times than not prepare to get killed on sight or offline raided by your new "friends"People will offer to help new players and give them free stuff now by all means accept the help take the free stuff but don't put no trust in strangers and never bring someone to your base no matter how helpful they are they will raid you the moment you log off or go afk. Rust can be less of a survival game and more of a home invasion simulator at times.

review: Rust..It's the simple uncouth joy of doing bad things to other human beings but Rust has a distinctly regressive effect on the human species. The voice chat merges with the draw distance so when you're spotted by an idiot you'll start hearing the talk quietly tickling your ear. They get closer they get louder and more confident and suddenly you're hopping over shotgun blasts while absorbing an entire dictionary of insults. The auditory experience is both fantastic and haunting. They have made changes to make it somewhat not so stale from the birth of the game. It is both frustrating and rewarding. Rick reward is very much alive in this game. Either you love it or hate it.

review: TL DR Don't buy it it's a toxic pile of trash that's a marathon of death upon mild success.Rust is a huge crock of trash. Unless you have a dedicated server a dead server or sheer luck Rust will not be a fun experience for you. You will be killed on sight by anyone no one is willing to help you 99% of the players are toxic as hell and the gameplay bone dry. Besides the giant performance issues the Unity engine brings forth and also the downright unusable mess of the chat system there's little joy in running for your life for 15 minutes trying to gather the minimum supplies to create a pickaxe or hatches. By the time your naked body is covered in maybe some gloves or something for your feet you'll be dead. Or at the very least starving. Or being shot at... Or being set ablaze... Lets not forget that if you're a beginner with no idea what to do you'll be given no help by fellow players and they'll just taunt you with such things as "I love killing nakeds" and "If I see you I'll kill you for 1 scrap". This game is a huge pile of trash a game somehow even worse than the DayZ standalone or even terrible Steam Greenlight survival games.

review: My friends and I begin a raid plan.We construct a raid tower to overlook a guy's base.Two people overwatch.Three to try to parkour inside the base.I am the only one that gets into the wall.Friends die trying to get in.They're forced to abandon me.Find a safe isolated corner.I jump into it.Find out it is impossible to get out once you're in there.Call for help screaming on mic to the defenders to get me out.I bang on the walls with my bone clubs.They send naked men with machetes to take me down.I kill one of them with my trusty waterpipe shotgun.Out of ammo take machete.Continue to kill 3 more nakeds with the machete.One of the defenders become disarmed and wounded.I help him up.We're both stuck in slave pit.I compliment his body features (especially the lower body)We become buddies.Ends up glitching up the wall and boosting him up to allow him to leave.I hear a fall followed by screams he dies from wooden spike traps.Rust in Peace Vengeance."BIG DADDY DAN" comes along and gives me food clothes and resources through a tiny crack in the pit.We become best buddies.He dies to an AK from the defenders.Rust in Peace Daniel.Spend an hour sitting there playing the guitar.Friend comes along to boost me out.True "Saving Private Ryan" moment.Run free to the north like a black slave in the 1800's.10/10 game would tell my tale of escaping slavery to grandchildren.TL DR Went raiding got stuck inside base forced to kill to survive made buddies that died boosted out to tell tale.

review: TBH writing a review for the STEAM AWARDS BADGE but the game is truly good.Gameplay is awesome.You get good ant somewhat realistic feeling PVP gunplay there's also base building farming ant etc. but mostly your gonna be fighting. The other elements revolve around fighting in some way so don t expect much besides PVP and raiding/getting raided.Community.There are some hackers but they ussualy get banned pretty quick.Community as a whole is mostly toxic but that's to be expected from a PVP game don't you think?THE DEVSDevs are active. A roadmap montly updates if needed quick patches. Lot's of devs from survival games lack that these days. But in rust FACEPUNCH is very active and they don't look like they are planning to abandon rust in any time soon. They fixed most of the issues from legacy alpha beta and every month add something new to keep the game alive.So if Fallout 76 left you dissapointed give this game a try.

review: This game is everything I expected it to be. Challenging exciting frustrating fun and strategic all rolled into one. I joined and started playing this game a few days on the Rustopia US Main after it did its weekly wipe. Don't expect to progress very far since most of the player base is established already with prime locations and etc. Also be prepared to die...A LOT. There is a lot of grieving and toxicity so if you get your feelings hurt easy then this isn't the game for you and you should move on to something less...evil. The one thing I did see is immediate bans for homophobic and racist comments...that alone is a huge improvement. I applaud that. They receive bad marks for allowing anyone under 18 in the game though. There are many underage members. The graphics and sound is very nice. For being a DayZ clone these guys did a bang up outstanding job. The only thing that I would probably be critical of is not letting new players understand what exactly they are getting into. It would also be nice for them to open up a newbie server that focuses more on game mechanics and understanding them versus just going around and cannibalizing everything and everyone for the LULZ.I hope this is helpful. I'm a friendly in game if you see me feel free to join my little community. )

review: I wrote a review back in 2017 on my main account. But now I've got a broader understanding of this game and I've played offical for enough now. So here is my 2018 review on rust.The game is super fun even after having nothing and starting over again with a rock in hand. But it's as toxic as it's ever been. And not gonna lie i'm really toxic as well. But I think one of the biggest problems in this game with offical servers. Is asians and hackers. Asians don't have any servers so you have them come to the Australian servers so it's really hard to communicate. And hackers are everywhere there flying around instant doming people raiding people exactly where there loot is. It's really annoying. Edit 23/12/2018I was playing on Facepunch 2 Official back in the day which was filled with Asians. I've moved on and there isn't that much once you move other offiicial servers There are still asians but not alot. Don't have a problem but it's a lot of Asians are hacking/hard to communicate with or in big zergs which makes the game a bit unfun at certian times. but if you can get past that your good. The optimization is terrible in this game and I have to play on Potato graphics with a 1050ti and a i7 to keep my frames during PvP Also has anyone noticed the decrease in frames and good animations over the years? Just a quick thing to point up But at this current state of the game I give rust a 8/10.I'm going to rewrite this review at a later date. please leave any constructive ideas in the comments that I could address in my next review.

review: I bought RUST on Steam for $19.99 CAD. It is a very fun online multiplayer game that is a lot like Fallout and Fortnite. The decisions opportunities and changes are constant and keep the game very interesting. The game takes a long time to load there is no story mode and your progress gets wiped off of the online servers when they do updates and scheduled wipes. There is a lot to get used to and a lot of time to be spent learning. I strongly recommend playing RUST on PC.

review: THIS GAME IS AMAZING. HORRIFICALLY toxic playerbase at times. Good players are gems that glow in the dark and become friends. TONS of stuff to do. You will die a lot at first but if you avoid the starting areas and congested areas you'll have a much calmer funnier time. Build up your bases tech tree Unlock new techs through research and discovered blueprints. Survive attacks on both you and your base. Explore ruins and find chests. Go scuba diving and explore sunken ships. Avoid military base tanks Fly in a balloon with fuel you crafted. Drive a boatsCons See more racial slurs than you've ever seen outside four chan. (four chan is a censored word in Steam? LMAO)Basically if you can be an adult and ignore all the toxicness and avoid congested areas you can put TONS of hours into this game and have a lot of fun. Having friends to play would be a great advantage but I've been doing solo and I've hit 32 hours in like... 4 days. I can't stop binging on this game.TIP There ARE toxic people here. This game is a "Sociopath Simulator." Everyone is cruel. BUT if you CHOOSE to take the highroad other humans WILL find you and you'll make friends. You'd be amazed how much you blow people's minds by simply not killing them and wishing them a nice day. &gt &gt Be the change you want to see in the world&lt &lt

review: rust is a unique survival game were instead of it having balenced pve and pvp it has little pve that impacts you game and makes it a heavy pvp based game that pushes the knowledge and skill of both you and the people around you. Think of it as as minecraft and csgo combined. the reason for saying minecraft as the building aspects are pretty much borrowed but instead of breaking down your base you spent 2hrs on you can simply just upgrade without breaking a simple item with in your fortress. another borrowed aspect of minecraft is the crafting but you have to find the items within a radtown/momument to make more of it and you have differenet tiers of crafting tables which are called workbenches you have a workbench level 1 (which is used to create more basic equipment) the workbench level 2 (which allows more advanced items like sub machine guns or rifes and more advanced base defences like auto turrets) the workbench level 3 (which allows the most advanced armor assult rifes sniper rifes and advanced raiding materials like c4 and rockets). the csgo aspect of rust is of course the guns every gun has a recoil pattern and spread (which can make or break you) an example of recoil (which happens to be the highest recoil in the game) is the ak https //www.youtube.com/watch?v xqXFfFjLlkw this video will so you how the ak recoil looks like other guns are much much simpler than this so if the ak is to much try its counter part the lr 300 but weapons like the lr 300 are uncraftable but can be bought (for scrap this game is not p2w)

review: I have mixed feelings for this game. I love the game but on the same time Im worried about how long time it will take and have taken to get it out of early access. It's been almost 5 years now since they started this game and it's believed to be out of early access in february 2018 even though I think it's far away from done.. Excepts from that I find it to be the best pvp survival game on pc currently there arent many survival aspects in the game but the interesting gun play and hard to master game mechanics make this a game that you will have tons of hours in. Just make sure to play with a fellow gamer or else you will have a tough time!EDIT 5 years after the game got published and 10 months since it left release on feb 2018 There are alot of things In this game that I find to be gamebreaking such as the helicopter shooting nakeds with bows (even when not being agressive). It really shows how much the devs care about the game..

review: At the time of this review I have more hours on Rust than any other game in my Steam library. Suffice it to say that I would not have put in this much time in without giving it a favorable review. That being said a lot has changed in Rust over the years most noticeably the toxic atmosphere created by kids that don't get enough attention from mommy and daddy. This is slowly eating away at the enjoyment of the game. This game is heavily focused on PvP but with the recent introduction of electricity more PvE servers have popped up and it is being compared to Minecraft. minus the blocks and editable terrain.If you like creative games but hate PvP then you will be torn with this game because the creative aspect that you can apply to building a base is great. On the other hand if you like PvP *AND* creative games then you will love Rust because not only can you be creative with your builds but you can make your builds functional too and even moreso with the electrical update.If you're new to Rust or about to purchase choose a small community server to learn on before attempting any of the official servers because the official servers are the most toxic and the constant KOS you will face will make it difficult to learn the basics.

review: After 4 years this is a *good game* but it is impossible to recommend. It's frustrating and a lot of times you'll play for hours with no results. Prepare to waste time for real here.This game is the antithesis of fun. This game is an allegory for life and the futulity of action. Much like in life in this game you will make great effort to both not die and prosper only to inevitably die of something most likely out of your hands. Sometimes you get the opportunity to ruin someone's day. Most of the time they'll be ruining yours. No one wins and everything is dust in the wind. We're all doomed to claw at one another like animals.If you can get over yourself and make friends you might have a chance.This game constantly makes progress gets updates and continues to grow. Take that as you will.

review: Great Game!Rust is a great game and although I m new to it I feel like I ve been playing forever and it s always a thrill when you snowball but always sad when you lose everything (especially when people offline) but there are 2 issues I find in the game that make the experience less pleasing 1. One of the newer guns the L96 is really Over Powered And is easy to get (bandit camp) so I think it should get either a nerf or should no longer be sold at bandit camp2. The group system is great for telling who is friendly and who is not easier but it also has friendly fire meaning that a small group can add a new member who then gains their trust and kills them for all their stuffMaybe this is just me being salty over the amount of times these two things have gotten me back to square one maybe others feel the same but I feel that (especially the first one) these issues should be dealt withThanks ArrowBoi

review: Ive played this game alot... all the way back to legacy. Its awesome... adrenaline filled and great with friends. Facepunch studios have put their heart in soul in to the game. This game keeps you thinking about it even when you aren't playing. Everything is about Rust. The only problem is the community. A summarization of the general pop of Rust above 300 hours just want to be MLG PvP gods and will one day be a Youtube/Twitch sensation... Even on small community servers where most are just looking to have good fun/competition in the world of Rust. Naked/low geared players automatically assume when they come into contact with another player that they will kill them. No talking just shoot on sight or a young boy screaming at the top of his lungs possibly doing both.The worst poeple are the ones who commit all of their free time to the this game. They are usually angry sexually frustrated or trying to live the dream of once becoming MLG Rust famous. If you kill these types of players by some chance they will usually make a threat to raid you when you go to bed. You can stay up till 4am but it doesnt matter. They having nothing outside of this game and will most likely have to start again until you or your friends quit till next mid month wipe.I dont think a talk with the community will work... its more of a cancer.Long live the old BP system and Rust 2015 to 2016.P.S. We didnt need the party system.

review: Its a hackers paradise. I got 1.3k hours on game and I have never seen so much hackers on it. Since the arrows have travel time the dont always hit but when on melee or when thet get guns or even a crossbow its a headshot festival.DONT BUY IT RIGHT KNOW !!!BUT This is a very good game. The survival aspect. The crafting/building... The struggle for suvival what's makes you build a base farm resources fortify and raid others for resources and guns. The drill of look around and never fell safe. The drill of defend what is yours and to claim what is not yet yours. It's a great game. Still on Beta but the developers are very active and keep the community informed about their work.The downside is like others FPSs games (the PVP on rust is kinda any other FPS out there) there is hacks but they are isolated cases and the hackers usually dont last long.

review: Too many hackers. Official servers have no admins to help the players. The devs ignore these issues. Very fun game with friends but the official servers are awful as far as administration goes. People will be kicked like 5 times in the hour over movement violations and are still allowed to play and possible fly hack into peoples bases.Would not recommend until Facepunch either ups their anti cheat program or provides active and useful administration to their offical servers.Gameplay is clustered and scatter brained as well balance and PvP is a mess. Devs have been trying to find something that sticks after three years. Game optimization ranges between catastrophic and acceptable. Recommended SIXTEEN GB of RAM and the game installed on an SSD.There is so much potential for a great game under all the issues. The devs constantly dream of interesting and fresh ideas but are either left on the white board or are implemented and require months of bug fixing.I do want this game to be good. I only criticize because it could be a stellar game.*** EDIT JANUARY 11 2018 ***Most of my complaints that reduced my recommendation have been resolved. Most servers official and otherwise have effective anti cheat. Game optimization has improved to the point where mid range PCs can play it comfortably. Gameplay loops haven't changed much over the years guns are still overpowered as is offline raiding. However there is a great amount of fun to be had. It is a simple pleasure to harvest resources make and protect a base and screw with random folks on the server. Would recommend. Very good with friends.

review: It may be considered a game in the genres of survival and building (I think its close to 7 Days to Die and such).You start naked only with a stone (which is your first tool to get stone wood etc.) and a torch. Nothing else. With this is you gradually try to get ressources feed yourself defend yourself and make a base. Within this base you can make research and get to better materials (eg. iron using a furnace etc.) and therefore better equipment.There are also NPCs that may make your life harder (depending on where you are on the map).This is not too bad. I have seen better games in that regards but certainly worse. It is rather intuitive and the tutorial rather easy to grasp. The graphics are pretty and on the "comic" side but in my opinion fit pretty well.You can play it solo (haven't tried that though) and with friends (hosting your own server). In my opinion this is the only way to play it. Playing it with friends might be considered fun even though it may take away (some at least) the challanges of PvP.There are community servers (non official server for public access) which may also worth taking a look.Playing on an official server (you need to play there to get the steam achievements) can only be considered toxic. It's pure PvP with no rules and absolutely no noob friendlieness at all (noob meaning here new on the server with no functioning base).It took me over 32 deaths I stopped couting after that all within 3 to 4 minutes to get TWO single achievements (getting scrap from barrels and destroying barrels. Afer each death you start over naked with no materials and somewhere else on the map (not even close).Naked me got attacked by other nakeds and by others fully equipped with automated weapons. All out of nowhere no interaction what's'o'ever. Within these few hours only ONE single player gave me an iron hatchet and left me alone.So ....if you like this kind of challenges....go for it and play on official servers. I can't recommend it. Fortunately there are other options )
title: Rust

title: Rust

review: So Rust over the years in beta suffered alot of setbacks. From deers deciding to scale mountains to run away to people building a massive tower and jumping into your base. However since full release in Feb it has greatly improved and i give the Devs credit. They fixed optimization issues dead spots in the landscape glitching characters gun lagging and everything else. The game runs so much smoother and they added tons of side events which makes you feel like you arent doing the same thing over and over again like in wave games or MM. They also routinely speak to the players about both present and future updates. Even with the price increase i would recommend this game especially to group gamers. This is such a relaxing yet vigorating game and im looking foward to future updates.

review: Rust. If you've ever played minecraft think of it like that except add on alot more murderous players explosives such as rockets and c4 and the occasional helicopter to come shoot you down if your not indoors. dont forget the animals as even a chicken can kill you. Rust is a open world type of game where you gather materials and build a base and then fight off other players to protect this base or you go destroy somebody elses base and take whats rightfully yours. Yes as some reviews say there are negatives. being(1) Hackers are lurking around corners left and right. but most of the time the modded and community servers do a good job of banning these snot nosed kids quickly.(2) As a solo player you will struggle in this game. yes your going to get raided alot. yes your going to get shot down by multiple people ranging from a 2v1 to a 6v1. but it is quite fun to be doing your own thing with nobody else to disturb you.(3) i see some people complaining about faulty admins. yes your correct these admins will most likely be abusive but also if you join a server with "ranks" on it like urusty servers in modded you'll notice the admins actually arent allowed to play the game at all they just watch players for cheating. there are several servers like this and a way to find them quickly is just looking through and seeing if they have ranks or a store or something like that.Overall if i had to rate this game 1 to 10 i would give it a solid 8.5 graphics are nice i like that you can vary the graphics in the launcher depending on your pc the voicechat is very nice to communicate with other players ( toxic or not ) And this game is special. as all servers wipe bringing you a new fresh map with new people daily which is what i personally believe is why so many people play rust and keep coming back to it week after week.

review: I made a review on this game back in april when i went on my run of making reviews for certain games I played. I am rewriting it since a lot has changed in 8 months. First this game is still one of the hardest games for new players on steam but is rewarding when your skill level gets higher and higher. I used to be hot at this game and after 300 hours i know consider myself half decent at aiming. This game is a perfect blend between realistic survival and arcadey survival. The hardest task in this game is 'soloing' or playing by yourself but i have made plenty of steam friends via this game. Overall some of the new additions like the ship and military transport helicopter that were not relavent when i did my first review are great additions. However some like the electronics and traps added very recently seem to be a needless chore like a minecraft mod. This game is fantastic and easily lands a place in the top five of my most favorite steam games of all time and if you can get it for a good price like $25 or so buy it however you will need a beefy computer to run the game fair warning. Rate 9/10 stupid ing nakeds.

review: Update 01/01/2019 This game is trash and you should avoid it as a solo player or someone who has a small group of friends as you won't stand a chance against the zergs or the hackers. Not recommended.Rust is one of those games which you either love or hate. It depends on whether or not you can blend in with one of the most toxic communities in all of gaming. People seem to misunderstand this for a cooperative survival game. This is NOT for people who are looking to be friendly and live peacefully. This is an intense PVP game thats meant to make you mad.1. A very small portion of the Rust community is friendly. This game seems to turn most of us into complete s2. You will die a lot. 90% of the people will be to you and kill you on sight even if you got nothing.3. You will get salty over losing some good loot that took you a while to collect. This will occur multiple times.4. Someone (Sometimes huge clans) will always raid your base while you're online or while you're sleeping.5. The optimization of this game is simply awful in it's current state. Make sure you play on lowest settings.My suggestions to enjoy Rust 1. FInd a friend to go duo with if you're new. Solo is usually insanely hard for new players (especially on official servers)2. Try out Low pop community servers or High rate modded servers to get a hang of the game.3. Modify and change your mindset to become a complete to everyone else to feed on their salt.4. Git gud. It takes a lot of practice and experience to build a proper base and use weapons effectively.And finally try to learn to let things go. If you die with your best rifle or a crap ton of resources don't get mad. That's what everyone else is looking for to make people rage quit. Just make an effort to farm it back and get some sweet revenge!Coming to my final verdict
title: Rust

review: Great PvP game that is very rewarding to those who have skill or put in effort to improve their skill. It is definitely an unfair game if you do not understand what's going on such as different styles of servers like solo/duo/trio and keeping up to date which days the servers wipe. You will most likely have no fun if you join mid/late week so it's important to learn wipe schedules. Playing solo is very stressful you will die a lot but it is possible to do this alone once you learn how to pvp or avoid confrontation. This game can take a lot of your time up but you can play modded servers that will speed up gameplay so you can have fun over a weekend instead of grinding for a week straight. Highly recommend this game if you love PvP. This game has a lot of negative reviews because I don't think people understand that the main goal is to kill each other and they try playing it as a survival game. Which it is but to survive against your neighbors.

review: I ve played about 200 hours on rust and I can easily say it is the best survival/crafting game I have ever played. I really enjoy the concept of spawning into a desolate wasteland having to deal with animals other players scientists and numerous other things in order to survive. I absolutely love the crafting system and base building system. I have played games that have had similar building mechanics in them but there is just something about the way rust employs these mechanics that really take the cake for me. I enjoy how you can choose numerous different servers to match your play style whether it be intense pvp or limited pvp week wipes or monthly wipes. The choice is yours and it is nice to see a game give you this decision to make. I would full recommend this game to anyone looking for a very enjoyable experience. 10/10
title: Rust

review: This game will absorb your whole life just for it's hit markers.
title: Rust

review: I've been playing rust since it came out (legacy). I have to say this is the best game I've ever played. The devs truly love the game and you can see that with their almost weekly updates for half a decade now. The game has come such a long way and is continuously getting better. I play solo which is a huge challenge but part of why I enjoy it so much. This game is not for the weak and will require that you learn A LOT before making huge progress but ultimately it is so rewarding to see your hard work come to fruition. The game also compliments people with various play styles. If you are a creative person that likes to build bases set up traps and strategically get ahead then you can do that. On the other side if you like to PVP and progress through getting other peoples loot that you kill you can do that as well. Rust truly is the closets thing to real life in a game.

Survive build get your butt kicked shake it off learn and survive longer builder smarter start kicking butt for a change and repeat! Thats what this game is all about. The steep learning curve the savagery the toxicity its all by design and those ignorant to accept the design say this game sucks. Don't believe them! The game is all about perserverance learn be smarter and either become a smart solo survivor or be a kick clan. The game is far from perfect but if you have friends or are willing to put your wits to the test then this is the game for you. Buy it on sale really worth all the hours!

review: In All Rust is a good game. There are too many little kids for a full nudity game. its really easy to become or meet a toxic player. Community Not really a community Toxic Somewhat Toxic Normal Friendly Extremely FriendlyThe community is less toxic than csgo but if you play on the right server expect to be offline raided constantly its almost impossible to play for a long time without a crew. The community is also really helpfull at times. if you need help with a certain item there will be some people who will help you find or use that certain item. Audience Kids Everyone Casual players Pro playersRust has imediate nudity the second you load into the game. I would not advice your children 13 (Under) to play this game. There are alot of guns and raiding blowing up things if you are a liberal and you want liberalism to run in your family dont let this game be purchasesd. Graphics Potato Really bad Bad OK Good Beautiful MasterpieceThe graphs are really good. at times it can look super realistic but the building mechanic can really take you out of it. other then that dont expect extra wrinkles on character model. Nothing like FarCry 5 and JC3. Price/quality Free Full price Wait for sale Average Refund it if you can Don't buy itPersonaly i would wait for a sale. the game is too much for a Build&amp Shoot Simulator. but if you have friends who are willing to play with you i would absolutly buy it at full price. MicroTransactions No Microtransactions Some Microtransactions (Not Shoved in your face) Some Microtransactions (Shoved in your face) A lot of Microtransactions (Not Shoved in your face) A lot of Microtransactions (Shoved in your face)MicroTransactions consist of clothing and asestics much like the csgo system. PC Requirments (if you want it to look decent) 90' PC (Laptops running windows Vista with CPU integrated Graphics) Minimum (any AMD Series Not to be rude. ) Medium (Geforce GTX 600 &amp 700 Series) Fast Gaming/Hobiest PC (Geforce Gtx 800 &amp 900 series) High end Gaming/Hobiest PC (1000 Series) NASA computer (2080 TI) Difficulty You just need 2 arms Easy Easy to learn / Hard to master Hard Dark SoulsThe game is mostly easy its not that difficult to get into building and understanding how the crafting system works. Game time/length Really short ( 0 2 hours) Short ( 2 8 hours) Few hours ( 8 12 hours) Long ( 12+ hours) EndlessThe game is a purely multiplayer game for Story No story Still better than Twilight Average Good FantasticThere is lore but there isnt any offical story mode or single player. Bugs Game itself is one big BUG Bugs destroying the game Lot of bugs Few Bugs No Bugs (As far as im aware)There isnt that many bugs as far as im aware but there are a few where dropped items wont appear and stuff. read more on the fourms. DLC No DLC Game needs it to be fun Unneeded Nothing special A fun addition lots of fun Modification Support No Modification Support Steam Workshop Unofficial Modding SystemMuch like csgo you can submit your own items to be added ingame Multi/Single Player Multiplayer Singleplayer What I Recomend A singleplayer mode with an offical story and lore. I am a steam curator. Join my group.

review: I was banned from this game all the way back when only Legacy existed. Now im not hear to make a case or statement outright i blatantly cheated. I did however purchase the game on a different account and have been enjoying it ever since. More now than ever does Rust give a unique feeling when playing. The loot you carry actually has value to you mostly in the form of time and losing or gaining loot is either a huge crash or a pumping surge of adrenaline. Nothing feels better than raiding a base for a case full of weapons and explosives. Rust isnt without its flaws obviously the community is extremely toxic and it can feel disheartening for new players or small groups when a 10 man zerg marches over their base. With this in mind though there are still many positives to the game. Rust has an active dev team that is fully committed to the game and ships monthly updates that can change the landscape of how the game is played and while a good majority of Rust's player base is toxic there are a few individuals who you may make a connection with and then who knows!Side note Thank you to all the devs who have put in the effort to make the game what it is today and thank you for all of your hard work it does not go unappreciated. Much love to daddy Helk keep being a meme!
title: Rust

review: Yes I waited over 1600 hours over the course of four years to write a review.Rust is the best game if you're not faint of heart and enjoy high risk high reward gameplay. Rust does not hold your hand but gives you the tools to pretty much do anything you want. With enough charisma you can create whole communities of strangers set up shops and sell items for the materials you need to maintain your base. If you and your friends are good at PvP you can roam the map and hardly farm anything at all. If you're sneaky (and you'll have to be) you can run solo around the map and into monuments which is some of the riskiest and most thrilling gameplay.You will die a lot. You will get extremely frustrated. Morale will get very low. The eventual big victory is totally worth it whether you successfully defend your base from a raid defeat another group of players in the wild drive another hostile group out of the area or even put up a damn good fight as an underdog in a losing battle.The devs are some of the most active I've seen for a survival game. New content is pushed out regularly and it works as intended most of the time. Whatever small bugs exist are quickly fixed. They also do not compromise on their vision of the game. There are plenty of people (carebears) who have pushed them to make it more forgiving but they haven't budged very much in this regard. They know the game they're making and the niche it fills.Get the game. Git gud. Bring your friends. Make some friends. Take over the map.

review: If you're looking for a game review you've come to the wrong place. But if youre looking for a fantastic pancakes recipe you've come to the right place.MAKES12 thin pancakes (18 20cm each)INGREDIENTS125g plain flour1 egg and 1 yolk300ml milkMETHODSift 125g plain flour into a bowl and make a well in the middle. Whisk together one egg one egg yolk and a little milk taken from the 300ml then pour into the well. Whisk with a little of the flour.Gradually whisk in half of the remaining milk drawing in the rest of the flour a little at a time to make a smooth batter. Stir in the remaining milk. Cover and leave to stand for about 30 minutes.Heat the frying pan and brush with a little oil.Ladle two or three tablespoons of batter into the pan and tilt the pan so that the batter spreads out evenly over the bottom.Cook the pancake over a medium high heat for 45 60 seconds until small holes appear on the surface the underside is lightly browned and the edge has started to curl. Loosen the pancake and turn it over by tossing or flipping it with a palette knife. Cook the other side for about 30 seconds until golden. Slide the pancake out of the pan.Heat and lightly grease the pan again before making the next pancake. Serve the pancakes as they are made or stack them on a plate and reheat before serving. (If the pancakes are hot when you stack them they will not stick together there is no need to interleave them with greaseproof paper.)Total time40 minutes

Any group with people 6+ will be set in their wipe in rust.Cons Clans in this game that are 8+ will dominate the server but is able to be tackled by offilining or allying with another group to take down a common enemy.Conclusion This game requires a lot of time to be played since you need to materials to build up your base and aquire new guns aswell as researching them which takes quite a bit of time to do. Being very good in pvp in this game is crucial and you will not get away with not being able to left click on poeple. Consider this game to be a 2nd job working 6 12 pm in a sense that if you dont spend enough time into the game you wont get anywhere. THE GAME IS GREAT !!!!!

review: okay after 2800h played and more to come can i safely say that i ADDORE this game. It is a post apocalyptic survival PvP game that really tests your limits. Spawn on the beach get beaten down by naked people who swing their around to mock you. Esacape the evil circle and make it to the woods start gathering wood and basic supplies like mushrooms and hemp cloth. Craft yourself an hatchet and a pickaxe and start your resource gathering build a shack stash your make a bow and go PvP you're most probably going to die but if you make it congrats your hunt was succesful. Keep stashing your and make a decent base go loot in the closest rad townand find something of value run back to base in hopes of getting there unnoticed and stash your new (better) After many hours doing this you are going to be shocked how time consuming this game is and for what? Wake up next day do whatever you do when you wake up log in on steam eneter rust find your server. to spawn in with the text "you got killed by _ZERG_KOREA_10_MAN_CLAN. now repeat.okay for real this game is amazing however if you have no friends that play this game it is going to be very difficult for you. So keep in mind that soloing in rust is for experienced players if even them. I with 3k hours can have a hard time soloing. One last thing the PVP in this game called Rust is very unnusual please train on some battlfield servers before you actually start playng. hope this review was helpful to the new players and for us experienced ones i hope you agree with me. D

review: I asked for a refund after 3 hours of play time because when i joined a large map my fps was horrible. I shouldn't have to own a half working game. Steam sent bot automated message of refusal twice. I'm pretty sure it was bots anyway. I refuse to believe steams customer service is so bad that they'd refuse someone with one extra hour of play time.Anyway I'm somewhat glad they didn't because once i decided I was stuck with it. I tried to make it better and looked up some video's on how to improve fps in rust and I picked up a few tricks that I didn't know. The biggest of which being the ''Global.free'' command which I believe boosted my fps by about 40 50 and removed most of the stuttering. So now rust is fully playable for me. I guess I'm just making kind of a warning before you purchase make sure you have the specs to run it. Because the que times and the loading screen and the fact you have to change the res outside of the game will most likely put you over the 2 hour limit.REVIEW The first time I spawned into rust ever I was chased by a wolf and there were no platforms to jump on. First death in about 15 seconds of playing the game. That set the curve right away. I laughed. Really hard. If you laughed to this is a game you will enjoy.

review: I do reccommend this game since you will get plenty of play time out of it for the price but there are some things i'd like to add some reasons why i've started playing this game less and less lately. First the good. So the game is definitely worth the price which basically comes from the game's awesome building features and high anxiety combat. At all times in this game you have to be constantly alert and ready to fight because you have to fight for your hard earned loot and resources with other players. It's both good and bad super rewarding to win a fight/raid or completely devastating to lose it all (especially back to back). The other good parts of this game are the updates which are constantly being added with the most recent being electricity and water based updates involving boats and ships. These updates will keep things new and interesting and let you experiment and explore more new locations all the time. However I think there a few fundamental issues with the way the game runs as a whole basically involving balancing. Playing solo is very much possible in this game which is what i've done for nearly all the hours I have in game but it is the most frustrating way to play (on vanilla) since you are always outnumbered always outgunned almost always on the receiving end of a sneak attack/gank or always the target of raids since you can't afford the upkeep for a good base or don't have allies to defend while you're offline. This is essentially what burnt me out on this game restarting every few days or weeks because I was raided by a 2 man 3 man or entire clan. I have tried team play but it feels like a cheap and easy way out and i've always liked a challenging game instead of having everything handed to me. With a group it just feels like you can steamroll anyone in your region and it gets boring once you max out your upkeep and have every blueprint/gun and there isn't much else to do but kill people. It is a fun game overall but it just gets to the point where restarting over and over burns you out. If I come back it might be to try out the new updates but until then i've moved on to more singleplayer oriented survival games like 7 Days to Die or The Forest. I think part of this is my personal preference since I don't really like PVP in general but if you're someone who does and likes a tough skill based game this is for you 100%.
title: Rust

review: I love Rust. I have been playing this game before it was even good. I have so many amazing memories on this game and nothing made me want to stop playing. But the devs. added a new function. The Decay system was added and its actually a really amazing idea it makes idle players bases decay away if they don't get on reducing lag. and it also made players/clans not able to create huge bases because the tax on your base is relative to the size of your base. This is a great idea and system but it doesn't clash well with the other systems in the game. finding blueprints making a base and getting components are WAYYYYY too much to do. This game doesn't feel like a game and it more feels like a JOB. It's actually frustrating because I have to get blueprints for stuff find the stuff to make the stuff I know. and then gather resources for the daily tax on my base. The devs either need to get rid of the decay system (which I don't personally want) or the blueprint system (which I do want). I don't enjoy this game as a solo I would LOVE it if the devs. changed this stuff. But I truly don't think they will and the grind feels like a JOB. Overall I love Rust but can't recommend it because it's just too much and the devs really need to make it feel more like a game and less like a JOB.Please read the big box of text before skipping by my review I have 1400+ hours. I am someone you can believe
title: Rust

review: Rust is a game for people that have a lot of time on their hands to complete tasks or to even grind to get guns to try to kill people with go on raids or upgrade your base. Unless you are good enough to kill geared people with low tier weapons then you have to work a lot. Playing solo isn't ideal because the amount of zergs or clans that may play on your server depending on the population gets very toxic if you keep dying to more populated groups. I would say playing solo is for after understanding the game. And if you're reading this and you just purchased the game keep in mind you're going to rage a lot because people that play this game are very skilled just know that once you get better it'll get easier. Anyway one last thing if you're planning on getting rust but are still unsure I can promise you hours of fun and if you get good you'll get even more fun out of it.

review: I love this game. It has very simple mechanics that anyone can jump in and understand. But it is extremely complex in the way you can express yourself. There are endless play styles that you can explore. I tend to be a bit of a pacifist so I try to make friends with my neighbors. If that's not your cup of tea you can go around the map squashing everything you see and take everything for yourself. The players tend to be a bit toxic but if you are not as quick on the draw and willing to give diplomancy a try you can make friendships you never knew could exist before. I definetly recommend giving it a try. And if you are a friendly player like me look me up.

review: Been a longtime lurker on you tube watching the likes of Ser Winter Jordanrants Surge and a bunch of others. Never relaly thought I had it in me to compete PVP but was really drawn to the crafting building side of the game. Purchased the game just before christmas and got into it. Initially had what seemed like lag issues but it all came down to a wireless keyboard. From then on quality gaming has ensured started as a solo a couple official servers. Was getting slaughtered left right and centre some people would pretend "friendly player" then kill you at a short distance (must like the look of my stone tools). Didnt really get any building done just kept getting hammered but Ak's or groups would butcher me. Found a modded server that is local and made a start. Into my second wipe have teammed up with a master builder it seems got the mainbase set on the second day and have just been making mild alterations as we proceed. Really enjoy the duo play have had a few engagements and wow check out the bow if you can hit the headshot Oh what a great feeling. Make sure you internet connection is upto it but enjoying this game have been lucky to get on a good server with top people. Exactly what noob like myself needed. This game is totally value for money +++recommended+++

review: If you are looking into this game with relaxing and joyful gameplay in mind please look elsewhere.BUT!! If you're up for a bit of a challenge and don't mind cocky and immature people this is the game for you! This game offers planning building shooting sneaking raiding and all that fun stuff. It is very unpredictable and offers a variety of servers with different rules and possiblities. Just look around and you'll find something that will suit your taste. Playing alone can be considered to be quite rough to say the least. If you're not a highly skilled player I'd advice you to bring some friends or at least search for some in the server chat or on Reddit.This game is very stressful not to mention frustrating and if you're not careful you may find yourself enraged by one tiny mistake made by either you or your teammates. Many of the players are as mentioned above on the toxic and immature side as this game can bring out the worst in people but if you're thick skinned enough you can take it. Putting this aside I absolutely love this game. It is very fun to play with my friends and I advice you to try it out.I'd rate this game 7/10 (it would be higher if the community wouldn't be so negative).

review: Rust. What is there to say about rust that already hasn't been said? Rust is a Survival game set in what seems to be a post nuclear island that is filled with animals scientists and even other players. Players compete (or help eachother) to build up a base farm materials and eventually get great end game weapons before wipe day. Rust is a great game in my book and I love the style look feel and almost everything about the game. It always feels so great to take down The helicopter or get the chinoook crate. The PVP combat system is great giving many different weapons with many different advantages (or disadvantages depending on how you look at it) and giving each encounter to feel unique. To sum up rust is a great game and should be bought and played even for it's somewhat steep price. Love the game and almost everything about it.

review: Look I edited my review before. Most of hours are from Legacy I won't lie I have ever so hated the new direction of this game. Sure albeit that in the begginning it was nice for a change since yeah Legacy looked like a piece of junk but at least it was functional if that. I no longer see a functioning game anymore when I look at this.Yeah the graphics improved but do they run even on my high end system? No.Yeah the map seeds were improved and generate more interesting maps sure but do people refrain from squading up in a clan and camping objectives for components? No. Yeah you could say that the gunplay has improved but is it smooth? Is the bullet drop realistic? Do people no longer roof camp and headpeek like I am playing Counter Strike when my bullets emerge from my characters mouth? No. Yeah they added boats hot air balloons helicopters hell even tanks but can we pilot them? Can we make Soviet Russia the clan we always desired? Can we fuel our engines with Vodka and praise our gracious leader Stalin? No. Can we have tracer battles at night like we are immitating lazer fire in Star Wars? Or is it pitch black and holding any source of light is basically a target for roof campers like I think it is. This game is no longer something I want to be a part of. I have always loved it yes and I come back just about every interesting update to see if they actually fixed FPS optimization and added actual content but despite their convincing fan base that this game has a somehow positive reputation status on reviews despite the price INCREASING for this piece of crap I see no end no improvement the ground mistakes that plagued it at the begginning have not been cured people still run this game on potato whether it be for FPS or for the fact it enables people to be better at PVP I don't know which is worse I feel like I enter Verdun whenever I come back nothing innovative about this game at all. I most definitely recommend to stay away. Despite my hundreds of hours of farming I do not enjoy this game. Period.

review: Collect some wood and stone build a basic base. It gets dark get your torch up the torch durability runs out build a campfire to see and a sleeping bag to spawn.. The sun comes up goes out and collect some more wood and stone to make a bow and some arrows tries to find animals can't find under 30 minutes kills one chicken.. Collect some scraps metal ore sulfur ore low grade fuel. Builds a furnace burns down the sulfur and the metal ore upgrades the base to complete stone base. A plane with a carriage drops close to my house gets weapons with bullets and alot more. Runs to my house before someone else come and shoots me in the back... Russian raiders raids me with c4 and easily destroys the base takes my stuff and destroys my sleeping bag.. 6 hour of work

review: This game to me is exactly what early access should be about. For anyone who has played this game as long you will understand how far it has came since its early days. Do you want to play on a low pop server and just try to survive alone? you can do that. Do you want to join a high pop where people are being slaughtered every 2 seconds and be in consant gun fights? you can do that too. The base building is unmatched by any other survival game the constant updates from the devs who actually care about their game is refreshing the amount of user made mods that can be put into a server is amazing. review: Product received for free. Graphics Gameplay Community 8/10 7.5/10 5.5/10 Review In my opinion this game is mostly great and should be the example that other developers follow. While I have noticed that the game has slight bugs the developers are very active and always patching them. Along with bug fixes new stuff is constantly being added into the game. In my time playing the game I have come to realise that a part of the Rust community is very toxic and most people just want to ruin your day. Of course I have also met multiple people who have helped me progress through the game and get started. Rust is sometimes about exploring and the developers have done an amazing job making the natural environment look amazing. I recommend this game to people who like PvP and PvE. While you can play this game by yourself I also recommend getting a few friends and playing together it is much more fun that way!

review: The game is great. I enjoy survival games so my review might be a little biased. If you don't like PVP or survival games this is definitely not the game for you. However if you do I fully recommend this game. It has a survival system that isn't too ball breakingly hard but hard enough to where you notice it and tend to your needs. The PVP is sometimes stupid with people who camp on roofs people who just rush nakeds with AK 47s or just times when you shouldn't have died. But there are great points to PVP and that feeling you get when you get your revenge on some salty kids you just sh*t talked you. As far as PVE when going to Launch Site mind the tank. If you hear helicopter blades get inside. Don't try and kill scientists if you don't have the weapons to fight them. And boars bears and wolves are so easy to kill. The game isn't hard but you will have to put time into it. Before refunding it I recommend that you just get to know it. I assume if you put in enough time you'll learn to enjoy it.

review: Om my god what a game. Ive had my ups and downs ive had my quits my wins but this game always has me comming back. This game is not the most polished game but it so fun that it makes up for the rare glitch you encounter. Rust is a game where you really gotta sink time to get good at at one point in your rust lifetime your hyped to get a crossbow then your tired of getting m2's. This game has so much depth and so much content i think it will stand the test of time and with a active developer blog and monthly updates there is usually something new all the time. I even made an alt account just to buy this game on a account without a vacban i cant articulate how much i love this game. The pvp is deep and hard at first the fact that every gun (pretty much) you use was made by you or someone else is such a cool concept i would love there to be a "made by " description on every gun so you can see how many hands it has been in. I cant wait for the future of this game. This is the best open world survival game i have ever played. This game is so charming and i love seeing moments where someone is on the beach and a naked is throwing his rock at him screaming at the top of his lungs its so funny. I have had a wonderful 2khrs (on multiple accounts) and i cant wait to play more.

review: Played RUST in the original Alpha and after 2years without touching it i returned last night.Little break down of my 2 hour stint 1st spawn.Im running naked along the beach bashing the skulls in of the naked sleeping bodies so i can make low grade fuel for a nearby boat also collecting some hemp along the way to make some pants. After getting desired fuel i push the boat out and set off on a journey for the perfect place to call home... Along my sailing i come to what appears to be some idiots crafting gone awol as it appears to be a of tall brick walls blocking my watery path i get closer and end up having to dock my boat as i cant get round them. This is when i realise its not randomly placed structures but a carefully plotted out path to lead me straight into an ambush.Shot with a shotgun point blank range my only bit of clothing stolen left on the floor dying with my and b lls out.2nd spawn This is great i spawn right next to a compound littered with gear. oooo a shotgun with loads of ammo but whats that footsteps? nope just my paranoia getting the better of me. Jump down onto a tug boat to see if theres anymore gear worth grabbing fall into water and get stuck between jetty &amp tug boat. DROWN.Minus my so far bad luck i can say im glad i supported this game in its early development it looks to have come a long way from what it was and im looking forward to putting many new hours into this!

review: The game has been in better states in "my opinion" in terms of the progression system within the game but one thing is sure with this purchase you get your money's worth! I spent 15 on this game back when it came out and after playing it now for over 2400 hours I still play it quite often!It may have issues but for a game to be that cheap and have no ingame transactions other than minor cosmetics its a ing steal!One of my most played games of all time and even after all this time they keep updating it. Every thing from new events to minor loot changes even tho it is not as often as it used to be its still really consistent (first Thursday of every month).At times the devs of the game (FacePunch) can seem disconeccted from it's playerbase in terms of what direction the game is heading in.I have my frustrations wth the game but they do mainly come from me knowing how great the game could be and how great it has been and still is! After having played it for so long I really cant give it anything else then a 10/10 its one of my favorite games of all time but I still hope it gets better as it has it's flaws! If you are looking for a survival game dont look any further as it is currently in my opinion deffininetly the best game within its genre.

review: Product received for free. If you need a fullthrough review you may need to look for someone who spent thousands of hours in this game. If you'd expect me to go through those hours chances are it won't happen to a guy like me who enjoys a different view towards Sandbox games.Yes by definition this is a sandbox game. With the obvious generic elements of survival open world multiplayer stuff that does not hesitate to bring your first few minutes into terror comparable to your first circumcision. If by any means you are afraid of that happening towards you don't waste your money in this game.If you are willing to commit then welcome to the game that will repeatedly crush your hopes and dreams. I would compare this to Rimworld and Dwarf Fortress in terms of it's lack of mercy towards the players but that depends on which servers you'd land on the most part probably the community and official servers. If you obviously wanted to do things solo in this game then you may have to make your own server to do so.As many generic survival games follow you gather resources build your own base and commit to scavenging and developing to become one of if not the best man or woman in the server by having "cutting edge" late game hardware that will dispose anyone whether prepared or unprepared. And by no means creating a crossroads for all players whether they should commit against the unpredictability made by fellow players or toss the game to the bin and call it a day. If you are willing to commit then congratulations you are still far away from being an official masochist.Random events and NPCs generally happen and appear every tick of the clock adding to that already chaotic but vibrant mess that makes things more dangerous but as always taking the risks guarantees a reward alot worth than your grandmother's fake pairs of pearls she normally wears everyday and that's calling the chances of yourself getting something better like a rocket launcher or something worse like nothing. Including the players for that reward? The same variation who knows they might have something you need to satisfy your stats or something even better.But how did this game garnered such a mixed reputation despite a community's "very positive" review? It's a bit weird to say that the game lacks content but to put it more truthfully Rust have definitely rusted itself out pardon the pun.The players are the sole reason the game builted up it's well known standing reputation. Like things in life each individual would begin to prey over the other regardless of their intent. An unwanted achilles heel many games not wanted but nevertheless given by it's players. The unpredictability scale explodes by every player that joins in and that remarkable wanting journey to get everyone the experience they need is only defined by what other people hurl into them. Whether by a charming cuddle of friendship or by no means many's favorite approach a violent swing. The game does not lie about it's basic description and by tossing them phrases similar to that of survival isolation do whatever it takes to survive. Such oversight by players from the game's very truthful description left them doused with frustration and disappointment. But even if one were aware of the nature of this game there is no doubt about many people's answers that everything is the same with or without hardware.How the game runs is okay to say the least. It's one of the few Unity Engine games that doesn't seem to collapse the player's enjoyment in the game for most time but its notorious presence of breaking the game still persists for a few but growing numbers of players. Most would blame the community servers' contents others for reasons of the engine barely optimized or just inconsistent. The music is unneccessary and the sounds are okay as the annoying birds on the balcony. Unless Steam gets the option for players to vote between good and bad this is as far as I can go with this. If you think my review sucks you'd probably be right. But as how Rust goes it's not making it up there well to be relevant but as my experience goes it only works like charm with friends and I have to admit there's still a few more good things to do.

review: This is a great game I truly love it but it does have some issues especially for new players.Gameplay wise the game is excellent. It's easy to start but hard to master. However the only way to play this game is online and most of the community is super toxic. The chances you'll come across a friendly player or even one that won't kos (kill on sight). A giant clan can just come and grief you even if you are a naked with a thatch base. Even if you have nothing but a rock you'll get murdered and laughed at by groups of geared players. They don't care about the loot on your body half the time they won't even check it they just want you dead.The graphics are great and really easy on the eyes. However the game runs like garbage if you don't have a NASA computer. Good luck getting this thing to run on even the best of laptops so you should snag this game only if you've got a good graphics card and ram. However it does run on crappy computers but at about 5 frames a second. There are graphical settings however the graphics really don't change the frame rate unless the setting are ultra high. So this game is great but you're gonna need a good computer to run it.This game's purchasable cosmetics are pretty interesting and cool. In games like counter strike and even the free to play zombie survival game Unturned the in game cosmetics are for weapons and clothing pieces. However in Rust the cosmetics still include Weapons/Tools and Clothing but it also has some cool additions that are unique to the game furniture and building supplies such as bedrolls furnaces and even doors. In my opinion it's a really neat concept for purchasable cosmetics and I look forward to new skins and even new items that can use skins.This game is updated consistently and they're pretty interesting. The major updates can change the way players strategize the game. New tactics can be added with the newest update as of this review electricity as you can now use electricity in traps and in a clan. I believe the game's updates really shape the way the game works and goes to show how commited FacePunch is to this game.In conclusion I believe everyone should at least try this game. It's a great game in my opinion and the people you can meet in this game while rare can be friendly and you can cooperatively work to make a giant base and even recruit more people to your up and coming clan. This game is holds a spot in my heart and I would give it a 9/10.

review: Primitive chat and no dedicated official servers. The servers that are there are supposedly moderated but there is no sign of it when you require assistance. The server i played on was PVE and went to PVP without notice. They also crapped up the rate of decay. In a matter of days my town decayed and i have to start all over again. The community is overall very bad. No one helps each other they just try to raid your house over and over again. It is not allowed on my server but guess what they take no action. Maybe with some dedicated servers and some sensible decay rates this game would be fun to play. Currently though i would stay away unless you like to waste time starting over every few days. Refund!As of late summer 2018 i got banned by the game developer. I was hacked and my account stolen. While they can clearly see my account was hacked and i was not the culprit the ban still holds. This is a scandalous way of doing business innocent until proven guilty clearly is something they have not heard of. Furthermore they have stained my name with this ban and this is against the law. They need to provide proof and they have not done so. Avoid this game developer at all costs!
